title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack
description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: Iâ€™ve used Samsungâ€™s Ultra and Note series for years, so Iâ€™m very familiar with wide, boxy phones and large displays. Thatâ€™s why, when I first got the Z Fold 7, the cover screen initially felt narrow compared to what I was used to. In height itâ€™s almost the same, but the width seemed smaller. However, this feeling only lasted a few daysâ€”once I adjusted, I realized the cover display is more than enough for everyday use. In fact, itâ€™s very similar in size to the S25 Plus, and you can comfortably run any app on it. The magic happens when you unfold it. The internal display is huge, immersive, and makes you forget about missing the wider Ultra screen. You can run two apps side by side, or one above the other, almost like having two phones in one. For example, you can keep your email open on one side while chatting or receiving information on the otherâ€”copying, pasting, and multitasking without constantly switching apps. You can also watch a video on one half while replying to emails, chatting on WhatsApp, or doing other tasks on the other half. Itâ€™s an unmatched experience that no regular phone can offer. Multitasking and Apps Multitasking on the Fold is incredible. Editing photos, playing games, or browsing is simply more fun on such a large display. Most apps are optimized because Samsungâ€™s software is excellent, and social apps like Instagram, WhatsApp, and Facebook look fantastic. If you ever prefer a narrower aspect ratio, you can quickly switch any app to â€œslim modeâ€ through the multitasking options. Addressing the Hatersâ€™ Complaints Under-display camera: You can enable a black bar in apps to hide the camera area, so it never gets in the way. S Pen: While thereâ€™s no built-in S Pen slot, you can use a capacitive S Pen. By enabling â€œincreased touch sensitivityâ€ (especially if you use a tempered glass screen protector), it works very well for everyday use. Battery life: After weeks of use, I can confirm the battery lasts all day. With adaptive power saving and dark mode, Iâ€™ve managed up to 10 hours of screen time on the cover screen, and 7â€“8 hours with mixed cover and main screen use. Heavy gaming or demanding apps bring it down to 5â€“6 hours, which is still solid. To preserve long-term battery health, I recommend enabling battery protection (charging to 90â€“95%) and avoiding letting it drop below 30%. Cameras For 99% of users, the cameras are more than enough. The biggest advantage is using the high-quality rear cameras for selfies or streaming, which no standard phoneâ€”including the Ultra seriesâ€”can match. Plus, when taking photos of others, they can preview themselves on the cover screen. Photos, selfies, and videos are sharp and vibrant. While professionals may prefer the S25 Ultra for advanced photography, the Foldâ€™s versatility makes it an excellent choice for almost everyone. Final Thoughts The Z Fold 7 is an outstanding phone. Even if youâ€™re coming from an Ultra, it only takes a few days to adjust before you realize you donâ€™t miss the wider display. In fact, Ultras feel bulky and brick-like compared to the Fold, which is slimmer, more comfortable to hold, and far more versatile. The cover screen is fully usable for everyday apps, and when you want something larger, unfolding gives you a massive display that no traditional phone can match. I donâ€™t regret switching at allâ€”this is easily one of the best devices Iâ€™ve ever used, and I highly recommend it.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack
description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: This phone is worth every penny! I am upgrading from a 6 year old Samsung Galaxy (non-flagship) phone and the Z Flip 7 is the upgrade I needed! This is my first "flip" phone since my Motorola back in the 90s so this is definitely a new and exciting experience for me. I've done lots of research prior to purchasing and can confidently say I made the right choice for my first foldable! Right out the box, everything from the look and feel, to the satisfaction you get from flipping and closing the phone; the Galaxy Z Flip 7 is pure luxury! Functionality is premium and what you'd expect from a flagship Samsung device and the features seem never-ending. I've been with Samsung for most of my cellular life and couldn't be more pleased to have this unlocked beaut in my possession! If you're on the fence, take the leap and dive into the future of smartphones with the Galaxy Z Flip 7! Thanks to Amazon for providing me with the monthly pay option so I could be able to snag this gem before Christmas. Fit - Perfect in the hand, feels premium Weight - Has the right amount of heft Durability - Would recommend a case Functionality - Snappy, pleasing, and hard to put down Features - Too many to name Highly recommend this product

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack
description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: I've been a lifelong Samsung user. I've had their Galaxy Note, s2, s8, fold3 and now switched to the Flip 7. I loved the Fold3 but screen ended up not opening all the way and felt a bit heavy in the pockets. I needed something small and light. Amazon had a $200 gift card deal for flip 7 pre-orders, so that looked good to me. Once I got it, it's pretty good. Feels premium. The battery life is good. Durability is good so far. Time will tell if it holds up better than my fold3. I like using the smaller screen for games and browsing the web. It's also an easier way for me to view and change what I'm listening to rather than opening up the phone. Camera is good too. People get impressed when they see themselves on the selfie screen. I can't wait for the next version to make the outer screen like a regular smart phone instead of it currently relying on apps and widgets to be installed using big screen. Next version should also make the mini screen text friendly. I can send messages using it but it takes up the majority of the screen. Can't really see replies. One downside is that the connection drops. My mobile data symbol sometimes show a circle â­• with a line though it even when I'm in a good service area. Doesn't happen often though which is good. One of the functions I like is when I'm watching a YouTube video on the small screen, the volume up and down button get swapped, and works like it was intended. Volume down on big screen would be volume up when it's closed. I love that they thought of that. In the end, it's a great value for anyone looking for a minimal phone.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack
description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: So far, the item is great and very practical. Main display seems slightly frail, but I think it can still hold up with long term use. Bettery life seems better than expected. Durability factor will be tested more in the long term, but I got a great case for it I'm the meantime. It doesn't overheat as much under heavy use as some people said. The Exynos chipset is not slow at all and can definitely compete with other modern devices. It's no Snapdragon, but it's certainly quick and worth the money which is a pleasant surprise. The camera is totally fine. People are comparing it to the S25 Ultra camera or an iPhone pro camera when they need to compare it to a base model S25 or iPhone. It will suffice for most needs. It doesn't have ultra wideband. But that's something that most people won't notice or miss. The blue color is the absolute best and perfect. It's an eye catching color. Being able to flip to answer and end calls brings back a wonderful feeling of nostalgia from my old flip phones of 2 decades ago. Make sure you get the Samsung Care insurance with it.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack
description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: Wife absolutely loves it! I put a Spigen glass protector on the front. When folded it's so compact, fits in her back pocket with ease and in her purse it's completey protected from scratches cuz the main screen is not exposed. Also can fit in tiny accessory purses! I know the camera is not the biggest bestest badest flagship camera, but it's still a great camera (it can't do 200x zoom, but turns out my wife never even did a 50x zoom on her S22 so it was a non-issue for us). Also lots of reviews of the battery being out of step with all other phones these days, but again, for her she typically arrives at home with 50~60% battery remaining, so also a non-issue. A quick tip for protecting your inner main screen. Do not add any 3rd party screen protectors, marketers will promote them with influencers. It already has one installed from Samsung factory. If you scratch it up, you simply take it to a Samsung repair shop (like ufix) and for $20 they'll swap out the protector for a new one.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack
description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: I just love the samsung fold phone. Unfolded to use tablet mode is a game changer. Don't get me wrong the price is steep but to be able to use my phone that functions as a tablet at work really helps pass the time. I've dropped it once and no damage so the durability is good so far. However its important to nose some paint has scratched off around the charge port. The paint around that area scratched off from my trying to insert the charger so be aware of that but to me personally is not a big deal. The phone is REALLY LIGHT. It weights about the same to my apple 13 mini iphone yet is much bigger and is about the same thickness UNFOLDED. Yet once you fold it into the tablet form its thinner then the iPhone 13 mini by a substantial amount. The color accuracy is pretty good. Trust me it doesn't get any better then this. Battery life lasts around 8-10 hours but I couldn't say for sure because I always play games on my phone so obviously its gonna drain battery more quickly but I personally am satisfied with how long it last. I bought the phone while on sale for $1699 which is still steep from the $2000. I can't get over the fact it can turn into a tablet. It's hard to say if its worth its price point but all I can say is I don't regret buying it even if admittedly it did put a hole in my pocket

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack
description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: I'd say this was really close to 5 stars, but I took one off for a few things: 1). Charging speed is really not great.  2 1/2 hours to fully charge.  My iPhone 16 Pro was far faster.  The big thing is to make sure you use a 25W charging block.  Just sticking it into any ol' charging block will end up much longer, most likely.  Yesterday, I was charging at 15W using a charging block with like 8 USB ports.  I didn't realize that 4 of those ports charge at only 5W.  Two others at 12 or 15W.  And two at 20W.  Going from 12/15W to 20W chopped 30 minutes off the charge time, which was 1 1/2 hours, at that point.  The phone will only charge up to 25W.  Other phones are 45 on up. 2)  Speakers kinda suck.  My iPhone 16 Pro was much better, and it wasn't great.  But... it's not that big a deal.  I'm not listening to anything that important on my phone. 3). Getting used to an Android phone again, after 6 years of an iPhone, (had Android since Android phones first came out), is it a bit of doing, but not that bad. 4).  The crease is not completely gone, but apparently much better than the Fold 6.  I'd like to see it gone completely, bu... it's really not an issue in real world use.  You don't really see it until turn the phone and catch some glare. 4).  I hate that I lose the ability to send text messages from my Mac's iMessage app.  This is truly the only REAL negative.  The other 4 above are minor.  But... I can use a free bit of software called Blue Bubble to allow me to do this.  I haven't set it up, yet, but... with working there's nothing to not recommend this awesome piece of tech.  Truly super cool.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack
description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: The Galaxy Z Fold 7 feels like the future of smartphones in your hand. The design is sleek, with a more durable hinge and a nearly flawless 7.6-inch display when unfolded. The screen is vibrant, sharp, and perfect for multitaskingâ€”whether you're browsing, working, or gaming. Performance is lightning fast. Apps open in a flash, and running multiple apps side-by-side feels like a breeze. As for the cameras, theyâ€™re solidâ€”50MP main camera takes great photos, though it's not quite up to par with the Galaxy S series. Battery life is decent, lasting through a full day of heavy use, and the 25W fast charging is a nice touch. The software is where it shines, with One UI offering amazing features for multitaskers. I love how you can run three apps at once or use Flex Mode for hands-free use. The Z Fold 7 is definitely a premium device, so the price is steep. But if youâ€™re into cutting-edge tech and love the idea of a phone that doubles as a tablet, itâ€™s hard to beat. Pros: Gorgeous, durable screen Fast performance, great for multitasking Solid camera setup Smooth software experience Cons: Pricey Camera could be better for the price

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack
description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: The "Qi2-ready" mark would benefit from more detail.  Here are some thoughts:  The  camera lenses (with or without a case) is an uneven surface that causes built-in car Qi wireless chargers to display an obstruction error in one car and to overheat in another car. Suggestions:  Amazon offers some excellent cases with appropriate Magsafe or Qi2 magnets.  Successfully identified a phone case where the protruding camera island protective trim is partially cut away such as not to obstruct a Magsafe/Qi2 power bank.  Happily ordered a couple Qi2 power banks.  Ordered up a bunch of Magsafe/Qi2 charging adapters from Amazon to replace all the older non-magnetic Qi wireless chargers. If the phone overheats during wireless charging, try wired or maybe experiment with Google partial workaround:  setting > battery > Charging Settings > Fast Wireless Charging > off.  Wired or wireless, maybe charge on a repurposed metal cookie tin to act as a passive heat sink.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack
description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: The form factor is the best. The screen works fine. I have had four Samsung flip phones. The ability to put it in your front pocket and still sit down is great. How easy it is to hold in your hand and not drop is great. The fact that you just flip it closed and it ends your session is great. The problem is that Samsung and to some extent Android in general have such horrible flaws. With speech to text, Samsung doesn't understand the exact commands they tell you they do. New line, new paragraph, Etc. As I remember, even if you say the word comma, it types that out instead of actually putting in the punctuation. Samsung was told about this by numerous people for the last 4 years or so and they've never addressed it. The result is that almost everybody uses gboard. Theoretically gboard is not as secure. Also, even if you're using gboard as your keyboard, Samsung doesn't allow you to remove theirs. It will capitalize odd words that are sometimes used as names. It will capitalize the first letter of a first name, but not the first letter of the last name that follows. As far as the flip phone goes, check things like resolution of the screen. You'll find that even the main screen is far below normal bar phone screens and even their own s25 Plus. So it's a mixed bag. If you don't use dictation it can probably be wonderful because of the form factor and because you get a very big screen when it's open. If you use dictation, forget about it.  I am switching to another phone. If Samsung and or Android we get there act together when it comes to dictation, I would stick with it. Of course that is if they would stop lying and saying it'll be fixed in a couple of weeks or it will be fixed with the next update.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold7 Cell Phone, 512GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Photo Edits, Large Screen, Long Battery Life, 2025, US 1 Yr Manufacturer Warranty, JetBlack
description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: This is the 3rd Samsung ZFlip phones I've had.  Started with the Z flip 4, and the screen went black from the center of the fold out to the edge.  It progressed so you could see no phone, but it still worked if you knew where to poke the black screen.  Took it to the phone repair shop and they replaced all the guts on it.  This happened on month 4 of owning it.  That phone bricked at 14 months, so I bought another z flip s4.  It lasted just over a year and started running super slow,  If I swiped on the screen it was in super slow motion.  That is when I bought the z flip 7 on July 24, 2025.  I didn't even open the box until mid-August.  Now it's been a month, and the inside main screen has gone black again. It is under warantee, so it's going to the shop tomorrow.  But I will never buy another Samsung Z flip again.  I thought it was cool, and safer to not break the screen, but it has not been a good fit.  I'm in my late 60s, and don't open the dang thing a 1000 times a day.  Jeez.

description: Expand whatâ€™s possible with Galaxy Z Fold7, the foldable thatâ€™s designed to do so much more than before.
reviews: I moved from a Apple 12 Pro Max to a new Z 7. I've only had it for three days now but my first impression isn't good. I will say the reason for my purchase was for the large screen. However, at this point I'm very frustrated that ALL apps that I add from Samsung store have advertisements!!!! Apple app downloads never had adds! I'll give another review after a few weeks and see if I can find apps from another location other than Samsung. After getting used to Samsung I'm still not impressed. In my phone book there isn't a map function to see where the address is? Apple made that real easy in the address book also when adding credit cards to the wallet I had to enter all of them manually? So, maybe I'll update my review later.

reviews: As a user of the Z Flip 5 & 6, I'm impressed by the improved hardware this generation. However, I'm not impressed by a) the cover screen still behaving the way it did 2-3 years ago, and b) the camera quality. Why is the widget selection still so limited to Samsung apps? Why do I need Good Lock to launch apps? Why do I have to open the phone to view notifications in more detail even after installing good lock? Why does my face still look cloudy and washed out when using the main camera sensor? It's a shame Samsung still hasn't figured out the potential of this device. Until I can remote start my car and quickly check my Google Home devices from cover screen widgets, I don't see this phone's form factor being any more beneficial than a slab phone.

reviews: At first, it appeared to work on Mint Mobile (T-Mobile network), so I assumed everything was fine. I performed multiple factory resets, updated the phone fully, and used it normally. After a Samsung security/modem update, the phone suddenly lost service. When I tried to re-add my eSIM, the phone explicitly warned that the device is locked and activation failed. This is not a glitch â€” this is a carrier lock being enforced after updates. Yes, compatibility checkers may say this phone â€œworksâ€ on T-Mobile or Mint, but that is not the same thing as being unlocked. This phone was clearly still carrier-locked, and that only became obvious after normal use and required updates â€” something no buyer would reasonably expect. This is extremely frustrating and misleading, especially since the phone was sold specifically as unlocked. If you plan to use eSIM, an MVNO like Mint, or any carrier flexibility at all, do not trust this listing unless the seller can guarantee true factory unlock status. I am returning this device.

title: SAMSUNG Galaxy S25 Ultra Cell Phone, 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, AI Camera, Fast Processor, Long Battery Life, 2025, Titanium Black (Renewed)
description: Experience the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra, a powerhouse of innovation that redefines what a smartphone can do. reviews: I purchased this Galaxy S25 Ultra because the listing clearly said it was â€œfully unlocked.â€ After receiving the phone, it would not activate an eSIM. I ran an IMEI check and confirmed the device was actually locked to T-Mobile, not unlocked as advertised. I contacted T-Mobile directly and they confirmed only the *original owner* could unlock it, meaning this phone was not eligible for unlocking through any carrier support or service. The model number I received (SM-S938U) is a carrier model, not the factory unlocked U1 version. Because of this, the phone could not be used with my carrier at all and has to be returned. This caused a lot of unnecessary frustration and wasted time. If you need a truly unlocked device, double-check the model number before buying.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: This is a very nice phone at a reasonable price.  Usually, the "FE" designation just means the body of the phone is plastic rather than metal.  This phone works just as well as the S25 and will serve most users quite well. The 128 GB storage will hold thousands of pictures, etc. and all pictures and data can be transferred to one's computer if the memory should fill-up.  If you go to the two SIM card upgrade you will pay much more for the phone for not that much more "bang for the buck". Remember, this phone will work just fine for the MAJORITY of people who just want great calling, texting and photo abilities. The camera does a very nice job and is quite versatile.  You can do most everything you need for picture taking. One "little" problem however, you better know what you are doing if you plan to link/connect via bluetooth to your car hands-free system.  Connection takes "patience".  However, stick with it for once you do get connected the connection is very solid, clear and fast. If it would be helpful, my car is a 2024 Jeep Grand Cherokee Limited with the UConnect-5 System in it.  It took a little bit of "wrestling" to get the connection made but it will eventually got through. The phone feels very good in the hand and it does have metal banding/edges all around it.  Definitely get a screen protector and some form of body case for added safety.  The phone works just fine with a screen protector on it because you can increase touch sensitivity through the phone settings. Take your time setting this phone up.  It has a "thousand" menus and selections that make the phone very personalized for each person.  Before doing the set up I would suggest you go online and look at many of the tutorials that are offered on set up and use. The phone is completely unlocked for ANY United States Carrier.  All you may need is a new SIM card to be sure you get the company services you want. These SIM cards can be obtained at the various carrier's stores--they cost about $10.00 and the technicians will install them for you.  These phones WILL allow you to use the new eSIM card set-ups also. I would recommend purchase of this Samsung S25FE phone for certain!  It is a great buy and should give you many years of service.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: Been buying cell phones since the beginning all the way back to when they were called car phones, lol (shows my age) Once they went to texting and smart phones I have always bought budget model phones Samsung, Moto, etc.. I never really used them for more than texting and phone calls. Then came 2FA and apps for everything. I have always liked Samsung phones, I was ready for a new device and this time I decided to look at the top tier devices during the sales. NEVER APPLE or ONE PLUS so would be Pixel 10 Pro or S25 Ultra. Bought both... Usually I spent $150 -$200 and they get the job done so I was sceptical on spending $1K on a phone. The Pixel was ok, though not worth it over what I already had. Then the Samsung S25 Ultra arrived (with a free bundled set or Pro 3 Ear Buds) and all I can say is Wow! This thing is built like a tank, super quality construction. Love the material, screen OLED is amazing, camera is outstanding and the audio synced with the Pro 3 Buds is unreal. Put Spotify on and I hear thing in songs I have never heard before, the clarity and frequency response is like nothing I have ever heard before. I love Samsung because you can customize almost everything about this phone, they don't load it with bloat, and they make it easy to disable features if you don't want them, unlike some other brands. I run mine pretty lean without a lot of background stuff going and the battery charge lasts longer than any other phone I have had. I did not expect that at all. And it charges fast. Has every function I could possibly need and more is I want it. The feel is pure quality, has the durable OLED glass for protection. This thing has exceeded my expectations in every way and if you can get one, it is well worth it. IMO

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: Phone is a beast that hasn't flinched at anything I threw at it. Cameras have been great. Software is best in class, s pen is handy for quick notes. I do have some feedback for samsung though, some of these are nitpicks but I do wanna bring those up. - Camera is great for my usage but it would be great if the array of cameras was in a horizontal visor akin to the pixel -OIS on the space zoom camera. Sometimes I use my phone like binoculars when hiking and wanna snap a quick pic. Also maybe copy some ideas from apple like the camera button, the magnetic sensor shift stabilization, and square sensor. - More ram would be appreciated, 12gb is no slouch and I have no doubts it won't be a painpoint but competitors like google have it albeit with a much weaker chip. It's not that the phone isn't future proof, it's more that there could be more to be done. That being said the RAM shortage is surely gonna keep 12gb the standard for the foreseeable. future. -PLEASE KEEP THE SPEN. I don't care for bluetooth functionality but other people do. I just like it for quick notes and using it like a mouse. Honestly I wouldn't consider this phone if it didn't have it. -Silicon carbon battery? Now the battery has been able to last me a full day with the light performance profile, 1080p resolution, mostly on wifi, 6-9 hours of SoT depending what I'm doing. I do understand the US has some regulations on battery capacity and samsung might still have ptsd from the note 7, but companies like oneplus have it. Yes they do age faster then conventional batteries but even so, an aged silicon carbon battery can still have better battery than a conventional lithium ion. -I don't really play games on my phone, mostly use my steamdeck for that but I'm just gonna throw this out there... a sprititual successor to the xperia play would make me so happy. -Samsung I love oneui but please stop making duplicate apps for everything. It's a minor annoyance since you can uninstall/hide everything but come on don't be annoying. -speech to type is better on the pixel from what I've read online -maybe support the aptx adaptive and aptx hd bluetooth codecs -Bring gemini to android auto. Now I'm not a big ai user I turn off most everything except gemini and circle to search, I think it's obnoxiously implemented but google assistant is just plain stupid when using android auto. Also while on the topic of gemini, I want to be able to tell gemini "play *song* by *artist* and it not be limited to youtube music and spotify. I wanna use other services like deezer or my locally downloaded music. -front facing speakers. I appreciate the stereospeakers but how cool would it be if we had both speakers front facing? -finally please implement a "hold for me" and call tree like pixels do. I know it sounds like I'm just envying pixel software feature but that would seriously be game over. Phone trees seems to be brain numbing nowadays and hold music is a form of torture.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: With there being really no options now for a few phone or low price upgrade on any carrier this was a great deal.  Not only cheaper than if I got thru my carrier locally, but it's unlocked so I can switch off I want to.  IT ALSO CAME WITH A PROMO OF DBL STORAGE FOR FREE AND A 100 AMAZON GC!!! Why I like this phone.  LITERALLY took 5 minds to set up and transfer all my contacts and apps and set up on with my carrier. It is much lighter than my old Samsung 36. IT IS spec wise so close to the samsung s25. It is so fast with built in AI features which are fun and helpful. Overall if you are an android user this phone feels and acts like the phones that are 1200$ on up. I also like the changes.  It has great sound, great"cleaner" on the phone,  gorilla glass screen, and the fingerprint unlock feature is no longer the power button but on the screen. I learned long ago, even if you are super excited to start using the phone, be sure you charge it to 100% on the first charge.  Then go to settings, battery , and set it to never over charge.  OLD PHONE defaulted to cap at 85%, this one let's you set the top up to 95%. I used to have an electric vehicle and the batteries need to learn what 100 is but never overcharge.  This will extend the life of the phone and prevent major headaches in the future.  I keep mine on the charger overnight and playing my favorite sleep podcast- it stops at 95% and does not get hot. I am always playing audible books or podcasts and using Google maps.  The battery stays charged and by the end of the day it's around 70%. I am thankful samsung put out a good "lower priced model" than the s25 ultra. I also ran into using 99% of my storage on my old phone(128gb) I have every kind of app on here and it's only using 28% of my total storage so I highly recommend getting the 512 GB of you need lots of room. I am one of those people that keeps a phone forever and I think this one will last me a very long time.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: The S25 Ultra is a very nice upgrade, especially from my old S9 Plus, better cameras, connectivity and a much faster operating system. I thought I would miss the option of having a micro SD slot however the 256GB is actually plenty, I'm storing over several thousand images and 4K videos and still only 1/3 full. The phone dimensions are similar to most flagship models on the market but the S25 is noticeably heavy and still tough to carry in your pants pocket, can be difficult to remove depending on what your wearing and if your sitting. The phone feels stronger however I use a case to protect it, makes is easier to hold and protects it from drops. I don't use screen protectors and so far after several months of daily carrying in pockets, taking to the beach and covered in sand, and carrying around the yard while working, I still haven't noticed any scratches on the screen or camera lenses. The new AI features are helpful and can be fun, Samsung has their own AI apps and so far the drawing assist is my favorite, some of the apps work best with a pen and the one included with the phone is actually very good. I didn't think I'd ever use it and was planning to hold on buying a new phone until the next model arrives, if they offered an Ultra without a pen, but I'm glad I got this one. It's also great if your hands are dirty and you don't want to touch the screen, it doesn't have any remote options for taking pictures but still works very well for most tasks. The cameras are amazing, vibrant images and taking pictures at night actually works. It does a good job of not overexposing lights in the background and clearly capturing the subject in front. The AI clears up a lot of the ghosting effect you get when the subject moves and the phone is set to a long exposure time. I'm glad I'm finally able to capture family moments when there's insufficient lighting, missed a lot of good opportunities with the last phone. So far the phone has been perfect and I'm glad I finally upgraded.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: This is my 4th Cell phone in 6 years- android only. This phone is a workhorse and the battery lasts forever. The size is a bit bigger than the others but I love that I can actually enlarge the screen and be able to read the tiny print that seems to be appearing more and more. The screen is easy to maneuver and it's crisp and clear. Camera has serious capabilities so take a look at some YouTube videos on how to use and what to use for seriously great photos and videos. Always use a screen protector as you never know what will scratch it putting it in your purse. Lastly, grab that larger storage amount as this phone does not take a SD card. Nobody likes to delete things due to storage limits. I'm extremely happy with this purchase!

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: I am upgrading from the Samsung A71 to the S25 FE. I got it for $534 USD during Early Black Friday Deals on Amazon. I must say this phone feels premium in my had. Wonderfully made. Slick and nice. Not too big and not too small.  The back feels really good without the case. The phone feels light in my hand. But I use cases for my devices so that nice touch feeling goes away once i have on the phone case.  I took the Jet Black colour as I find it the nicest and best colour. The phone is lighter than my old phone. A Wonderful 7.9 " display. I use my phone for Light gaming like Subway Surf, Lords Mobile, so the Exynos 2400 Should be good enough for me.  I also took the 256 GB storage because I like taking pictures and saving  Videos on my phone. The camera ... I must say "WOW" coming from the A71. It is too good to be true. It picks up a lot of details. The video is another  "WOW". One thing I have noticed is that the phone started heating up during the set up. So  I you are looking to do lots with this phone maybe go for the S25 or higher. I just got this phone because my old phone has numerous lines on the screen and I wanted something with bigger storage and better camera and at least 4 years of updates. This S25 FE gives 7 years worth of updates so good enough for me since my phones last me a  minimum 4 years. At the back of the phone in the images you may not see the silver rings around camera because I put on a screen protector thing for the camera but i might take it off because I love seeing the silver rings. So far its a great phone depite the heating up during the set up

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: Upgraded from an older Motorola, and wow, what a leap. Iâ€™ve been using this phone for about two months now, and it just feels like a power tool in my pocketâ€”in the best way possible. Letâ€™s start with the obvious: the screen. Itâ€™s absolutely stunning. The flat display is a GAME-CHANGER. No more accidental touches, and applying screen protectors is finally a stress-free experience. The brightness is insane; I can read everything perfectly clear under direct sunlight. Watching videos and scrolling is just buttery smooth. The camera system is next-level, especially for zoom. The 5x optical zoom lens is the real deal. I took a photo of the moon (yes, I became that person) and the details were incredible. But itâ€™s not just a party trick. I used the 10x zoom at my kid's soccer game and could actually see faces clearly from the bleachers. The 200MP main sensor captures crazy detail if you have good light, and the low-light photos are far cleaner than on my old phone. The AI editing tools are also surprisingly useful for quickly removing photobombers or shadows. Performance is flawless. Everything is instant, apps launch fast, switching between them is seamless, and gaming is super smooth. The battery life is a marathon runner. Iâ€™m a heavy user (emails, social media, YouTube, some gaming), and I easily get through a full day with 20-30% to spare. The S-Pen is as handy as ever for quick notes and edits. I was worried about the titanium build and boxy design being uncomfortable, but it feels premium and solid in the hand. The matte finish doesnâ€™t pick up fingerprints, which is a huge win. Is it perfect? Itâ€™s a big, heavy phoneâ€”no getting around that. And itâ€™s expensive. Youâ€™re paying for the absolute top of the line. But if you want the maximum possible from a smartphone right now, this is it. Pros: Gorgeous flat display, unbeatable zoom camera, all-day+ battery life, blazing fast performance, useful S-Pen, premium titanium build. Cons:Large and heavy (not for everyone), very high price tag. Verdict:9.5/10. Itâ€™s the ultimate do-everything smartphone. If youâ€™re a power user, a creative, or just want the best camera system on the market, this phone is worth every penny. No regrets at all.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: I've been buying cheap, entry level phones for 15+ years and finally decided to try out the best of the best.  And wow.  This phone is incredible.  It's extremely fast at everything.  Image processing, gaming, applications.  All run without issue or slowdown.  The design of the body is sleek, sexy very durable.  I love the way the metal feels in my hand.  The overall weight of the phone is very manageable and I wouldn't consider it heavy at all.  The screen is top tier.  120hz is liquid smooth for gaming and apps.  HDR looks incredible on this display and it gets very bright!  I put a good quality screen protector on my display to keep it flawless.  Very well worth investing in a good one. The phone unlocks super quick via fingerprint which is a nice change compared to my old phone that felt like it took ages to unlock with fingerprint.  The S25 Ultra is basically tap the area and you're unlocked.  So fast! Overall, I consider this phone to be a great value for the money for anyone who is constantly on their phone.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: The Samsung S25 Ultra is an excellent phone from a hardware standpoint. The screen is beautiful, the speakers are loud and clear, and the camera takes great photos. Cell service and internet connectivity have been solid and reliable with no complaints. When I first purchased the phone, the battery life was outstandingâ€”easily close to two full days and comparable to the iPhone 16 Pro Max. Unfortunately, after being forced to install software updates, that battery performance dropped noticeably. What was once amazing is now just decent, with the phone ending a full day around 16% battery, even though I limit charging to 85% to preserve long-term battery health. This feels more like a software optimization issue than a hardware problem, which is disappointing. Bixby and Samsungâ€™s built-in ecosystem are underwhelming to me, but Googleâ€™s Assistant AI works very well, and if you donâ€™t like either option, using ChatGPT is a solid alternative. The S Pen is a nice added bonus and genuinely useful at times. The phone itself feels durable, though I still recommend using a case for extra protection. I purchased a new phone and received a new phone and perfect condition. I also havenâ€™t experienced any screen burn-in issues, even with the always-on display enabled. Overall, itâ€™s a powerful and premium device with excellent features, but software updates and battery regression keep it from being a top-tier experience.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: The fall prime days deal got me sold over the new iphone 17, as it was 170 bucks cheaper for the same capacity. Coming from an old iphone that has been saying I am tired, everything feels amazing. However, I do have an iphone 15 pro and have used 17 briefly, so I will compare them if you are having to decide between them: Camera: 15 pro has an overall a bit better camera system, pronounced more with indoor shots and low light situations. S25 seems to prioritize faster shutter over better light capture and it can gather less light, limiting its photo quality at low light. At other situations, there is no noticeable quality difference. 17 has a better low light performance as well, but lacks the telephoto lens. The biggest win for S25 camera is the telephoto in my opinion, and it is amazing for professional looking outdoor shots. I may be overusing it during my trips but it has been a game changer for me. pro iphones have the same lens, but they are a lot more pricey. It is a privilege at this price point. The official expert raw app from Samsung gives you a bit more edge over iphones, but it is not enough to compensate for the inferior sensor during point and shoot scenarios. May be a different story if you got time and the skills to use it. Material feel: the aluminum and glass body is iphone like, and it is great to see the phone industry caught up with apple on this. I like the iphone roundness a bit more aestetically pleasing, but my eyes got used to it too. Unlocking: faceID works fine mostly during the day but struggles at night, unlike iphones that can do it at any condition. The fingerprint is my most go to method, but finding where the sensor is sometimes a hit or miss. I drew lines on the case to find it more easily. Also, the accuracy drops a bit further with a glass screen protector and most protectors have the fingerprint accuracy drop as feedback on their pages. I wish I knew this before. Still searching for that amazing screen protector. Screen: 120 hz smoothness has been there for a long time, but my first experience with it now on the android side and 60hz feels yuck at this point. Can't go back. Both 17 and 15 pro has the feature, so no longer a deciding factor, but I am glad to see Apple finally giving that to everyone with 17. Too late for me though. I lost FaceTime and the blue bubbles (or green, I don't remember what color it was), and it has been alright. I am using WhatsApp video calls instead, and I admit that the video quality seems to be noticeably worse, but I got used to it all. The lines are more blurry with imessage, as RCS on the new androids allow for the most of that bubbles privileges. One more loss was airdrop, which I used to use a lot sending photos, but now I just use a usb cable between phones and grab from the iphone using the files manager. I am rooting for a handshake between Google and Apple someday that they will lower the walls. I tried a few third party apps that replace airdrop, but none was ok. On the other hand, finally I can transfer all my photos to my PC at once, by just plugging it! A feature that iphones lack. Tried getting all the photos to backup with the iphone and it fails no matter what I tried. I speculate that they are pushing icloud onto us and japordizing all the other methods for backing up photos, so the exit is here. Just get a phone that doesn't force you to their cloud service (hint: this one). The UI: can be set up like iphone by selecting "gestures", but the classic back button layout is more intuitive and the gestures mode seems less polished. A good alternative especially if you swear by the iphone way to interact with your phone. Payment: Apple pay has to strong contenders here: Google Pay and Samsung Pay. Both are very strong but I ended up with Google pay as it is more widely used. From pizza apps to banking, almost all the apps that I used to use Apple pay with just works with Google Pay. Battery life: not noticeably different from 15 pro or 17. 17 has a bit more juice even though it has lower battery capacity, but the difference between this or the others is something I could not tell during my use. The least I can say is that it should not be a deciding factor. Weight and size: feels significantly lighter than the pro Iphones and a bit lighter than the regular. A blindfolded person can easily tell the difference and holding iphones feel heavy to me now. Can't get smaller phones anymore, but hats off to Samsung for sticking with the lightness at least! Overall, a bit better point and shoot camera is not enough to justify that extra for me and I like the flexibility that android gives to this phone. The iphones and this are way too similar than I imagined before getting it, so the switch (both ways) is a lot easier now than ever. I am very happy with the phone and if you are on the fence, I would say just give it a try, please? Update: I found out amfilm screen protector that is made of hard glass and is very thin, so it does not reduce fingerprint accuracy. I totally forgot it was an annoyance. Plus, using the night mode on the camera for any indoor shots give me similar quality shots to the iphone because it tends to increase the shutter time. Turns out the iphone does it without the night mode and it was the secret sauce to better night time pictures. Now I use the Samsung camera more confidently!

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: Very snappy phone. I did have some problems initially connecting it to spectrum. It turned out I THINK that the mobile data was turned off in the settings somewhere and I have no idea why. I got it on sale for about 1K and it was normally 1500 as it is the 512GB version. I absolutely hate the fact no major cell phone carriers have sd cards anymore. I want to not have to worry about space for my photos.  I purchased a third party screen protector as I did not want to chance my screen being scratched as well as a battery case which keeps the phone charged over Wireless power delivery so I have full access to the USB port for things like video output. I was coming from a note 10 plus 4g version so this is a big upgrade and I plan to hold on to this phone for another 5 years or so. I upgraded only because certain apps would not support my old android version but the old phone was plenty good. (Oh also my external battery pack died and I couldn't get another one anymore). I do like that they ditched the curved glass as I hated that. They also ditched the backside glass which I hated even more!  Sound Quality is far better than my note 10. It comes out of a slit at the bottom. Initially I did not know what it was. The fit is great as it is almost exactly the same size as my note 10. I would have loved it if they made a more of 8 inch tablet phone but nope. Value for money is so so. I do not like spending 1k for a cell phone especially when it was on sale. It is the same price as a full blown computer but at least on a computer I can put extra storage. I do like the face recognition and the finger print works from behind the glass screen protector. I do wish the S Pen retention was better as I have already lost mine after the phone fell off a shelf. Thank god for the battery case and the screen protector. If they had an SD card I would have purchased a model with less memory. It is just Samsung causing us to pay extra especially since the flash chips are not that expensive and the assembly process is exactly the same.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: I love the phone but they can keep the AI. I upgraded from a very old phone so it was not hard to be impressed with this one. Super fast charging and extremely responsive. The sound and picture quality are mind blowing. The only thing not to like is the ridiculous AI.  The AI is is all about being politically correct. The outcome will be it can not do something or you will get nothing that you asked for. Remember when you did a search and you could actually do research. Well those days are gone. Now the only answer you get is what AI wants you to get, You can put your brain in a safe deposit box as free will and actually thinking are a thing of the past. I get AI when places are actually to cheap to pay for people. They have gone way to far. No longer are you shown how to think. Now it is all about what to think. From all that I have seen/heard the AI was really all that was focused on since last years model (for the most part). Which seems a waste and a shame. It would be a solid 5 stars and possibly one of the best phones ever made if they had a non AI version.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: Got this as an upgrade for my ancient S9 that's gotten really really slow. Installing and transferring over my apps and data was very easy with the included transfer app. Just make sure to connect both to wifi and let the transfer app update first before trying it. Popped in my old SIM card and it recognized it instantly as expected since this is an unlocked phone. What wasn't expected though was the lack of a microSD slot. Pretty disappointing. Speed is very fast, though the animations are still annoyingly slow. Ended up going into developer options and turning animation speed to 2X and now it just flies and everything is almost instant. As big as it is, I still needed a case for it to protect it, and got one of those plastic inner with silicone cover type cases. Fit very well and made it even bigger and heftier, but such is the cost of wanting to use modern phones. Feels fine though and can still fit into my pocket. Battery life is great. With how fast the phone is I can set it to power save mode and it's still miles ahead of my old S9. And it has a new feature to keep the battery capped at 80%. This prevents the battery from wearing out over time when left on a charger at 100%. You'll have less battery in the short term, but your battery will last years longer before it degrades. The AI photo fixing tools are amazing. Actually went back through a lot of old photos from my S9 that were messed up and didn't have any retakes, and the S25U was able to fix up all of them perfectly. Friend is actually seriously considering switching from iOS because iOS's photos AI is a complete joke.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: I wanted to replace an iPhone Xr with an Android device.  My thought process was something like, "the Xr is REALLY old, and the S25 is one of the latest Android phones and will probably be superior in most if not all categories." Jebus cribst I was SO wrong.  First, the facial recognition - works about 20% of the time (and that's being generous).  Second, the fingerprint scanner - works about 20% of the time on the first try (and that's being generous). With my iPhone, I never needed the fingerprint because the facial recognition worked EVERY TIME with no issues. I paid for two years of Samsung Care+ when I got the phone, expecting to love it.  If I had not purchased the Samsung Care+, I would have already traded in this phone for an iPhone. Bottom line, if you are considering switching from an old iPhone, DON'T.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: The build quality is very good, at least on a visible side of things. The phone is quite heavy. The battery life despite promises is not very impressive. With normal use it lasts approximately 36 hours, but if camera is used, particularly with high resolution, the battery will drain very fast since the phone heats up very badly. The screen quality is very good, especially no glare feature. I would definitely give it five stars if not a major problem. After a day of use the left part of the screen stopped responding to two finger pinching gesture for zomming in and out. It is happening with any application allowing zooming, such as Gallery, browsers, Photos, to name but a few. After a reboot it would work for a few hours, and will start again. I initiated a return with Amazon, and since Amazon wouldn't deliver a replacement on time for the return to be sent back, I purchased another one from Best Buy. And... absolutely same issue. Now both will go back because this is an absolutely unacceptable problem. Another problem that is annoying, but not critical. The sound volume jumps up and down when switching between apps. For example you are on a speaker in WhatsApp, you pick a regular phone call and switch back, the volume may jump to its maximum, or you increase the volume for phone conversation, it will also increase the ring tone volume. I have to say that I was spoiled with my older Galaxy S10 Lite, which served flowlessly for 6 years before the battery started failing.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ

For God's Sake people Keep It Simple!!!!!  There are a lot of us older people out here that want basic equipment and a lot of us do not like Apple. title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: I am a professional artist: painter/illustrator/photographer. I use Adobe products like Photoshop. I was hoping to have a high quality camera on me at all times for photographing unplanned scenes and subjects (i.o.w. when I'm not lugging around my heavy Canon dslr and lenses). The jpegs this phone produces look fine in my Adobe products, (appear consistent with Samsung's Gallery app) and are acceptable quality for medium-sized prints, let's say 11x14. But for $1000+ I want the raw photos Samsung claims this phone can take. Once the photos get imported into Adobe apps, whether a mobile or desktop, it becomes apparent that the raw images are not really raw - they act like jpegs with a raw file ending. (I learned from researching, other users have found some third party apps can output the real raw images but those apps don't have access to all the camera hardware features. I did not feel this was an acceptable solution for such an expensive phone). Additionally the raw images appear terrible compared to their jpeg counterparts; they're extremely overexposed with odd color artifacts and pixelization, unusable as shot. This isn't acceptable for an artist with an existing workflow.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: Not worth the high price.  Battery life and faster charging  was my main reasons for wanting a new phone,  but it wasn't actually better than my older A15 Samsung! Also,  I don't like some of the features or functionality compared to my older Samsung but everything else that I use was exactly the same.  I ended up returning it because I couldn't justify paying that price for so little benefit.  It just didn't seem like an upgrade.  Luckily I hadn't traded in my older phone and I ended up adding an sd card to ease the storage burden on it.  I'll just keep my old one until they stop updating or it fully stops functioning and by that time this new version or similar will be a much better price.  A good reminder that new isn't always better and definitely over inflated in price. It's often more practical to wait.  I have better things to do with my money.
