title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: After 1 month of ownership, I am extremely disappointed with this phone's durability and build quality. On day 1, the day before the Otterbox case I ordered from Amazon arrived, I was walking my dog, she saw a rabbit and bolted. This caused me to accidently drop the phone from hip height (less than 36") on to the sidewalk. It landed on its back, and a small u-shaped crack developed on the back glass. I did not realize the back was constructed of such flimsy glass.  This experience is contrary to the drop tests I reviewed before buying the phone, and I expected higher durability from Samsung. I'd have gladly accepted a more durable plastic back like some of the A series phones have.  Needless to say, it went in the Otterbox as soon as it came a day later.  I decided to live with the crack, as it was barely visible when in the case. About 3 weeks after purchase (July 2), I look at the back of my phone and see that the crack has now grown diagonally across the back of the back of the phone (see attached photo). Probably due to thermal contraction and expansion due to Maryland summers and the fact that my life does not allow me to stay in a constant temperature and humidity controlled environment. I decided to file a complaint with Samsung.  I got referred to a repair shop, who contacted me promptly to tell me that the repair would be out of pocket (roughly $130) unless I had Samsung care or something through my phone carrier. I am on the fence about doing this, but leaning towards doing it, especially if I decide not to keep this phone. Yesterday, I used the phone to take photos at the local 4th of July parade. Ambient temperature was about 84 degrees F. After about an hour of intermittent camera use, the phone became too hot to operate and handle. This is simply unacceptable! I have also found that the battery life claims are highly optimistic and not indicative of real world use. I am fortunate if I can get a full waking day (16 hours) from 100% to 15% (connect charger), and less if I am using the phone more extensively. I was forced to upgrade to this phone from my S20 FE since Samsung ceased to support the S20 series in May 2025. I am seriously considering either going back to that phone or replacing this one with either an A series or even an iPhone. Buyer beware! Your user experience with this phone may vary. I have been a loyal Samsung customer since the Galaxy S3, but that may change since my experience with this phone has been a bitter disappointment.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: This new "MINT" green phone has been nothing but a nightmare since I opened the box. I ordered MINT green. The picture shows "MINT" green. The box they shipped it in says MINT green. The settings on the phone says "MINT" green. So instead of a nice, cheerful, spring green phone I would enjoy looking at, why did they send me a COAL ASH AIR POLLUTION GREY PHONE that is so smoky and dark I have to try to hide it in a case?! This is blatant false advertising. The product they sell you looks nothing like the false mockup picture they made up for the listing. I have asked everyone I know and no one thinks it's a MINT PHONE. It's GREY. Not only that, the whole experience has been downhill from there as I've lost a lot of the features and freedom I took for granted on my S10. I'm afraid to even use the flashlight because it gets so hot it burns. When I first turned it on I got a warning alert that it can cause skin burns. Can you imagine if the other brand tried to sell a phone with a flashlight that burns through plastic and causes skin burns so much they have to put a warning alert when it's toggled on? Games that played effortlessly on my Samsung Galaxy S10 overheat this S25, freeze, don't respond, or just don't run at all. I have a huge list of issues with this phone and I will never buy another Samsung product again. This phone has been a downgrade in every way and I really wish I hadn't gotten this horrible falsely advertised product. They shouldn't be allowed to make up fake product images and send you something so depressingly not what they advertised at all!

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: WOW just upgraded my Samsung S9+ to the new Samsung S25Ultra. Couldn't wait to start using it as I've heard such great things about it. Started moving files thru the Smart Switch app and it moved all of my files from one phone to the other using the cable method. Only to about 6 hours to move all of them. After the move, I was moving my music around to different playlists and went to play music and noticed that some of it wasn't playing. I thought maybe the file transfer was corrupted somehow so I deleted the music file off the phone. This time I downloaded just the music file thru the Smart Switch App again and this time and it only took 3 hours.  Went to play music and just as before half of the music wouldn't play. Went online to ask what the problem was or was I doing something wrong. I found out SAMSUNG NO LONGER SUPPORTS WMA FILES, THIS SUCKS!!!  I have an extensive CD collection that I like to move songs onto my phone so that I can listen to them while I'm away from home.  It's unfortunate the Samsung folks spent so much time and effort on upgrades to their phone that they eliminated the one function I use the most. Contacted the Samsung forum about the issue and Samsung's response for a solution to THEIR problem was to look for a third party app that may be able to solve it, however no suggestions given.  I have been a proponent of Samsung for many years ditching my Apple phone long ago because Samsung was so much better (except their Icemakers).  I'm now considering sending the phone back to Amazon and go back to using my S9+ at least it still works the way it was intended to.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: Unfortunately there is no place to put a negative star. This is a very weak device. Terrible functionality. When I purchased this product I was moving to another town and I was very busy, therefore I did not have time to use it. So I missed the deadline to return it back to Amazon.  Be aware that Samsung only accepts returns upto 14 days. This device randomly freezes, to the point that you click on one app either does not open it at all, or you click on gmail suddenly it opens your instagram. Or you click on google map suddenly opens WhatsApp. It is a terrible experience since I paid above 1000 to make sure to buy a phone that I do not have this experience, but the phone feels like a useless toy in hand. I also called samsung customer service and they refuse to take it back even when their device does not work and it is only 40 days passed from purchase. I rarely write reviews, but this time I am writing to make people aware, you pay above 1000 but feels as cheap as 100 phone. Do not do that to yourself. What a shame, that a company knows how awful their product is that they do not want to get it back even after 40 days. I do not have enough money and time to follow up this issue legally, so be aware this phone does not work properly.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: Had xfinity, my provider, transfer data from my s20 to s25. Got home I first noticed a pop-up for pdf app. This pop-up blocked me from accessing any other app. I immediately removed the ad and went into settings and blocked all my apps from allowing notifications.  Problem kept coming back.  After getting frustrated for days trying to find out what was causing this I went back to xfinity, and for the first time in years I was very unhappy with their response.  They would not even look at the phone they accused me of installing the "VIRUS " to say the least I was disappointed with xfinity. I decided to go back to my s20 and return s25 back . Thankfully Amazon has great customer support.  I will buy, from Amazon,  a new s25, after a couple of new versions have been released.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: DO NOT BUY YOUR PHONE FROM AMAZON!!! When there's a problem, Samsung points at the Carrier and/or Amazon to solve the problem. My selfie camera went out a little over a month after I bought it. I'm a computer geek, so I followed all of Samsung's detailed instructions in order to verify that it was a legit failure and not an App conflict. It took me hours to back up everything & perform the nuclear option and perform a Factory Reset. Nothing worked, so Samsung told me to bring it to a Samsung Service Center. I did, they confirmed that it was a camera module failure & I hadn't damaged it (the rear-facing cameras work fine). However, since the camera is so new, there are no selfie camera modules available, so they told me to contact Samsung again. Samsung said I could send them the phone and they would fix it and return it to me. Sure, about how long would that take, about 2 weeks? Seriously, go without a phone for 2 weeks!?! It's no wonder they are happy to provide a 1yr warranty, you can't really exercise it! Online with Samsung now... We'll see if they can resolve it. I've invested 4 days already, this was a big mistake! Don't make the same mistake I did.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: I bought this phone intending to use it as my primary device running Android apps. If it were possible to install LineageOS or some alternate firmware then I might be using it for that purpose. However, it seems that's not possible. Some reasons why I want to install alternate firmware include: 1) I do not like the Samsung UI 2) I want to log in as root, change OS settings, run SQL statements on sqlite databases for apps, etc. 3) have the option to make changes to Android, compile those changes and flash those changes to my device. Since as I previously stated that is not possible, I am now using this device as a home router by enabling the wireless "hotspot" feature. Here are the things I like: 1) Good hardware. The upload and download speeds are significantly faster compared to iPhone 15 Pro Max. Things I do not like: 1) The lowest battery charge setting is 80%. Since this is plugged in all the time, I'd like to set this to 50%. 2) This is connecting my EightSleep mattress to the internet (the mattress doesn't work unless connected to the internet). One issue I have is that the Samsung S25+ will automatically install updates and reboot. And when it reboots, my EightSleep mattress is then disconnected from the internet and I cannot control it and I loose all sleep data for that day. 3) And finally, this is what I dislike the most: when there are no devices connected to the hotspot, it will automatically turn off. I've already had to go to the device, unlock it, and manually re-enable the hotspot three times today.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: I work in Tech Procurement and Support; I bought this phone for work purposes or to handle daily life. I wanted something small and light, and for that, it 100% is. I'm a woman and have small hands, so I want this to be a good size. The battery is good, and I have no problems with connectivity. What we come down to a large problem is AI: Samsung's Vision and Language Core occupies a good portion of your resources. Encrouch upon them in space, and you likely will have a miserable time. It is a lie that you have "128 GB" on your phone. At least a 1/3rd of that and any resources on your phone is occupied by Samsung's AI. It will reinstall itself, no matter what setting you enable or disable "not allowed to change system settings" "do not update galaxy apps" it *will* reinstall itself at YOUR data and WiFi's expense. So embrace it, and enjoy it, or if you don't like it, buy another phone. Me personally, I will be selling this for scrap and moving on. Even my old Chinese OnePlus 12 had less bloatware than this crap. The AI Core I disabled on that phone? Still disabled, didn't re-install itself, didn't update itself.

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: Phone was working fine for a couple of months and had no less than 85% by lunchtime today. Suddenly the phone won't turn on or show it's charging. After calling Samsung and Amazon, i was advised to take it to UBreakiFix and there is no battery reading on their machine. He said it could be the battery or the port. Amazon isn't showing an option to replace, only return. I cant sent my phone back with all my pictures on it. Help!

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 FE Cell Phone (2025), 256GB AI Smartphone, Unlocked Android, Large Display, 4900mAh Battery, High Res-Camera, AI Photo Edits, Durable, US 1 Yr Warranty, JetBlack
description: Powerful where it counts and smart where it matters, Galaxy S25 FE is built to level up your everyday. From its vivid 6.7" display to its long lasting battery and pro grade camera, Galaxy S25 FE is packed with all the features you want, upgraded.âµ
reviews: Do Not Buy!!!!! Where do I start. I purchased this phone February when it just came out. 3 months ago I started having issues with the volume. It would go up and down by itself. It also would mute itself and I would be missing parts of a conversation  when talking. I have a one year warranty on the phone. I called Amazon because this is where I purchased it from. Well Lord and behold  Samsung tells me they do not replace phones outside of 15 days. They stated I would need to call Amazon because that is where I bought it from. Well Amazon has stated they will not replace the phone because it is outside of the 30 days. Well Amazon will end up being in another law suite because that is not what is stated on their page. Please do not Buy any expensive phones from Amazon or Samsung. This is not over. Anyone that wants to join in a class action law suite please reach out. This is unacceptable. Amazon needs to do better with these sellers.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 5G US Version, 512GB, Crafted Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold6 SM-F956U combines cutting-edge design with advanced technology, offering a truly unique smartphone experience. Its stunning foldable display opens to reveal a spacious, immersive screen that fits comfortably in your pocket when closed, making it perfect for on-the-go use. reviews: This is my first foldable, coming from the Note 20U an I'm very impressed. It is a renewed version but it looks brand new an works well. The screen seems good but the company shipped it in the closed position, I understand that they didn't have a box for it. The price was great an the build quality is good. It is a heavy phone but I like it.

reviews: Great phone, missing one ESSENTIAL feature. Samsung has done much to improve the Z flip since I bought the z flip 4 three years ago and this is a great budget option. However when I plugged it into my car to use android auto, it does not work, this is a deal breaker for me, I didnt really care about losing "Samsung DEX" Capability but android auto is a whole nother story. The idea that a phone from Samsung in 2025 is without android auto capabilities is frankly insane and my nissan leaf has the worst UI imaginable so android auto is a must. I will be ordering the z flip 7, and returning this phone once I've transfered everything over AGAIN. So if you are thinking of this phone and you need android auto. BUY A DIFFERENT PHONE.

(ì˜ì–´) As a Korean who has used Samsung phones my entire life, I never thought Iâ€™d end up criticizing one this harshly. Iâ€™ve been using only Samsung Note series phones for over a decade. Notes were about the size of an adult manâ€™s large palm, so portability wasnâ€™t great, but they had a generous screen and were durable enough to be called â€œtank phones.â€ Then, while living in the U.S., I switched to a budget carrier and ran into compatibility issues. In the end, I had no choice but to move to a foldable phone. And today, I deeply regret that decision. The phone was perfectly fine just yesterday. I woke up this morning to find that half the screen was dead. I went to a repair shop and was told, â€œIt looks like a drop of about 30 cm, and this kind of case is very common, so itâ€™s not eligible for warranty repair.â€ I understand the logic behind denying a free repair. But from a structural perspective, this makes no sense. A phone that canâ€™t even withstand everyday impact, with no bent corners or visible damageâ€”can this really be called a phone? I honestly have no idea what Samsung was thinking when they designed this. For the first time in my life, I even found myself considering trying an Apple phone. Why? Because in the U.S., the Note series doesnâ€™t exist, and in many cases, it isnâ€™t even compatible with local carriers. In conclusion, regardless of brand, foldable phones are not meant for everyday use. Either you wrap it in an extremely thick protective case to survive daily impacts, or itâ€™s a phone only for people who have enough money to casually absorb expensive repair costs. (For reference: phone price $750, repair cost $380 + taxâ€¦ shocking.) I sincerely hope Samsung discontinues this form factor as soon as possible. Summary: Never buy foldable phones. If youâ€™re going to buy a Samsung phone, a $120 basic Samsung model is the correct choice.

Simply Circle to Search1 with Google and start planning your own trip to the Louvre. reviews: I ordered this phone back in February & back when I opened it, it felt brand new. The battery still lasts super long & charges quickly with my fast charger from Anker. It had a couple of scuffs on the back, but it's barely noticeable. Especially with a case, which I always keep it in. It does feel comfortable to hold without a case, but I prefer having a case for popsockets. The phone functions perfectly, I was surprised for a refurbished one. The speakers sound how they should (my cousin got the same model but brand new so I was able to test) even with a privacy screen protector on, the finger print reader works as well as the face ID. I definitely can see myself having this phone for years. I play genshin impact & honkai star rail on it and they both run superrr smooth. I also used to play infinity nikki on it and that ran pretty well too. But these games do drain the battery quite a bit (obviously). It really does feel like a pc in phone form. I have successfully connected my phone to monitors, but i havent done much with that feature. (Samsung dex or something like that) (I took these pics with my iPad so forgive the quality, the phone looks more deep purple irl. But the phone arrived with these scuffs. And here's proof of the battery charging fast & how long it lasts!)

reviews: Ordered the purple S24 Ultra and am very happy with the device. Upgraded from an S22+ to this. Was able to drop my SIM card in and go! But it came with Android version 14 which is older than the version on my S22+ (v16) so I was missing some features I was used to. I looked more into it and my CSC was XAA (US unlocked) but the firmware version S928USQS4AXL3 was for TKM Android 14 (T-Mobile) and was preventing automatic updates. I flashed my phone to S928USQU4CYIS which is Android 16. Technically it's for the SM-S928U1 model which is the unlocked model. What i got from them is SM-S928U and that is a carrier specific/locked model. No issues with it and I have all my missing features, but this is not technically Factory Unlocked. Also my CSC changed to AIO because of my SIM being from Cricket being in the phone when I started the phone after flashing it with the firmware. So far no issues.

reviews: I bought a Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra (Unlocked, Refurbished Excellent, 256GB, 12GB RAM, Violet) through Amazon Renewed, and unfortunately, my experience has been very disappointing. The phoneâ€™s model number is SM-S928U, which means it was originally carrier-locked, not a true factory-unlocked model (those are SM-S928U1). Because of thisâ€”or possibly another issueâ€”the phone is stuck on Android 14 with One UI 6 and shows â€œup to date,â€ so it canâ€™t be updated to the latest Android 15 / One UI 8. Cosmetically, itâ€™s also not â€œExcellentâ€ as described. There are noticeable scratches on the back, and the screen has faint white lines or faded marks beneath the surface that canâ€™t be wiped away. It looks more like â€œGoodâ€ condition at best. Overall, this product does not meet the quality standards I expected from Amazon Renewed. Itâ€™s disappointing that something listed as â€œExcellentâ€ arrived with both software and cosmetic issues. Iâ€™ll be returning it for a refund. Buyers, please double-check listings and model numbers before purchasing â€” quality control seems to have slipped lately.

reviews: I was hesitant to upgrade my trusty S10 but it was my birthday and I was feeling saucy. For the price and the various reviews I read, this is THE bang for the buck. Compared to a S24, S25 or S26 there isn't much missing and some would argue it's one of the last of the breed especially with the BT S-Pen (the new ones don't have anymore or have lesser features). It STILL has "updates" life left and WILL get One UI 8.5 (any day now actually). This is noticeably faster and better in pretty much every way. I didn't know what real battery life was until now. I can go a full day without a charge; my other phone I was lucky to get 4 hours of my normal use and even then I was on high alert to where the nearest AC plug is. To go from 80% to 50% was scary but that 50% to 20% when the S10 would power down to safe mode was a constant source of anxiety. With this it's like time is on a different measure. I could watch the % tick down on the old one, on here it barely moves. A true game changer. The ONLY "gripe" I have is this beast is a big-boy. It's probably double the weight and dimensions in every way. I can absolutely feel it in my front pocket and if I wear my PJs it will pull the pocket down even. Due to that weight it will also pull the suction cup mount off the windshield of the car more often than not so I had to switch to a cup-holder style that's more secure. It is curious why Samsung didn't let it wireless charge their own Galaxy Watch Ultra (when I try the watch says it's "not compatible" when I thought it is just Qi charging?) That's a real shame; not huge as the watch lasts a couple days as it is, but would have been a nice-to-have given it's all their same flagship stuff from the same time-frame even... I thought I'd miss not having an SD slot (and kind of do in a way) but I went from 256GB to 512GB internal now. Similarly I used to have the ol' Bixby button on the S10 commandeered to launch Home Assistant. I thought I'd miss that, but literally last night I discovered that the "RegiStar" plugin to Samsung's "Good Lock" (yeah dumb name) has the ability to assign all kinds of things to all kinds of other things. So now my main power button long-press launches Home Assistant. BOOM! Overall "no ragrets" and almost wish I'd done it sooner.

reviews: The phone works as a S23 ultra should, screen works as it should, speakers, microphone, signal doesnt Drop and battery life is decent. The reason for 4 stars is because even though the phone is factory unlocked it has alot of AT&T bloatware on it. Whenever the phone is starting and powering off AT&T bloatware is there. Ive had to disable AT&T apps because I live outside the US where that network isnt available. So I fully expected a fully unlocked phone and not one from AT&T. The phone still works with my carrier but it would be awesome to be fully unlocked.

reviews: This is not my idea of excellent condition. At best, it is good. (1) The screen has some kind of a mark on the left upper side. Not exactly a scratch, but like a chemical burn. I am happy that putting on a screen protector now makes it indistinguishable. (2) there are visible signs of glue at the back of the phone around the camera lenses. (3) Bottom left edge of the phone shows signs that it was impacted (most likely it fell). (4) Left side bezel, not well fitted, a ridge can be detected when you run your hands over it. Having said all of that, the phone seems very much to be in good working condition, no issues there.

reviews: I purchased this Galaxy S23 Ultra from Big Box LLC on June 17, 2025, based on the listing clearly stating the device was â€œFactory Unlocked.â€ That turned out to be false. ðŸ“… Timeline of What Happened: June 17 â€“ Order placed and shipped same day. June 18 â€“ Inserted SIM and discovered the phone was locked to AT&T. June 19â€“20 â€“ AT&T confirmed the device was under an unpaid installment plan and ineligible for unlocking. The seller provided an incorrect unlock code, which they later admitted was missing a digit. After multiple failed attempts, the device became MCK locked â€” a high-level lock that makes the phone completely unusable. I spent over a week trying to get a valid unlock or MCK code from the seller. They kept stalling. June 28 â€“ Seller admitted they couldnâ€™t obtain the MCK code and instructed me to return the phone. âš ï¸ Why This Matters: A factory unlocked phone should never require an unlock code â€” and certainly not end up MCK locked. I made 8 trips between T-Mobile and AT&T trying to resolve this. I lost 15+ hours of professional time, and the phone was bricked because of the sellerâ€™s incorrect information. After all of this, the only resolution was to return the phone â€” which I did under protest, with the entire incident documented. Iâ€™m grateful that Amazon support has been helpful and professional, but buyers should be extremely cautious with this seller. A device tied to a financing plan should never be sold as â€œfactory unlocked.â€ If your time and peace of mind are valuable, look elsewhere.

reviews: Would give this 0 if possible, but it does gain 1 because it does mostly work in a T-Mobile dense metro area. Either the refurbishing failed to remove all AT&T crapware, or Samsung was incompetent and allowed some hidden AT&T configuration. This was supposed to be identical as unlocked, to the T-Mobile refurbished unlocked that I bought for my wife. There are many places within the area bounded by LA along I-10 to El Paso, up I-25 to Cheyenne; Barstow along I-40 to Oklahoma City then I-44 to Saint Louis, following up through Toledo to Ypsilanti, back west along I-80 to San Francisco, and down I-5 to Barstow, through Yuma toTucson. Along the western edge of Nevada from Las Vegas to Reno, Flagstaff up through Central Utah to Idaho. Both phones show identical configuration, and icons, but this POS refuses to connect to data services when the other one will. Voice support appears to be identical. As far as I can tell, the only difference between the phones is the original vendor, which should have been erased during the unlocking refurbishing. I waited to report because early-on I thought it might have been build-out because the other one was inconsistent. For the last 4000 miles, the other one works and this one fails.

Now, about the unlocking complaints â€” especially important to clarify: This phone was sent to Asia, and it was still very easily unlocked by simply following the clear directions included in the box. The paperwork inside explicitly states that you do not need to pay extra to unlock the phone and that if the device arrives locked, you should contact the company directly. I did exactly that. Their customer service was beyond helpful â€” quick response, simple instructions, and the phone was unlocked very fast with zero hassle. The process was straightforward and worked exactly as promised, even for international use. After going through this myself, itâ€™s clear that many of the negative reviews come from people who: â€¢ Didnâ€™t read the papers included in the box â€¢ Didnâ€™t contact the seller â€¢ Or assumed the phone was permanently locked without following the provided steps If you follow the directions they give you, the process is quick, easy, and stress-free. reviews: Nice phone.  Like new.  Unlocked, but Verizon doesn't seems to play well with their own SIM. After hours of fighting with their website and app trying to activate the phone on am existing line, I removed the SIM from the phone and used the app to download an eSIM. After that the phone immediately activated and has been working flawlessly since. My advice to others experiencing trouble activating unlocked phones on Verizon? Ditch the plastic SIM and download an eSIM using the Verizon app.  As always, YMMV.

reviews: Love the phone! It's a Samsung too so I can't complain. Because of it's size, the phone is super lightweight. The battery life could've been a whole lot better. You will definitely need to carry some sort of power bank for this low mah phone. I couldn't believe how the screen had zero scratches on it. The phone definitely performs exceptionally well. Do not buy this phone if you have fat fingers like me. Texting and typing on this phone can be a huge headache for people with large thumbs. The only thing I have to complain about is the top of phone has 2 chips that are completely noticable. I guess whoever had it before dropped it without having a case. Still, this phone is a beast and I'm really happy I got it from Amazon even though they lied about the condition.

reviews: When I bought the phone it was unlocked. After a software update from the manufacturer, the phone has become unusable. After taking to both my carrier and Samsung twice it turns out it's now locked to a carrier (Verizon). I spoke with Verizon who stated that the previous owner broke their contract so they won't be unlocking the phone. I contacted the seller who tried to tell me that it is indeed unlocked, but the software update just reverted it back to the old carrier. They sent me instructions that required downloading two different applications on to a PC, then hooking my phone to it and what not. For one thing, I don't own a PC, for another thing, when buying an unlocked phone you shouldn't have to go back in to it to "unlock" it yourself. And, this just seems like a work around. I told the owner that I was told by Samsung, my carrier, and Verizon that this phone is locked to Verizon and he "assured" me this wasn't the case.  I think Verizon would know. Just be weary of buying an "unlocked" phone. It might be temporarily unlocked but a software update could have you left with a phone that's only good as a tiny tablet with no phone capabilities.

title: Samsung Galaxy S23 5G, US Version, 128GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Meet Galaxy S23, the phone takes you out of the everyday and into the epic. Life doesnâ€™t wait for the perfect lighting, but with Nightography, you are always ready to seize the moment and snap memories like a pro. See your content no matter the time of day on a display with a refresh rate up to 120Hz and Adaptive Vision Booster. reviews: Let me start by saying, wow! The SAMSUNG Galaxy S23 5G is an absolute powerhouse of a smartphone. From its sleek design to its cutting-edge features, this device has truly raised the bar for mobile technology. First off, let's talk performance. With its lightning-fast processor and generous 8GB of RAM, the S23 5G breezes through any task you throw at it. Whether you're multitasking between apps, streaming HD videos, or gaming on the go, this phone handles it all with ease. And let's not forget about 5G connectivity. With the S23 5G, you're future-proofed for the next generation of mobile networks. Downloads are blazing fast, streaming is seamless, and lag is a thing of the past. It's like having the power of a supercomputer right in the palm of your hand. But it's not just about performance â€“ the SAMSUNG Galaxy S23 5G also delivers in the camera department. The 128GB of storage means you'll never have to worry about running out of space for your photos and videos. And with its advanced camera system, featuring multiple lenses and AI enhancements, every shot is a masterpiece waiting to happen. The display is another highlight of this phone. The vibrant AMOLED screen is a joy to behold, with rich colors and deep blacks that make every image pop. Whether you're watching movies, browsing the web, or scrolling through social media, the S23 5G's display is sure to impress. And let's not forget about the little things â€“ like the sleek design, the intuitive user interface, and the long-lasting battery life. It's clear that every aspect of the SAMSUNG Galaxy S23 5G has been carefully crafted to deliver an exceptional user experience. In conclusion, if you're in the market for a new smartphone that offers top-notch performance, lightning-fast connectivity, and stunning photography capabilities, look no further than the SAMSUNG Galaxy S23 5G. It's a true flagship device that's worthy of your attention.

reviews: While the device has the potential to save my marriage, it comes with strings attached. 1. Screen defects: there are structural lines at the top and bottom, suggesting it may not be an OEM. 2. Scratches and nicks indicate it was dropped on the face several times. While the rear glass is excellent, the camera rings are scuffed and dinged. The sides have minor scratches at the top and bottom. Battery performance seems excellent.  The non-OEM screen performed excellently in all tests. Camera, microphones, and unlocked status are all excellent.  So, while it's had some repairs and shows wear from previous use, it's like that old red truck you see around town that's outlasted two of your newer vehicles. Bought in excellent functional condition, but the appearance is good at best. Four stars!

reviews: Know that unlocked phones have the last users sim data installed. So if AT&T was the last users config. It will boot up as AT&T till you insert your old phones SIM card. Unlocked phones have the last users config from the last carrier used as default till you insert your sim card. It would have been great to know this with a note from the seller... But in the end the seller was great clearing up the issue.

reviews: USA unlocked didn't work with my carrier. I had to return this phone so unfortunately do not get to enjoy the quality camera or other nice features. Try going for Universal unlocked if you can. As far as the device goes it was of quality and sturdy. It has what looks like a great camera.  It does lack the external port for wired earbuds and no microSD. I still think refurbished is a great option. Just make sure to test the phone as soon as you receive to make sure it will function with your carrier. Make sure you have the current sim card that does 5g to ease the transfer etc.  Even checking to make sure not blacklisted and finding it is ok does not mean it won't have the carrier compatibility issue. Now I understand the difference between the type of unlocked and I am sticking with factory unlocked(universal)

title: Samsung Galaxy S23 5G, US Version, 128GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Meet Galaxy S23, the phone takes you out of the everyday and into the epic. reviews: This phone came with a few small scratches which I was not thrilled about but it was not a make or break for me. However, after using this phone for a month I noticed that the screen had more issues than just that. For one I had to clean the screen continously because it was more prone to smudges. Not to mention the screen had a really gritty and dry texture. I thought this would be easily fixed by using a screen protector. However, every screen protector I tried to put on it they would never completely attach correctly to the screen. It would either have bubbles that I couldn't get out or they would have these large dark spots. This is after trying three different brands of screen protectors. The biggest concern I had about the screen was when one morning I woke up to my screen having a lot of condensation. I have a very cold room due to having POTS so I have had all of my phones in my room for years and not one of them had this kind of problem. I also noticed that this phone had a lot of scratches on the case and even a big dent on the side. The phone I use to have was a Samsung Galaxy S10E. It was such a better phone than this one and half the price. I noticed that my S10E had a far superior camera than this phone as well. The pictures were very blurry and had terrible lighting, not to mention the video had terrible stability. I ended up sending this phone back. It just didn't feel worth the price. One of the good points of this phone was the set up and SD card insert. I had no problems with putting in my mint mobile card. I would not recommend this seller because it was not packed well and came with no charger or cord. I decided to buy a Samsung Galaxy S21 5G instead and couldn't be happier.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: I'm seriously loving this phone. I'd been eyeing a co-worker's phone for a few years, and when I belatedly realized my Note 9 (which I hardly ever used) was no longer supported, I went for this right away. I think my only disappointment is that the S-Pen doesn't work the same on a Z Fold as it does for the Note. I'm happy with the screen, the battery life, the storage, the reception (not the best where I live, but this phone makes the best of it), the way the apps run, and the feel of the phone--although I keep it in a case, because I drop everything. I've yet to take more than one photo in it, but that one was fine. I may be firmly in the Apple walled garden, with my iPhone, Apple Watch, Apple TV, iPad, and MacBook Air, but I hardly use my iPhone anymore; it's now kind of just there to make certain features work on its fruity Companions. Some of my relatives who saw my phone over the holidays liked it. They lost interest when I answered their questions about the price, but my point is they were intrigued by my phone! If I could, I'd take off half a star for the way Samsung nerfed the S-Pen, but that's not an option. I don't think the loss of that functionality is worth a whole star, so it gets five in my book.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)

reviews: I was honestly sceptical of purchasing, as I'd read so many negative reviews. I decided to wait three months before leaving a review. The phone came in mint condition, no scratches, dinges or loose parts. SIM tray was easy to pop out, battery life lasts over 24 hours of usage varying from podcast listening and scrolling through social media apps. The quality of this phone is great. I was scared after seeing how glitchy and prone to breaking the Fold 3 was. Thankfully I spent an extra $50 on this model. It fits in female and male trouser pockets perfectly. As advertised, it truly is an unlocked phone! I tried AirTalk wireless SIM and it worked flawlessly and H20 Wireless.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: I am and have always been reluctant to buy a "used" or "refurbished" item. you never know how it will come to you and what condition, even if its described as good. So I pulled the gun on the ZFold 4 because my ZFold 4's inner screen died out. This a common issue with any of the Folds or Flips.  And to replace the cable and/or Screens cost about $500 - $800... and from there, you wont know if the place did a good job or not as well .. Anyway, so I received the ZFold-4 when it was shown to be delivered. When i looked in the box, it was missing the power cube.. I kinda got upset about it, but after going back and looking at the description, it never mentioned it would have one... my fault there. So, I looked over the ZFold-4 and I actually tried looking hard for any scratches, marks or anything and could not find anything. This ZFold-4 was basically NEW... I was very impressed.. So,after setting up the ZFold-4 i found that since this was an unlocked phone  it did not have the T-Mobile applications ( which would be obvious) .. not a big deal though.. So i have been using this for a few weeks now and it is still running good. I have noticed though that the battery life is not as good though. I have to charge it everyday.. my other ZFold-4 it was about a day and a half before I NEEDED to charge it.. so not sure yet if the battery may be a issue or not... I will be testing a bit more.. and if the battery still shows signs of degradation I may have to send it back, or try for another one....

reviews: Originally thought vendor sold a blacklisted phone, but turned out there was an issue with ATT's prepaid service not transferring nicely across devices. I would NOT call the device "excellent" quality (which is what I purchased); more like "good" quality. However, I am going to keep the device.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)

So now looking for a replacement.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: I bought this phone because i was impressed with the large screen.  However, after using it for 3 weeks I found it functionally hard to use.  The phone has two modes, the first is the closed position the other is when you open the phone.  In the closed position, it is only about 2 in wide, this made it difficult for me (with fat fingers) to correctly enter information on the keys.  When the phone is open, its about 4-5 in wide which makes it very difficult to hold in one hand.  It was easier to use when open because the keys were much bigger and easier to press without inadvertently press an adjacent key..  The phone is a great phone but it just didn't work for me.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: There were a few things I liked and didn't like about this phone and some were just an absolute deal breaker Likes: outside screen was a great size for general phone usage inside screen was much nicer for things that required more screen real estate Dislikes: The phone is difficult to open. one handed - no shot. Two handed, sure but it's a struggle, and it makes it much harder to just flip back and forth between screens When opened, the keyboard splits. Probably better in the long term, but i didn't care for it at all It's a brick. it's big, it's heavy. Maybe some don't mind, but i really didn't care for it at all The crease. this was expected and not completely terrible, but also not something that i think i would get used to. In the end i really didn't think this phone was worth paying almost double the price of a regular phone and even if it was the same price i probably would stick with my non foldable phone for now.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: I purchased this because my original fold 4s screens crapped out and it was cheaper to buy this  than get it fixed. I purchased the "excellent" condition option and the phone is nice. No scratches or visible dings or anything. My only complaint is that it's obvious that the inner screen was replaced, that's okay, not a problem but I don't think it was put together correctly because you CANNOT fully open this phone flat and theres also a little bit of some type of adhesive or glue that I had to clean from the gaps of the hinge mechanism. But honestly for the price I don't care. I just hope it doesn't crap out on me before the fold 6 comes out because I'll be trading in for that. Other wise I probably would have returned this phone for not being able to fully unfold.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: I purchased refurbished Samsung Galaxy z fold 4 in excellent condition.  The phone came in excellent shape and I was very happy with it.  Unfortunately, when I try to use it, the wifi will not work.  It turns on but doesn't show any list of wifi devices.  I tried updating, rebooting and even factory reset but no avail.  After talking to Samsung and Amazon, I had to give up trying to making it work and had to return it.  It's a shame since the phone was in a great condition.  I might try another one.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: Where do I start on this journey? I ordered a Samsung fold 4 on January 9th, through this vendor on Amazon. The Phone was refurbished and several hundred dollars cheaper than anyone else, it also had the Amazon 90 day warranty so I figured, what the hey! The phone arrived a few days later and looked fine, after opening it and turning it on, I was prompted to enter my Wi-Fi password and then to log into Google for set up..... easy enough, but about 3 seconds later the phone went blank with a warning from Samsung. "this phone has been temp locked by Samsung because it has been either reported stolen, lost in transit or not turned in on a phone upgrade. It gave a number to call Samsung so i did. The lady there said she couldn't help me and i needed to contact the buyer. I called them and asked what's up and they told me the phone wasn't on any black list and shouldn't be locked. They offered me a refund and sent an email with instructions to ship it back. Well a few days later they received the phone and issued a partial refund. The phone was locked with my google account and until I was able to unlock it, they wouldn't issue a full refund. I called them and was able to unlock the phone for them while talking and they said the full refund had been issued. When the first refund was issued I received an email almost right away saying i had received it. This time i got nothing. I waited a few days and still nothing. I called the company I used to purchase the phone through ( Affirm) and they said they had only received 1 refund. After several calls to the vendor and 5 or 6 calls to Amazon, we figured out the second refund was issued as a account credit or "gift cert" but that's not how it was purchased. So on the phone we go again, 5 more calls to Amazon trying to convince them the refund that I got just so happened to coincide at the exact second i received the gift card was the issue....Well, you'd think that would be easy to understand but nope!!! after a few more calls and being asked on each one to speak to someone higher up, i was told the issue was with the way it was refunded and Amazon had fixed it, I should get the refund in 48 hours...... 2 weeks later.... nothing, I finally gave in and said screw it, I'll just use the gift card. So.... in the end, the vendor sold me a locked phone, somehow between them and Amazon ( nobody will accept the blame) the refund was screwed up and i have a gift card now. Looking back I wish I would have just payed the extra money for a new, unlocked phone and skipped the middle person. Lesson learned I guess. The phone looked to be ok and if your willing to take a chance on going through with the giant mess I did, give it a shot. If you have bad luck and don't have time or money to spend on waiting and making phone calls.... I would give them and Amazon a hard pass. I know things can happen and do, but to ship out a phone that Samsung easily told me was on a black list seems strange..... I don't know maybe it wasn't but it was a time wasting ordeal, I for one won't be doing it again. Best of luck!!!

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: I really, really wanted to like this phone. My friend warned me ahead of time that he had to switch back to a non-foldable, but I thought it was a matter of his uses and preferences. The front screen is both shorter and slimmer than most flagships, but I actually found it pleasant and easier to reach all the corners. Unfortunately, something about the phone's shape makes it so fragile that after putting it in my pocket with no other objects around it, the built-in protector started to crack after 5 minutes of me casually walking around the house. Even after putting on a case, there are now several large cracks in the protector despite no drops or impacts, just normal pocket wear, placing on counters, etc. The most disappointing part is the way it interacts with apps. The ecosystem just isn't compatible with foldables yet, so unless you want to be a pioneer with potentially years of hit-or-miss experiences, it's probably not worth it just yet. The compatible pen is also so large that it begs the question why they didn't make a normal sized S Pen and integrate it into the phone's body. You can only use the pen on the inside screen, so it takes away all of the quick versatility I enjoyed with the Notes. I used to use my pen for everything, and now I don't use it at all.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: Shortly after using it in the first few days, the screen delaminated along the fold. It seemed to get worse everyday.Everytime I opened the screen Iâ€™d hear the sound of the screen cover lifting from the display and see a wide bubble forming (about 1/4 to 1/2 inch) running from the top to the bottom.  I checked reviews and comments on line and found my problem to be somewhat common. All Z Folds seems to be susceptible to this issue. From the reviews, I learned that Samsung has a mixed record of covering the cost of the repairs, with some users saying it costs $500 for a repair, even with a warranty.  I love to try the latest technology, but with it comes a risk of becoming a beta tester for the company. Samsung says the sceen has been tested for 400,000 cycles, but mine showed issues beginning at only 40 cycles. A huge disappointment.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)

Not sure who is testing these phones but this is an obvious "something aint right". ALSO, I think it had a software issue because it kept asking me to download the update....I didn't this literally  6 times and it kept asking. Needless to say....I sent the phone back. title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)

reviews: I purchased this Galaxy Z Fold from thegadgetdeals. I was excited because this is a really cool phone. I got it and visually it was in good condition,  it even came with a s reen protector on the inside screen. But then I noticed that it wouldn't charge wireless. 9 then noticed that the screen protector was coming g loose. After that I noticed what looked like a hair on the screen screen, it wouldn't blow off so I figured it was under the screen protector. I lifted it up and the hair didn't move, it later got bigger. I requested a refund and got it. The seller said it was a damaged pixel then charged me a restocking fee for a phone the clearly needed repaired. Accused me of dropping it cause they said the camera lens protector that I put on was cracked. Therefore even more proof, in their eyes, that the phone wasn't returned in the condition it was shipped. I will never buy from them again. And will tell my family and friends not to either.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: I purchased this phone and have been using it for 5 months. All of a sudden the front screen started flickering on and off randomly. This was NOT after a drop or any kind of physical misuse. Over the next three days the flickering became worse and then on the fourth day the main folding screen went black - completely dead. I attempted to factory reset to see if that fixed the issue - no go it would turn on for less than 30 seconds, then hiss static loudly and shut off. While I was trying to verify my warranty it stopped making notifications, then it also stopped making calls, then it stopped being able to take calls... This phone all of a sudden after 5 months of regular use suffered what can only be described as catastrophic hardware malfunction. Over the next 3 days I was contact with Samsung customer service, sending over my warranty documentation more than 5 times - I kid you not. The issue is that the amazon renewed warranty is 90 days and for some reason that overrides the fact that the phone has a year long warranty through Samsung. I sent my documentation five times to three different agents and even though it showed as in warranty on my end (from the original documentation i sent through the website) each agent somehow could not see that the documentation that I sent in. I spent over a week with Samsung customer service arguing the fact that they were incompetent and my warranty was valid. Now I am still in a fight as it is showing a repair estimation and still showing as out of warranty - whether through the amazon renewed warranty issue or whether they're sayin it's physical damage (I repeat the phone has not been dropped, the catastrophic issues started randomly) I will never buy another electronic from Samsung - Their customer service is the most appalling thing I have ever experienced - and I will be moving to a different device without repairing my current one if they insist its related to physical damage.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: I haven't had the phone 30 minutes yet, so nothing bad! I've heard of people getting fast service I have never got service this fast. I'm almost thinking this company lives next door to me. I'll comment later after I've gotten a chance to get used to it about how great the party is but it was packaged extremely professional it was packaged great very great so I have nothing bad to say!! That was 30 minutes after getting the phone but 4 days later a line appeared on the screen. I immediately contacted RECELL There were problems in communication right off the bat. I wasn't displeased right then, I know it's a business but in today's times. You can't expect a person to go without a phone for 2-3 days. Especially one that cost so much, I venture to say myself like most people don't understand the difference in a third party company on Amazon. And Amazon stores directly, I sent my previous phone in to, to have a discount rate on the new phone from "recell" but they are separate. So I would have no fall back phone they didn't care, I asked but there was no work around. Not to mention you can't talk to anybody directly, Everything has to be on email or through Amazon site. Where you have x amount of characters in which to type a message. The purchase description doesn't tell you all of these things! After all of this, I find out I'm only getting half or my $900/something Repayment. Because they say the phone was broken. It was not broken!  And it was not shipped broken, it was shipped in the same box my brand new phone was. My wife tried to tell me not to but I was trying to save money now I've paid more! You NEVER HAVE TO WORRY about me buying anything from you again!!

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: I purchased a Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 from (EXPORTTEK INC/ReNew Pros)  located at 410 FREEPORT PKWY, SUITE 100, COPPELL, TX 75019, US. I paid $612.47. I wish I would've been able to inspect this product before purchasing. You never know what you are going to get online. I received the phone in a timely manner and the appearance of the phone was excellent condition. I charged the phone fully and began to set the phone up. It did not come with a pen and within minutes the battery started dropping. After an hour the phone needed to be charged again. The phone couldn't even hold a charge! I reset the phone, repackaged it in its original packaging, and shipped the phone back immediately. This company has received the phone already, and told me once they have inspected it that they will issue a refund. This has not been the case. I have not received a refund and they have not responded to my latest inquiry. Not only did they send me a defective phone but they are trying to keep my money as well. I will be filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau, reporting this to Amazon, and making a statement on social media concerning their business practices. I do not recommend purchasing anything from this seller! I pray they can act like professionals and return the money that I have spent, but so far there is no hope.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold4 is a foldable smartphone that was released in August 2022. As a foldable phone, its key features revolve around the large, tablet-sized inner display and enhanced multitasking capabilities.
reviews: Previously bought Fold2 & Flip4 from Amazon Renew & they both came in excellent condition. The problem is that too much can go wrong with the hinge on folding phones. I learned my lesson on this Fold4. Excellent condition means no scratches on the screen, which it clearly has. I was willing to overlook, because the process to resolve it is long & tedious. But literally one week in the hinge failed & would not open flat. Also, all 3 folding phones I bought did not come with the screen protector Samsung strongly recommends for the inner screen. In this case I lost $39 because I had to buy one & then return the phone a week later. Be careful with the folders, especially the Fold4 which has a redesigned hinge. If you must have one, do your homework, & if you can hold out, buy new. That being said, the excellent condition brings with it 90 day return/refund so in that aspect it was a safe bet, but they can dock your refund for certain reasons. If you are watching reviews on phones keep in mind that everyone reviews phones when they first come out. What you're looking for is the "after one year", or "problems with the..." reviews. ;)

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4 5G US Version, 512GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)

SHOULD THIS BE THE NORM FOR THIS DEALER, ANYONE LOOKING AT THEIR 'FOR SALES,' DO NOT LOOK AT - STOP BY SITE, WALK VERY - VERY BRISKLY BEYOND THEM AND THEIRS! reviews: I've been needing to upgrade my phone and decided to purchase the Galaxy Flip 6 because of the affordable pricing on Amazon Renewed products and because the model android is still fairly new. This is my first Amazon renewed purchase and it went well, will probably buy other electronics this way too. The 90 day return policy gives peace of mind. After extensive comparisons on prices, conditions, availability and seller ratings, I decided on this seller. They had the best pricing for the condition listed. The phone arrived quickly, was well packaged and the phone quality is as described. The camera lens have no damage, the charging port and speakers are clean, main screen is perfect condition. There is one tiny scratch on the cover screen, but it's unnoticeable when the phone is on and doesn't impact function. The hinge does have a dent, which was concerning at first. But after inspection it seemed more cosmetic and doesn't effect the functionality of the phone. Which , to me, speaks to the durability of the phone. After using the phone for about a week, I'm glad I made the purchase and upgrade. Its nice to have the flip phone for making and ending phone calls, the slamming it shut satisfaction! The battery life is still operating at optimal performance for a second hand phone. Good experience with this seller!

reviews: Pristine. My current phone is a Galaxy S9, it's year 2025 and with pending tariffs, and an outdated camera that has ruined many vacation photos (not to mention dropping the phone in Santorini where it slided down tens of steps), I decided to upgrade. I don't believe in buying full price and I've had great experiences with renewed products. It was delivered to me by FedEx requiring signature. The FedEx delivery driver came to my door, knocked very gently and patiently waited until I could get decent to open the door. Then because I was putting on the screen protectors, I ended up inspecting the phone very carefully and because the Flip is a foldable phone, running the phone to explore the Cover Screen features. The condition is pristine, not a single scratch and the phone runs beautifully. I'm sure my amazement is partially from jumping from an S9 to a Z Flip 6 and not 100% contributable to the seller, however I'm very happy. One thing I want customers to be aware of the phone, and this is not about the seller, I didn't expect the thickness it is once it's folded. As a woman, when I put my S9 in my suit pant pocket, it hinders movement. Also, I'm a motorcycle rider and a slab phone in women's jeans front pockets (they are shallower than men's) is a pain in my butt and my thighs actually push the slab phone out of my front pocket. The big selling point for me for the Flip was the compactness, so the thickness really threw me off. Especially because I thought I'd be able to use Google Maps on the cover screen with my motorcycle mount and car mount but I realize that that is not an option because it's so thick. Nevertheless, the camera is a big jump from my S9 and I plan to keep it. I read on Reddit that even in 3 digit speeds, the phone stays open on a motorcycle so I'll find ways to use it on my motorcycle.

reviews: Great, Refurbished 2024 512GB like new Galaxy Z Flip6! My idea for buying this phone was to be able to have Energizer video camera feeds on the small cover screen to quickly and easily access my cameras. FYI Amazon sells Energizer video cameras for a very reasonable price. Sadly when I first bought the Flip6, I read in multiple 2024 reviews saying that the cover screen was very limited to running only a handful of very simple apps. Then I upgraded the Flip6's software to Android 16 and also installed all the associated Samsung update software. Still a no go for seeing Energizer camera feeds  on the phone's cover screen. Then I found Samsung's Good Lock app, installed it and in the "MultiStar tool", under "Life Up", press " Iâ¤ï¸ Galaxy Foldable", then "Launcher Widget", I quickly found that I could easily put ANY phone app on the cover screen, including the Energizer camera app. I can NOW get live Energizer camera video and audio feeds on the Flip6's cover screen! I can also easily and remotely physically move the Energizer Pan/Tilt camera's motorized view positioning system from the cover screen. Please see my pictures. Originally when first released  in 2024, the Flip6 got many poor reviews for the number and quality of apps able to be running on the cover screen. Another bonus, when I log in to Energizer camera feed on the top screen, then when I open the flip phone the Energizer camera feed is displayed full screen!! I was able in early Dec. 2025 to get a 512GB Flip6 in like new condition from Amazon for only $416!!! ?? Absolutely awesome! Thank you Amazon!

reviews: Bought this phone and it worked just fine for about 2 months and then suddenly after a samsung update it says that my carrier won't work with this phone although I bought it unlocked. What this company does is get old phones and refurbish them after being attached to other people's numbers and carrier, making it possible to be locked again to the person buying it through them...I would do research on this before buying. Although mine worked perfectly fine and so can yours, it has a high chance of getting locked again after a while or if a update is installed in your phone. The thing with these phones is even if you wipe and unlock them, it will ALWAYS be attached to the original person thay bought the phone. Funny thing is my 90 day warranty is almost up. If it would have done this after my warranty I would have been stuck with a phone that is useless and it being their fault.

reviews: Edit: Bought a second one and returned the original z flip 6. Both had deep scratches on the screen and chips on the back. I would avoid any flip phones from Amazon unless they are new.  I am deeply unsatisfied as I paid for a higher tier refurbished yet still had the same issues. It's unacceptable to lie on the condition.  This is my last time buying a used phone on Amazon. Product has constant crashings, slows down due to thermal throttling, and worst of all it had a giant scratch/dent in the bottom right corner! I wouldn't recommend buying an used phone unless it's in very good, like new, or perfect condition. I bought a refurbished â€“good condition phone and it came with a deep gash on the screen. Screen is nice, and big. Having two screens is a big plus. The battery life is acceptable, not a lot but not little. It's perfect weight for me (has some weight, I don't like super light phones). I would say it's not a good value for the money because replacing the screen costs more than the phone itself. Also, since it's second hand I don't get the discount $200 repair from Samsung.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 AI Cell Phone, 256GB Unlocked Android Smartphone, FlexCam, Photo Assist, Camcorder Mode, Live Interpreter, Foldable Design, 2024, Blue (Renewed)

reviews: Paid extra for "excellent quality". I have only had the phone for about two weeks, I have treated it like a baby, and its already starting to break. I know its not the phone, its the seller. I've bought older versions of this phone, all refurbished off Amazon, and I've always been pleased with the quality, so I feel safe to assume this is the sellers fault. Top centimeter of my phone screen flickers green when I turn my phone on/off. Early signs of a screen failure. After 2 weeks. Now I have to switch all my stuff back to my old phone and wait for a refund to buy a new one. Merry Christmas to me I guess. Samsung phones are fantastic, but I wouldn't trust this seller. Find someone else.

reviews: I mean, it's the most recommended phone on the planet it seems regarding android at least. I had it narrowed down between the oneplus 12/12r, pixel 8/8a and the galaxy s24. It's a hard pick, but when it came down to price, availability and software update schedule for refurbished, the galaxy s24 came through especially because I needed the 256GB version. The phone is as good as everyone reviews it to be. The camera is great, though this time it can actually auto focus unlike my s20 being sporadic. I really like the direction samsung is taking their software experience. Very useful apps and features, I don't feel like I'm missing out on anything important. Device care is one of my favorite tools. Maintenance mode is such an important feature. Diagnostics comes in clutch, I use it all the time to make sure my phone is in top shape and it does tell you when the battery life gets low as it did for me. When I got the phone, it got to work and automatically updated it's software to the latest versions all the way up to One UI 7 and android 15. Samsung plans to allow 7 years of updates I believe, which I'm all in favor for. I almost exclusively buy phones used or refurbished and even though 7+ years of updates may sound like a lot to some people or even excessive, it is perfect for people like I and many others who rely on used or refurbished phones. Last time I bought a refurbished phone, the s20 and I could only used it for 2 years before it will stop getting updates. Thank you samsung for  being a top contender in this area. I appreciate the fact they finally are keeping flat screens at least on some of their phone models. Curved screens became one of the most annoying things I've ever come across with a phone because it doesn't offer any improvements on function or easy of use and exposes my phone to more damage from drops and open sides. I want my phone case to fully protect my phone. Apple doesn't even do curved screens, get rid of them all samsung. I was hesistant to buy refurbished/renewed from amazon as you always hear mixed reviews for this kind of stuff, anywhere really. I did an exhaustive amount of research and finally got familiar with the pros, cons and what to actually look out for when buying refurbished so you have the best chance as getting what you actually want. Once you know what to look for, it's pretty simple, you just have to know which specific seller to buy from, but most importantly which to avoid. There are some red flag sellers out there and here on amazon, I suggest you do your due diligence and figure out who they all are. Macalegin or whatever their name is, is a great one though, just look at the seller's reviews and that should tell you most of what you need to know. I've been using samsung off and on since 2012 and they have improved so much over the years. Starting with the s20, I finally felt like I was able to experience the way android is supposed to be, smooth, fast, etc. Now with the s24, I feel as though I don't need to continue looking for a better android experience. It's already here.

reviews: I was a bit iffy about this product, and honestly, I still am as I'm typing this on my phone. But, it arrived in absolutely perfect condition. No scratches, and the packaging was just okay, but hey, it got here, and that's all that matters to me. It came with all necessary accessories. It had a screen protector that was too small for it.Everything worked, all the apps too. It did get pretty hot the first week, but then it cooled down. I had to update it a bunch; it wasn't updated at all. I also noticed something in the top and bottom speakers, but the audio is still amazing and totally blows my mind, especially coming from a mono loudspeaker. Overall, I totally recommend it. It still has 5 big updates left, so it's still current.

reviews: I really enjoy this phone, the battery life can go for 36 hours even with some pretty good use. However if you have your brightness on too high then it won't last as long. The phone is beautiful and sleek. It doesn't feel bulky or large in my pocket. I am able to add a phone wallet to the back and it still feels a good size. I promptly put it in a case, as I drop my phone all the time, and the screen hasn't cracked at all. Seems durable. The screen does not have a protector and I put this phone in my purse, pockets, dropped on the ground and it doesn't have any issues with scratches which I am very happy with. The camera is superb. Which, if I'm honest, is the biggest reason I bought a new phone. I am so happy with all the features this phone has.

I am placing the jury in the jury room for excellent, but I would give it a 8.8 or 10 on a rating scale from 1 to 10.  Overall, I think they are truthful and doing a pretty decent job on the ratings an product.  The shipping could be faster.

reviews: Phone was packaged well and arrived with no noticeable scratches or dings.  Battery is in good shape and lasts about 2.5 days on a charge with light use.  OS reports that battery is in good health.  No issues connecting to my Ubiquiti WiFi 7 AP on 2.5/5/6 GHz; peak link speed is over 2.6 Gbps.  Decent 5G coverage in my area which uses hybrid LTE/5G-NR radios; no weird call dropping.  No Bluetooth issues so far.  Speakers and microphone are clear. Phone was SIM locked to T-Mobile, which T-Mobile unlocked upon request in person.  No problem reflashing firmware to the U1 edition with Odin, which removes a lot of the T-Mobile bloatware.  Works great with Mint Mobile. In comparison to my older Galaxy S10e: glad to see the rounded screen corners and Bixby button gone.  The screen auto-brightness and fingerprint reader work much better.  The S-View cover doesn't support touch, but it doesn't block the rear camera anymore, either.  The Gemini AI stuff is everywhere and is difficult to remove.  Samsung is more insistent on you creating and linking a Samsung account.  A number of home screen widgets have weird font issues.  Using a USB-C headphone dongle is annoying and I'm worried that the USB-C port will break over time.

reviews: A few little dings in the metal around the camera lenses,  but no other immediately visible scratches. Some issues with biometrics, so I assume the screen was replaced and the sensor is slightly off. I use pattern unlock so it won't be an issue for me personally. Couldnt get it to connect with my mobile network on my own, but I took it to one of my networks store locations and the lady there called their tech department and the 2 of them were able to get it sorted out for me. 4 stars for the minor damage as the lady at the store said there's been a lot of bring your own phone issues recently on my network so I'm blaming the network related issues on that. Color matches the listing. Phone purchased for use in the US on T-mobile. This review is being posted within 48 hours of receiving. If I have further additions I will mark them as an edit at the end of this review.
