reviews: Be careful buying "unlocked" unless it's factory unlocked. While it may work on any network you will not receive updates for the phone if it was previously locked to another network because the software is locked to a network. My phone was telling me it was up to date even though it was on Android 14 rather than Android 16. I did a few hours of research on Reddit and learned the above information and how to fix it. It requires downloading Samsung firmware from Frija and a program called ODIN and reformatting the phones software. It's not hard but it is time consuming. If your not up for the challenge, skip this device. From my research it seems to only be the s24 models with this problem. The only reason I did not return the phone was it was in excellent condition and I paid $350 for it so it still seemed like steal even with 8hra of my life dedicated to fixing it.

I was also unlucky as they shipped my device without a SIM card tray and I had to wait an extra week for that to be delivered.

reviews: Phone arrived in great physical condition, but the listing was misleading. Although sold as â€œunlocked,â€ the phone was stuck on Android 14. Samsung already says this model should be running Android 16, yet the phone claimed it was â€œup to dateâ€ and would not update. After hours of research, I learned it is still controlled by the previous carrier, meaning it will never receive Android updates under normal use. Checking the serial number or IMEI does not warn you about this. Another review mentioned this exact issue and they were 100% right. Fixing this cost me hours of my own time, and shipping was also delayed. If you want a phone that actually updates, buy a true factory-unlocked (U1) model.

reviews: The phone itself was beautiful. In perfect condition. This is surprising since it came shipped in nothing more than a plastic sleeve and a doubled over bubble wrap mailer. This phone was supposed to be unlocked. It was not. I did some investigating and it turned out to be locked to T-Mobile. I tried calling them and they couldn't remove the lock because the account attached to the phone had a balance due. I immediately requested a refund from the seller and mailed the phone back in the original packaging. This is irresponsible of the seller. They are advertising locked phones as unlocked.

reviews: I purchased a refurbished Samsung Galaxy S24, and while it arrived in great condition, thereâ€™s a major issue: the phone is not fully unlocked. I keep getting a notification that some features arenâ€™t available because Iâ€™m using a non-Verizon SIM card. I reached out to Amazon customer support, and they initially offered a refund without returning the phone, but later changed their stance and now want me to return it and wait a month for a replacement. This has been frustrating. Pros: Phone in good condition Great performance and camera Cons: Not fully unlocked, with issues using a non-Verizon SIM Frustrating customer service experience Wouldâ€™ve been a great phone if not for the unlocking issue.

reviews: Since shortly after purchase, the device has had serious and persistent performance issues that make it unreliable for basic daily use. Specifically: â€¢ GPS functionality fails approximately 90% of the time â€¢ Cellular reception is extremely poor or nonexistent, despite the fact that I live in a city where normal cellular coverage is strong and reliable â€¢ I cannot reliably make calls, use navigation, or access mobile dataâ€”even in areas where reception should not be an issue These are fundamental functions of a smartphone, and the failure of both GPS and cellular reception has made this device unusable for its intended purpose. This has caused ongoing inconvenience, wasted time, and significant frustration.

reviews: 0 stars if i could. Phone was in great shape but Not unlocked as it was stated. Seller did not want to make situation right  and i was forced to return for full refund (pending). I would stay away from this seller and read the most recent reviews before  making a purchase. Especially if you do not have another phone to switch back to.

reviews: Phone was supposed to be unlocked.  Got this phone to upgrade my older Galaxy S9. Newer phone use a digital Simm card instead of a physical card. So once I tried to activate this S24 that was actually locked it canceled my physical Simm card. I was left with no working phone. I was forced to either buy another Simm card or buy a phone from my carrier.  I couldn't wait weeks to gamble if another "unlocked" phone was actually unlocked.  So this whole purchase was horrible and very inconvenient.  Don't fall for the same mistake.

reviews: I purchased this phone on Amazon. Apparently it is fulfilled by a third party. I received the phone and transferred my SIM card from old phone to the new phone and could not make or receive calls. I tried to switch the SIM card back to my old phone and could not use that phone anymore. I went to the Verizon store and was told my account was suspended because the device ID came back to a stolen phone or one that had a unpaid balance associated with it and it could not be activated. It was a real hassle to get my account unlocked. It was kind of a nightmare. I also had to pay $20.00 dollars to ship it back to them, for a phone they should have known had issues, and they may change me a restocking fee!

reviews: UNFAIR RESTOCKING FEE. The phone was in excellent condition yet it would drop the network signal consistently. I was unable to make calls out or take calls. I also had issues with audio and apps dropping signals. I returned the phone and the seller charged me a $379.99 restocking fee. The seller said the return phone had a screen lock and I wouldn't get a refund until I  send them my security screen lock pattern code. I informed the seller that I had factory reset the phone twice before sending it back. After communicating with seller I went into the accounts I used to set up that phone and it showed that I didn't install a pattern lock on that phone. It also showed that I was signed out from all activity on that phone. Seller has refused to refund me the $379.99.

title: Samsung Galaxy S23+ Plus 5G, US Version, 256GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S23+ SM-S916U is a flagship smartphone with a modern design and a spacious display, delivering vibrant visuals and efficient performance thanks to its powerful processor. The device excels in capturing moments with its advanced camera setup, offering high-quality photos and videos in various lighting conditions. Connectivity options are diverse, ensuring seamless communication and internet access. User convenience is a priority, reflected in the intuitive interface and customization options. The smartphone's robust battery provides long-lasting usage, making it an appealing choice for those seeking a premium and reliable mobile experience.
reviews: My phone arrived undamaged, in perfect condition!  I waited to do this review until I had it for a bit to make sure everything worked right. Well....IT'S AMAZING!!! The phone was not damaged in any way.  It looked like a brand new phone, right out of the box!  Not only that, but it functions flawlessly.  I don't use all of the features (and it has a lot of them), mostly because I don't do social media stuff, or take many pictures.  However, taking pictures is absolutely amazing!  There are sooooo many options: like filters, colors, cropping, picture size, frame size, etc.  There's just a ton of them. There is also Biometric features, which I appreciate.  I had the S9+ and the fingerprint reader was on the back.  If you use the fingerprint feature on this phone, make sure you set a passcode or pin as well.  The fingerprint reader is on the screen.  It shows as a pop-up.  Of course you have to go through the fingerprint set-up first, and can choose more than one finger/thumb.  My concern is that if the screen gets damaged where the reader is, the screen probably wouldn't be able to be able to read your print.  It does NOT have an iris scanner. This IS a 5G phone, but it can connect to 4G and other networks as well. I believe there might have been a SIM card, but I honestly don't remember.  I took the SIM from my other phone and put it in this one, so I didn't need it anyway.  I use AT&T pre-paid, and it works fine.  Right out of the box.  I don't know if it's unlocked to a variety of different network or service providers.  My service provider is AT&T, and the phone I got from this seller is also AT&T.  My recommendation to anyone considering purchasing this phone, would be to contact the seller, first and ask about supported service providers.  If you have AT&T, it's a total win!  :) This phone charges super fast, and the battery life is fabulous.  For my usage, anyway.  You absolutely have to use a fast charging cable, or you'll ruin your phone.  I believe it came with a USB cable, but I can't remember if the block was included.  Either way, if you need to get a charging block, and/or cable, MAKE SURE they're fast charging!!!  I thought the cable it came with was too short for my needs, so I bought a new one on Amazon that is specifically for the S23+...and phones like it. Another recommendation I have is to get an Otterbox.  BEFORE you start using the phone.  If you drop it, then a lot of money was spent for nothing.  The camera lenses on the back protrude.  I personally have the Otterbox Defender series, as the case itself prevents the camera lenses from touching any surface when you lay the phone down.  It's the same if you lay it face down.  The cover prevents the face from touching the surface of anything.  I would seriously consider getting a high quality case with this phone, instead of a cheap knock-off.  (Not all cases are created equal.)  The phone is constructed of metal, not plastic, so it feels very well made.  It's not a light phone, but not super heavy, either.  At least to me. The phone doesn't come in an original box.  At least mine didn't.  It came with the phone and charging cable.  I can't remember if it came with the little key that opens the SIM slot.  If it doesn't, you'll need to get one.  It also doesn't come with a manual.  Also, unless you get the S23 Ultra, there is no stylus.  If that's what you're looking for, the S23+ doesn't have that capability at all.  You aren't able to get an S Pen with it, as the S Pen wouldn't function, even if you bought one and tried. I would also like to mention that it's super easy to transfer your data and contacts (and whatever else) to the S23+.  I don't have any idea about transferring from an Apple product, though.  Samsung is my go-to for phones. As for settings, there are too many to list.  There is a specific one for the battery that I would like to mention, however.  It makes it so your phone doesn't charge over 80% when fully charged, which is important.  The phone won't overcharge that way and end up ruining your battery. As for call settings, there are a lot of those as well.  For people that are hard of hearing, there are options for that.  If, on the other hand, you'd like to protect your hearing and how loud the phone can get while listening to music or talking on it, you can limit the volume.  It has features for the blind, but I don't know what that entails.  It also has the car feature, but I don't know anything about that.  I don't drive. I hope this review was helpful.  :)

reviews: Phone came in perfect condition, everything works.  After reading the other reviews, one tip for anyone buying a refurbished phone that's unlocked, an unlocked phone does NOT mean it's an UNLOCKED SIM CARD, in fact,  mine didn't have a SIM card at all, which is fine with me, I had a SIM card already.  But SIM cards are often locked to a specific carrier even if the phone is not. So make sure you have a nano SIM card ready to use, even if it comes with one pre-installed, it may not be for your carrier. I used AI to give me a checklist to make sure all was good.  I suggest you do the same.  I got the "Excellent" tier and my phone definitely aligns with that but was way cheaper. Only complaint is that Amazon shipped it like a snail.  This is NOT an issue with the seller,  this is Amazon corporate making decisions on what they feel is most efficient and cost-effective, but when you're ordering a phone, you likely need it fast. And while if I order something dumb like post it notes and cotton candy flavored peanuts, they treat it like a life or death situation like it's a heart transplant and the clock is ticking, for this phone they were like "You can wait, there's no rush". But the seller gave me a great deal on a great item, so I can recommend you buy this still,  just be prepared to wait up to a week to get to you

reviews: The Galaxy S23+ was an impromptu upgrade after I dropped my Galaxy s10e, and it kept disconnecting the carrier sim. This is my first time buying a renewed phone, so I was a bit worried I might end up with a defective phone or one with cosmetic damage, which I can't really stand. ðŸ˜… I went for the phone locked to AT&T just in case I ran into any issues. The phone arrived faster than expected. It came in a simple box, and the phone was wrapped in bubble wrap. It came with a usb-c cord for charging and sim tool. I was blown away by the condition of this phone. Phone condition is practically FLAWLESS--only very small, barely noticeable scratches around the charging port. The screen is in stellar condition. Like getting a brand-new phone. The phone was already charged to 67% out of the box. Setup was seamless, and the carrier sim card was recognized without issue. I didn't have to contact AT&T. Wireless data transfer went very smoothly, and I was able to connect to my other Samsung devices (Buds Pro 2, Tablet S8, & s10e). So far, the phone is very responsive. I don't usually pay attention to battery life for any of my Samsung devices, since I usually have chargers or powerbanks on-hand, but the battery life is really good! Lasting all day after intermittent use--from 100% at 8 in the morning to 74% by 5:40 pm. I think I will definitely go this route again in the future. I saved so much money, and it was totally worth the buy.

reviews: I needed a phone that would connect via BT to my hearing aids.  This model was approved by by hearing aid manufacturer.  I bought a renewed phone to economize on price, and the phone met the description.  I am happy with the performance - very fast compared to my older A51 model.  It is a bit heavier, but the frame is metal vs plastic, so that is expected.  Battery life is very good - easily one full day with a lot of use. The only negative I have is that the fingerprint feature doesn't work well.  I have re-learned the finger print several times and it works at first but then stops recognizing correctly.  So now I swipe up and have it recognize my face - that works perfectly.

reviews: This was a great deal for the price, good memory, and the color was a bonus. BUT if you don't have a new enough car that is Android Auto compatible, this phone cannot be used handsfree while driving. It requires the caller to constantly sign in/unlock. (My workaround is to have Google Maps open for every single trip, to keep the phone awake. Huge inconvenience to remember to set up Directions every single drive.) There are whole Reddit threads to how poor this function is on this particular model. This was my third Samsung, but rather than buy a whole new car, for this price I'm going to search for a different brand.

reviews: Wow what a piece of garage. Who in their right mind thought replacing a hardware finger print scanner with some touch screen knock off was a good idea?  Works about 90 % of no.  It pretty much never works. Once on, the phone is slow and sluggish. It's totally bloated with Samsung wear you can't get rid of much of which is running in the background reporting your every move. (don't belive it, install duckduckgo browser and turn on app tracking blocker, see what comes up). My TCL 30V 5g was faster.  Screen touches where the app clearly responds do nothing. Long press for cut / copy / paste is laggy. Camera is Meh at best (considering all the hype). If security is important to you look elsewhere. The lack of a dedicated hardware  fingerprint reader is a deal breaker. This was my first Samsung in a phone going back to 08. It will probably be much last. At least this price, things should actually work. Too many thongs here don't.

reviews: Beware of the return policy.  I purchased this phone in October 2025, and it worked until January 2026.It will no longer charge completely.  The listing now shows a 90 day return policy so I tried to get a replacement.  I am told that Amazon changed their return policy for October 2025 to 30 days rather than 90 days so I don't qualify for a replacement.  It was changed back to 90 days in November.  Very convenient!  I am screwed. $300.00 + for a phone that didn't even last 90 days.

reviews: BEWARE! When ordering this phone it is said to be unlocked renewed. The phone I received was not truly unlocked and took 8 months for us to find there was a restriction on the phone.  The phone was FORCED unlocked which means it will not update.  The phone I received model name is SM-S916U and locked to T Mobile.  An UNLOCKED phone is SM-S916U1 and can get updates.  Samsung, Mint, or Amazon cannot remove the restriction.  Make sure U1 is on the model name to get an unlocked phone. It came be sold as unlocked and not be.  Check the model send it back immediately if it is the wrong model.  I learned the hard way.  I had to choose 1 star.

reviews: HORRID SELLER, Fantastic phone. My phone started malfunctioning within a month, but seller refused to honor the Amazon Renewed Warranty. Fantastic phone, When I had to reluctantly, suddenly & unexpectedly upgrade my zflip 3 to a zflip 5 Renewed was my only option. I'm cost conscious & purchase most of my electronics from Amazon Renewed & have have been a very satisfied customer for around a decade.  This was the 1st time I've encountered an untrustworthy seller. Basically they said "You received a product & that's the only thing we guarantee. Your case is closed" I'm quite impressed with how useful the outer screen is. We couldn't hold full conversations through text with the zflip 3 so this new upgrade was a fantastic surprise. I got the zflip 3 simply for aesthetics, but I've been thrilled with how useful this line is which is why I'd  decided to only purchase flips from now on.

reviews: This phone is very cool phone. My wife loves it. She loves it because it folds of course. The build quality again of course top teir its samsung after all. The gorilla glass victus 2 gives you the glass protection you need. The build of the phone top teir the aluminum body of the phone makes it light and strong. The hinge is very strong as well compared to the moto razr that is made out of steel. The z flip 5 has the latest chipset. It is flawless butter smooth scrolling speed. The screen becoms very bright. The camera is what you would expect from samsung would be awsome it had the 23 ultra camera but because of the size of the phone it would very goofy with those big camera circles like the 23 ultra or the iphone 14 or15. The features are not gimmicky my wife loves tpee mode it is super cool my wife uses it all the time. I just wish you could do everything on the front screen as you could with the phone open. The 1 major downside to this phone is the battery life it is not very good other than that it is an all around really fun and durable phone to use. I would recommend this phone becasue as i said before its fun to use it is a durable phone it packs all latest processing speed strength pretty good camera and build quality. If you are looking for a folding phone with all the latest and greatest. If you want a folding that you can use and not be so limited on its capabilities this is the phone. The zfold is i think not functioning the tablet screen is i believe to much. Most people would not open the phone too often its there if you want but in day to day use its not usable i think and also that phone is super heavy who wants that and the front screen is too narrow. The razr is made from plastic body and steel hindge makes it heavy as well. The google fold is small i think and to wide. The zflip 5 is everything you would want in a foldable. Usefulness screen size is perfect when its folded when open screen is not narrow and odd looking. Not a heavy phone. The gap when folded is completely from 1 end to the other so there will not be any unexpected unfold. For the price here its a steal and amazon provides a pretty good buy back program if you have unused samsung phones or want to upgrade its a great opportunity to get rid of phones to get nice money off of this phone more than it already is. Overall i would get this phone there are way more positive things than negative.

reviews: This phone wad something I was very excited to receive when I first purchased it. As soon as I got it I noticed that the sides are kind of flimsy and the crease is extremely noticeable but I never really cared much about the crease. The functionality of the phone is good, I've had no issues whatsoever so far. If you dont like how the phone has a screen on the back then this might not be the phone for you! The condition of the phone itself when it arrived was good, it's important to note to be gentle with the front of the phone as it could get damaged with opening and closing it. Sound quality was just fine as was everything else. Overall I think it's a good purchase.

reviews: Note: An earlier version of this review erroneously referred to the phone as a Z Fold 5, when in fact this was a Z Flip 5. There was one tiny problem with the device when I got it. A piece of rubber was sticking out of the side by the hinge in a way it wasn't supposed to, and I couldn't put it back. It did not seem to hinder use of the phone so I never bothered to report it, but given the 'excellent' condition it was supposed to be in I expected better. But the phone was otherwise pristine and has been working a charm ever since I got it. Phone is on par with all other flagship Android devices of the era, but does suffer from subpar battery life and only ALMOST stellar camera lenses. But if you love Samsung Galaxy smartphones and don't mind its limitations, and don't mind small QA issues, then getting an Amazon Renewed Z Flip is the way to go!

reviews: I got this phone refurbished for 500 dollars after getting bored of an iPhone 12 Pro. Battery life gets me through the entire day with 50% remaining, but if I don't reboot it after a while it drains nearly all the battery in a day. The flipping is awesome. Cover screen quality is good, if a little low resolution, but it's not too noticeable. Inner screen is great. Hinge has a bit of play but nothing major. The sides where the hinge is has a weird little ribbon thingy that gets a little annoying sometimes. Face recognition is a joke, might as well not have it at all. Fingerprint reader is perfect. Cameras are just okay. They chose an ultra wide lens instead of a telephoto for whatever reason. I never use ultra wide, but I use zoom a LOT. The 1x lens is fine but low light sucks. I am glad I got this below its 1000 price point because I would have hated to spend this much. Will probably be going back to a slab for my next phone. Never Apple again though, iOS sucks.

reviews: I have been looking to upgrade my phone for a while now and had my eyes set on the Z Flip 5. I saw the price on this refurbished Z Flip 5 and couldn't pass up the deal. Refurbished in "excellent" condition for less than $600, what a deal! I thought "excellent" condition meant maybe there'd be some scratches on the phone or maybe like some minor cosmetic damage to the sides of the phone. I received a phone with a crack along the entire width of the inner screen just above the crease. So not exactly the "excellent" condition that I had expected. That is my only complaint, though. Shipping: FAST Cost: Reasonable Value: Great Overall score: 4 out of 5 stars. I would subtract 2 points for the cracked screen (making the score a 2 out of 5 stars), but the phone is still fully usable.

reviews: This is my dream phone so I rushed into buying it. There was a crack in the screen but it works fine. I'm an Apple user so I'm still adjusting. Personally, not worth $400 (with taxes), it should be less. I haven't put a SIM card in yet but it works with all serviced in the US and can take both SIM and eSIM. The Face ID unlock and Touch ID work great and the phone is overall in good shape besides the crack in the screen. Don't get it if you are looking for a perfect phone but it works as a burner phone and actually fits in girl's pockets. Easy to connect to WiFi. Lavender color is cute but get a clear case.

reviews: Well I purchased the Galaxy Z 5 flip and was refurbished in excellent condition. I really enjoyed this phone until 5 months later my screen completely blacked out, I can only use the small screen now. I have been very careful with this phone and took great care of the phone so I don't understand why the phone screen just blacked out like that. Now I have to buy a whole new phone because it only had a 90 day returned window which is over. I will definitely not buy from them again. I just went a head and ordered an unlocked Galaxy Z 6 flip to replace this phone but this time I paid the $200 for the two year protection because apparently these phone are known to have this problem and buying the lastest model has better chances of not being constantly flipped open. It says these phones can be flipped open 200,000 times or last 10 years ðŸ¤£ðŸ˜‚ mine lasted not even 5 months. So if you buy this phone even though its an extra $200, definitely buy the protection. If I would've bought the protection for $200 then I definitely wouldn't have been  spending almost $1000 as of yesterday for a new phone and protection. Do not buy this phone without the two year protection warranty. They also have a protection plan for $9.99 a month of you can afford the $200 for two years. Your carrier will not replace an unlocked phone that you add to your plan unless you buy it directly from them. So the two year protection is definitely worth it unless you like spending another $1000 after spending $600 on a phone in a 5 months period. That's $1600 I have spent on phones in 5 months. I really wish I knew I could buy the two year protection in the first place and that I would need it with this phone, it would've saved me $1000. That's why I'm telling whoever reads this, please buy the two year protection they offer on electronics.

reviews: I really enjoyed this phone until the screen completely stopped working two weeks after I received it. The phone would turn on and the outside screen worked, however, the entire inside screen went black all of the sudden and wouldnâ€™t work at all despite trying to reset it. Thereâ€™s no evident reason for why it stopped working, I didnâ€™t drop it or anything like that. I was advised by a phone repair store to return it since the repair was going to cost more than I originally spent on the phone as I would have to completely replace the screen. After returning it, the company refused to refund me stating that the phone was damaged which is the whole reason why I was returning it in the first place as it was in the condition that I had received it in. Thereâ€™s no physical damage to the phone at all, just that the screen wouldnâ€™t work. Not happy at all with this product nor the customer service I received and would not recommend buying from this seller.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: It's always a gamble buying a phone that's renewed/refurbished, because you hope you're going to get what the seller actually promises (as opposed to a disappointing/broken/non-working product). This isn't my first refurbished phone, but I'm always a little anxious spending the money on something I HOPE is going to be good (as opposed to brand-new/unused). I bought this phone in refurbished/excellent condition. After reading multiple reviews on multiple refurbished phone listings on Amazon, my biggest concern was (always is) getting one with a damaged screen, cameras, or having it not truly be unlocked. I've had this phone less than 24 hours, but here's my take SO far (I can't speak for other people, these are just my experiences): 1) Yes, it was (for me) truly, 100% unlocked. Not even an ex-carrier logo when I first turned it on! (My previous 'unlocked' refurbished phone has a T-Mobile logo when turned on) I was quite happy/impressed about this. 2) No scratches (that I could see) on the front/touchscreen. There are multiple, TINY scuffs on the sides (not part of the touchscreen)/top edge/bottom edge of the phone - which I fully expected w/ a refurbished phone, and I'm totally fine with it (and this is if I'm REALLY nitpicking - they're really not that bad, though. It's just not FLAWLESS, which - again - I'm fine with). 3) 99% flawless on the backside - the ONLY thing I can see is a TINY scuff on the edge of one of the cameras (not the actual camera/glass screen itself), and this is cosmetic - it doesn't affect the quality of the camera (that I've noticed). 4) S-Pen pops out like it should, seems to be fine. 5) Charges just fine so far - both wireless and wired. 6) Popped in my SIM card (US Mobile, uses T-Mobile network), and it worked instantly. No phone/SIM-related problems so far. Everything - and I mean everything (data, wallpapers, photos, Samsung Notes from my previous phone, sounds/ringtones, apps, folders, etc) - transferred from my old phone perfectly (Samsung Smart Switch app). 7) Fingerprint reader works fine for me so far - and that's with a plastic-y (TPU?) screen protector that I put on it. I haven't noticed any real issues thus far - if anything changes, I'll update my review. OVERALL: For me, yes it's definitely worth the money. If you're considering it and you're on the fence (and I understand why you might be), I say go for it. I'm very satisfied, hopefully nothing changes in time. Buying refurbished is a great way (in theory, lol) to save money while still getting a phone you really want (I think they're normally way overpriced anyway). Shipping was great (got mine the next day!), no issues with packaging (very safe/secure), and the phone - while not literally FLAWLESS - still looks great, works great, and I look forward to using it for a long time to come! A great buy overall!

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: I was a little apprehensive spending more on a used phone than I spent on my new OnePlus 6T 4 years ago. I'd done the research and decided on the Galaxy S22 Ultra (mostly for the phone capabilities) but wasn't willing to spend $1200, so I took a chance on a refurb unit. I've had it for a couple days now and I can say it was one of my better purchases. The phone arrived a day early, well packaged, and included the phone(w/37% battery charge), an adaptive fast charger, a cheap usb c charging cable, and sim removal tool. After close inspection, the phone showed no signs of prior ownership. It was in pristine condition just like new. It started right up and I got through the setup process. Being an unlocked phone,I figured I could just throw in my Cricket sim card and be ready to go. Cricket recognized the phone straight away, reminded me to turn on wireless calling, and I was back in business. Now let's get it charged up. I plugged in my OP6T usb c cable and powerpack out of habit and started messing with settings when I ran across the battery settings. It showed 2 hour, 13 minutes until fully charged. Ok, lets try the included charger and cable. I setup the included charging rig and the charging time was reduced to 42 minutes. Sweet!... until it wasn't. With the phone fully charged, I went to unplug the charger only to find it stuck in the phones usb port. No amount of wiggling in any direction would free it. Time to turn to Google for a solution. Not much help there other than someone suggesting sending the phone in for charging port replacement after suggesting the fast charger combined with a cheap cable may have allowed an arc to form in the port effectively "welding" the cable to the port. Panic set in as I resumed the wiggling process. I finally decided to pull harder and dislodge it, whatever the outcome. It came out finally. I plugged in my "good" cable and it showed "charged" so I knew it was working. I quickly disposed of the cheap usb cable so it could cause to more harm. Crisis averted. I can tell that the signal reception is much better than I had with my old phone. My old phone had good early morning reception where I work but it was shut down at 9:30 A.M. for the rest of the day. I was happy to see that was no longer the case with this phone. I had useable signal even inside the building. That in itself is huge to me. This a is a large phone. I work construction and wear carpenter jeans (with the pocket on the right leg) and all my previous phones slid right in that pocket with a slim case. This phone will barely fit naked. With the case I bought for it, it won't even begin to fit. Luckily the Unicorn Beetle Pro case has the belt clip so I can still carry it while at work... although I'm not a fan of the belt clip method. The case is very protective but makes the phone even huge(er). I have a slim case on order. The phone itself is fast, responsive and beautiful with more bells and whistles than any phone I've owned to date. It's going to take some time to start learning the tips and tricks that make this phone stand out from the crowd, otherwise it's a waste of this phones "talent". I'm hoping my luck and the longevity of the phone will keep this as my daily driver for years to come as Samsung has promised four generations of One UI and Android OS upgrades. (tl:dr) It's a big glorious phone sent safely at a good price. IMO... if you can swing the price, don't hesitate.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: I just received my S22 Ultra yesterday, and Iâ€™m really impressed. It arrived in good condition with only very minor signs of normal wear and tearâ€”nothing too noticeable at all. Originally, I wanted more than 128GB of storage since I take a lot of pictures, but I upgraded from the S22 Plus (also 128GB) which felt okay to me BUT honestly, the space is still enough for the average person. I use a lot of photo editing apps and take plenty of pictures, and so far I havenâ€™t run into any storage issues. The phone works beautifully, especially with the S Penâ€”itâ€™s perfect for quick drawings or notes on the go. The camera is definitely a highlight. Iâ€™m loving the night mode feature, which really brightens up photos taken in low light. Plus, the photo settings are super customizable, and you can even create your own filters from images. Overall, for just $300 on Amazon, I was surprised by how premium it feels and the fact that its unlocked. NOT GSM BUT UNLOCKED. Even though it's a 2022 model, coming from the S22 Plus, this upgrade makes it feel like Iâ€™m carrying a fancy camera around. Totally worth it. Treat yourself.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: The first phone I received from this seller appeared to be in excellent condition, but it turned out to have a serious problem, that I'm now learning is very common. The phone would work great on WiFi, but would STRUGGLE to maintain service anywhere outside of my house. I would have service about 1/10th of the time, and could NEVER get through a phone call without it dropping, when I could even get through. Although they should have caught this, I can't fully blame the seller (which is why I gave 3 stars for a basically useless phone... which otherwise would be awesome... ya know, if it worked) because this is the 4th phone (3 - S22 Ultra's, 1 - Note 20 Ultra) I've had the exact same issue with over the last 2 years. I ordered a temporary phone to get me through while I return this one and wait for a replacement, so I'll update when I receive the next one... UPDATE: I'm raising my rating to 4 stars. The second phone arrived yesterday and so far it seems to be excellent. If any issues arise with the new phone I'll be sure to come back, but I'm hoping this is the last S22 I'll ever order...

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)

reviews: Well itâ€™s written that itâ€™s unlocked but it wasnâ€™t. I contacted them and they answered 2-3 days if I remember it correctly. Luckily they gave me the NETWORK PIN CODE. So just to be sure that YOU CONTACT AND ASK THEM FOR IT. But for the value for money, this is WORTH IT! Yes it had some scratches here and there but I donâ€™t mind. Itâ€™s just in the sides and bottom of the phone anyway, and I use case so it doesnâ€™t bother me that much. I bought this phone to have another ANDROID phone since I have more faith in android than iPhone (sorry fans), because for me it does more, and I can do more in android. So coming from iPhone mini 12, to S22U, itâ€™s not that easy in size difference. But the phone itself is easy to use. it comes with cord and CHARGER BRICK! It's C to C charger as well! Thank you for that, I got the fast charger out of the box!! I canâ€™t say about durability because from what I know, the phone that has been opened or â€œrenewedâ€ is not as durable as the new one especially when it comes to WATER RESISTANCE. But other than that, I guess this is STILL AN AWESOME SAMSUNG PHONE FOR 2024. Been using it since July. So I can really say it's a good buy. Edit: Sept 2025 now. My phone fell not from so high, usually from my sling bag or from my hand when my nephew's accidentally bump in to me, it got crack on its back. Buuuut still works great. How I deal with it? My case is usually clear since then, because I want to show color or photos behind my phone. So the solution? UPGRADE.... just the color though! Phone works fine so why change?! Hahahaha! Just get a skin! In a span of a year, I made my black phone to BLUE and MINT (GREEN). Currently mint green as of now. ðŸ˜

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: Phone arrived on time and in good packaging and as promised it appeared to be in great condition. No scratched screen or noticable flaws to be seen. It had enough charge to fire it up right out of the box but came with a charging cord also (charging box not included) I don't notice anything off at first, or maybe I did but I dismissed the glitchyness as my own doing. Thinking I must be pushing a button or in some other way activating a feature I was not intending to activate. Afterall this was a new device I was getting use to and a very big upgrade to the refurbished galaxy s9 w the very cracked screen running android 10 I was using previously. However it's been some time now and I'm sure that the glitches are not due to my usage or misusage. I have to restart the device about 10 times a day on average because to will randomly decide to not accept my touch commands and will only respond to the s-pen touch/control. This can get very frustrating since the ability to walk around with my little pen out tapping away at the phone screen is not always conducive  to my activities. I have not contacted customer service on this matter yet so I do not know if its a software issue or something. I likey will however be reaching out to them soon and will update my review with further insight if available. Other than the glitch the phone is very nice. The material is sturdy and sleek. The look screams of classic charm and beauty in line with the rest of the Samsung Galaxy family. It's got 5G capabilities and connects easily. Downloads quick  has the Samsung Knox enables for greats security. Large screen so streaming or playing games is great. The sellar shipped it out very quickly and it arrived on time. No issues with shipping. Last but not least (well in this case maybe it is least as well) I did a lot of research before deciding what type of phone to buy, I'm kinda thrift and do not buy things of any significant cost for myself without thoroughly looking into first. Then after I learn what I need to learn I spend a lot more time (and I do mean a lot!!!) searching through different sellers on dozens of sites and apps and stores (online and in person), checking with friends and friends of friends, searching social media......etc....lookibg for the absolute best deal I can find. And wen I look at a deal I factor in every bit of relative detail. Like the storage capacity, memory/ram, connectivity, FRS, refresh rate.....pretty much all the specs that affect the performance and I can say with confidence, if ur looking into the S22 ultra, this is the best deal you will find.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: First off, Iâ€™m knocking down two stars right away because it didnâ€™t even come with a SIM card removal tool. Took me 7 hours to find something small enough and strong enough to open the tray. That alone had me absolutely irritated and mad â€” a basic item that shouldâ€™ve been included. As far as the looks of the phone, it was in rough shape. Major wear and tear on the bottom â€” the paint looked rubbed off and faded, showing gray instead of black along the bottom bezel. There was some horrible sticker slapped on the back that I still canâ€™t fully remove, no matter how much I scrub. It looked like someone used it hard, slapped a wipe on it, and called it â€œrefurbished.â€ Battery life? Terrible. My old phone â€” which had less battery capacity â€” outlasts this one by hours. So clearly, no real battery replacement was done. It feels like they just cleaned it up with a little rubbing alcohol and shipped it out. As for performance, it gets hot pretty fast and sometimes lags even with basic tasks. And donâ€™t even get me started on the fingerprint reader â€” works when it wants to, and that's not often. This phone is clearly not â€œgently usedâ€ or â€œcertified refurbishedâ€ â€” it's more like â€œbarely salvaged.â€ If you're expecting quality control or care in presentation, look elsewhere. This felt like a quick flip with no attention to detail. Highly disappointed.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: This is probably my favorite Galaxy that I've owned so far. The camera is absolutely amazing. It's lightening fast and never lags, freezes or any of that crap. I definitely recommend a screen protector!!!! because these screens with the curved edges can get REALLY pricey to replace... at one point I was tempted to just buy a whole new phone. Anyway, love the phone!!!! and then all of the sudden...... the screen went black on me for no reason. It wasn't cracked or anything... so i thought, maybe it just died?  i didnt recall the battery being so low though.. well , even the charging circle didnt pop up when i plugged it in, BUT it vibrated. it also vibrated when i pulled the s pen out. ok, so the phone is on.... the screen isn't working... but why? there is no reason for the screen to be black... while attempting to unlock my old s10+ through Samsung mobile i , for whatever reason, clicked play sound to find my s22.. it didnt ring. why?!???! it is enabled to be found.. the location and everything was on. whats going  on? welllllllp. after trouble shooting and symptom checking i discovered that my motherboard is failing. and its a really common problem with the s22 ultra! so my favorite phone.... has a motherboard issue. I just hope i can get all of my data off of it, and i hope that everything is backed up. it flashed on for a few minutes and i synced back ups but I'm not sure it actually finished before the screen blacked out again, or if it continued while blacked out.. anyway, this really really sucks. BEWARE of this issue and if you decide to buy this phone anyway MAKE SURE YOU REGULARLY BACK UP and HAVE AN EXTRA PHONE ON TO USE in case this happens to you.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: I use a Samsung S9 for work applications and have for years. The s9 is obviously old but it worked well so I figured I'd buy a newer version for personal use after my iPhone I had for 8 years finally died. What I was looking for in a phone: [  ] Ability to make calls/texts [  ] A great camera as I am constantly traveling and in nature and I don't like carrying an extra camera [  ] A large interface to view the photos I take. A few details in the beginning -The below issues have been present since getting my phone. I have just now became frustrated enough to write a review. -I have never dropped my phone more than 3ish ft (from hand to ground while sitting or standing), what I'd sat is normal wear/tear. These issues DID exist before, though I don't think dropping an electric ever helps it. I've never gotten my phone wet, too hot, plugged in to a non GFCI protected outlet, or hooked up to another computer where a data transfer cord could have transmitted a virus. -I run a paid VPN and use Firefox and duckduckgo -I live in a very metropolitan area where proximity to my cell providers towers are not an issue -I have a nice case I have had on the phone since purchasing and a screen protector Issues [  ] Answering phone calls: what I feel like happens most often is that when I attempt to answer an incoming call I press the green answer button. Then the  phone will stop ringing and bring up what I'll call the "in-session call" screen but it never truly connects. It will stay stuck on this screen with no one able to hear each other for up to a minute. I have talked to people in person (the one I was trying to communicate with) and they will tell me that they were sent to voice-mail. [  ] Placing phone calls: when trying to place phone calls, sometimes my phone will ring once then a recording will tell me the person I am trying to reach is unavailable or the number I am trying to reach is not in service. I knew that these two reasons were not valid before but I had an experience when needing to reach 911 where I was told the number was not in service. I have also verified this by sitting next to people I am trying to call and seeing that the call never goes through. [  ] Microphone crackles if playing outloud or on speaker and will continue making the crackling noise until phone is restarted [  ] Camera is just way less detailed than I thought it would be. I heard great things about the clarity before buying. And, when looking at the physical phone, seeing how many lenses there are on the outside, one would think this phone could produce some quality shots. But every photo I take seems pixelated. I have tried to narrow it down to a specific lens by tweaking zoom and frame but I have located it the fix. This may be a software issue as the lenses aren't scratched [  ] The autocorrect function is pretty lousy. One of the 3 options usually happens: 1, a word that is spelled correctly will be autocorrected to something that doesn't make contextual sense. 2, the correct correction will be made but it will be conjoined with the following word after typing. 3, a word is spelled wrong bybthe operator but autocorrect never pics it up. Funny enough, this example happened while typing the previous sentence. I left it just to provide example and put it into the attached media section on the review. [  ] Screenshots don't always show up immediately in your photos. The photo app may need to be closed out of first and reopened. [  ] Thumb print: huge issue here...it only works about half of the time. I have now just began putting my password in every time. This is a first world complaint, but if it is a function of the phone I bought, it should work more than half of the time. [  ] Trying to place the mouse in a specific place in a paragraph can be a nightmare. The sensitivity and touch technology for the screen seems cheap. I know this isn't the case but it can seem like it will place your mouse everywhere but where you want it. I have similar issues when trying to highlight a specific word/portion in text while making edits. Some good stuff [  ] The screen is very large and crystal clear. Samsung was able to utilize a really large portion of the front screen all the way to the literal edge The phone is great for watching videos [  ] The phone itself is very sleek and good-looking [  ] The battery life is surprisingly good. The lifespan does seem to fluctuate day to day as my usage usually consists of calling and text (no social media). If you reach 5% life though the phone has about 1-2 minutes left, unlike the iPhone which seems to vary. All in all, the first thing I would have done differently is to not buy refurbished. And secondly, in my very narrow experience, I think Apple makes a better product. The security on Apples devices is a HUGE selling point for me as well. I haven't had a security issue with this device, but I have tested the security of other android devices.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: Read entire review before buying! We bought two of these phones at the same time recently one green and one pink. The pink one works good, I do have a little less service and it sometimes cuts out in areas that every other phone I have had kept full service. I use the same carrier so its not a coverage issue. We spoke to the carrier and they had us replace our Sim cards with new updated ones to make sure that wasnt causing any issues(it wasnt). I like the phone and features so much that its not a huge issue for me, i will be keeping this phone for awhile..... HOWEVER.. the green one does not work for service unless it is on wifi for wifi calling and messages. Once off wifi it says emergency calls only. Its unusable.. I contacted the seller and let them know. It has been several days and I havent heard back from them on anything. These phones are christmas gifts, so I only needed a replacement that works as well as the pink one and I was needing it quickly but I am still having no luck reaching anyone. I contacted Amazon and they are wanting me to return the item and are sending the labels to do so. Phone features, colors, and design-5 stars Phone service, dropped calls- 3 stars Customer service from seller-0 Stars I'm only giving a 2 star rating bcuz the pink phone does work, it does drop calls but its usable and I really like the look, feel in my hand, color, and over all design of the phone. It is very sleek, pretty and was in perfect cosmetic condition, otherwise they would get even less of a rating. Very disappointed at the lack of customer service especially this close to christmas with needing to return and replace a gift. We had decided to return/exchange for the exact same one from the same seller, but with the lack of response we will try and find another seller entirely. Will update review if anything changes or seller contacts me.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: When the phone arrived, it was in excellent physical condition and looked practically new. Initial setup went smoothly while connected to Wi-Fi, though I did notice the fingerprint reader did not work and the battery drained unusually fast. The real issue became apparent once I left home: the phone would not connect to my carrierâ€™s network at all and showed â€œNo network / Emergency calls only.â€ I spent over three hours troubleshooting with my carrier (Cricket / AT&T network), and they confirmed the error messages I was receiving only occur with carrier-locked devices. Despite being listed as unlocked, the phone could not be used on my carrier. After a factory reset done during troubleshooting, Wi-Fi calling also stopped working, leaving the phone completely unusable. I reached out to the seller multiple times but did not receive a resolution or confirmation that the device could be unlocked. I understand that refurbished phones can be a gamble, and Iâ€™ve had positive experiences purchasing refurbished devices through Amazon in the past. Unfortunately, this one did not match the product description and had to be returned. If you need a phone immediately or do not have a backup device, I would recommend purchasing elsewhere.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: Not Actually Factory Unlocked. It is a Jailbreak I bought this phone about a year ago, and I have been frustrated from the beginning. It was advertised as â€œfactory unlocked,â€ but it turns out itâ€™s actually jailbroken, which I only found out recently after talking to an IT tech. That explains everything. Because itâ€™s jailbroken, itâ€™s not truly compatible with my carrier and causes nonstop problems: It wonâ€™t switch to 4G when 5G is weak. Wi-Fi calling doesnâ€™t work. Service is terrible even when my husband has perfect signal right beside me (same provider, same plan). The battery drains fast and the phone overheats randomly. App Store updates fail or apps wonâ€™t download correctly. Fingerprint scanner fails about 70% of the time. Bluetooth connections drop often or wonâ€™t pair right. I keep getting signed out of Hulu for no reason (maybe related, maybe not, but it started when I got this phone). I thought I was buying a reliable, unlocked phone, instead, Iâ€™ve dealt with nothing but frustration. It says â€œunlockedâ€ in the listing, not "jailbroken." Lesson learned the hard way.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: Updating my review after using the phone more. From four stars to two. The S22 Ultra overheats constantly, even during really simple tasks which I later found out this model is known for that. The battery life is also worse than expected even for a refurbished phone. I also got the wrong color (ordered green, received gray). The phone showed up completely dead, taking 20 minutes of charging to even turn on, and had fingerprints all over the screen, so the presentation was basically non-existent. The only nice surprise was that it came with both a cable and a wall adapter instead of just a cable. The phone works decent for an average user, but the overheating is very annoying. I got this to run heavy tasks with but it seems like that's not going to be a viable option. I paid more for a like-new option and am overall disappointed.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: Bought this phone as a "good" refurbished phone which means there might be 1 or 2 small visible scratches on the body. When I received the phone it had multiple areas where there were pretty bad scratch marks as well as one huge divot taken out of the body by the s-pen. It does work fine but the mark almost guarantees it had a pretty significant drop. Pretty disappointed at how badly the damage is on the phone.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: Bought this 2 years ago. It was sold as factory unlocked but actually its carrier unlocked (att), but the carrier firmware is so bad that the phones network settings are so messed up. Still trying to flash unlocked firmware on this phone. Horrible in the US and every country I've taken it to with regards to connecting to networks. It was sold as refurbished good and had a few scratches on the screen. Other than that its fine. If you want to know if your phone is actually unlocked turn the phone off and hold the power button and volume down together for 10 seconds. Won't work with T-Mobile in the US. I regret this purchase.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: This product seemed perfect at first. I have always bought my phones refurbished and unlocked from Amazon and have never had any issues. The model of the phone itself is awesome and the camera is perfect. Which is a huge reason I went with this model. I was constantly getting compliments on the quality of my photos. I have zero complaints about the phone make/model. It also came to me looking brand new and in excellent condition. The phone seemed to work flawlessly for the first month and half that I had it. I had no issues at all and then one day it just stopped connecting to my network carrier. It worked completely fine until I would leave anywhere that I had wifi and then I would not be able to use my phone as a phone. I wasn't able to send or receive calls or do anything that required internet unless I was connected to wifi. Including google maps when I was trying to navigate somewhere. I tried troubleshooting a bunch of different ways including removing my SIM card and putting it back in, and I spent over an hour on the phone with AT&T who told me to clear my cache in my internet browser which seemed to work for about an hour then it would tell me "No network coverage available" anytime I tried to do anything. It wasn't my carriers issue because everyone else on my plan had zero coverage issues. I went back and read more of the negative reviews on here and realized I wasn't alone with this issue. Like I said, I'd never had any problems like this before with buying refurbished phones on Amazon. I don't know if this seller is bad, or the device itself just had some computing issues. When I requested an exchange for my phone I was told that they didn't have any more available and that I would have to receive a refund only available on the card that I used to purchase it. I ended up just going to AT&T and buying the new Galaxy S24 Ultra and I LOVE it. Unfortunately this experience has probably ruined my buying refurbished phones for me, and I will probably just end up spending the extra money for a new one from now on.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS MODEL!! THEY ARE FACTORY DEFECTIVE!! DO YOUR RESEARCH AND YOU'LL SEE THIS PHONE SHOULD BE RECALLED!! I really did enjoy this phone while it only lasted for about first six months. Then comes the devastating issues. The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5g was and is being sold with now known manufacturing defects. The internal antenna disconnects unreasonably too easy. This phone can't even be dropped from 2-3 ft with a nice case. The antenna broke/came loose inside the phone 3 different times. The first time it just started showing "Emergency Calls Only" on the top left of the screen and this ðŸš« where 5g should be on the top right side. This happened over 20 times a day, and after driving me insane for a couple days I took the case off and it had a small crack on the lower right side of the back glass. ( I've never had a phone crack inside a case before). So I got the back glass repaired. Then the next day the phone begins doing the same thing again, having no service more time than functioning correctly. So now's the next diagnosis saying the  antenna needs replacing and the  charging port must be replaced with an antenna repair. It worked for about 2 weeks and did the same thing again and there was no accidents or damage done to cause it. By now I'm way too frustrated and take it back and use the warranty of the repair shop. So I bought this phone for about 599.00 in July of 2024 and since then the screen cracked through a screen cover, the back glass broke through a strong case and I've had to get the antenna repaired 2 or 3 times now and now the phone is doing it again. It only lasted 2 weeks and now I can only count on it at home with WiFi. I've got over 1 thousand dollars in a phone that should've been 100% Recalled and Replaced with a different model. I hope it was only this year and this specific model. SADLY this has turned me to really considering going to an iPhone. I also had to change phone carriers(Boost Infinite to Mint mobile) bc at first I didn't think it was the phone causing the problems. And I've bought 10-12 accessories just for this phone. Not counting my Samsung Galaxy Watch and Galaxy Earbuds. This Phone has left me stranded before and now it's just left a devastating aftermath of WASTED MONEY AND TIME!!

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: I have had pretty good success with buying refurbished/renewed phones on Amazon in the past, but this Samsung S22 Ultra is hot garbage.  Everything seemed great the first two months, and then I started having issues connecting to the network, with the phone only working on WiFi. Did all the Samsung "fixes" on their support page but nothing worked. Ended up going to a local phone repair shop that changed the antenna at a cost of $80 parts and labor.  That worked for another two months and I just started having issues with network connectivity AGAIN...knowing its eventually going to drop to zero very soon following the previous experience. Im not an electrical engineer, but I am in the maintenance field.  I think this phone has a serious design flaw.  My guess is the battery overheats too much during charging and softens or unsolders the antenna connection over time.  Again, this is my best guess why this phone, and many others I see purchasers complaining about the same issue here are having when it comes to connectivity with networks.  Samsung either really dropped the ball on this model design wise, or purposely made it cheap. Id recommend AVOIDING the Samsung S22 Ultra Edit: I opened the phone and pushed the ribbon cable back into the antenna and it worked again. So that's the issue. Minor bumps or drops cause the ribbon cable to pull free. Im also not ruling out my other theory that the battery expanding as it gets hot also tugs on the cable, as it runs directly over the battery. Again, I'd avoid this model if I were you
