title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: If I could leave a 0 for Samsung I would, Amazons been great btw. I bought this phone September 12, 2024. Carrier coverage worked fantastic, cameras are amazing, still are amazing. Fast forward to February of 2025 thats when my cell coverage would randomly drop after doing an update. I contacted my carrier support, and spent hours troubleshooting, they asked me to check for updates, low and behold I had more updates cross fingers. After doing the updates I now have no cell service. Looked online and there are a lot of S22 Ultras and the newer Samsung phones with the same issue after updates from Samsung. Ive tried two different carriers, all networks Verizon, T-mobile, and ATT nothing except in satuated cell coverages like phoenix it will randomly gain and drop cell service. Ive read the 5g antennas and sim tray board can be faulty from the factory, had a shop change them with no success. Im in contact with Samsung to try and get the phone fixed, they had me go to a shop that said its more than likely the motherboard/mainboard for the phone, we cant fix that it'll have to be sent to Samsung to be fixed. Recontact Samsung and they can't even give me a price on how much its going to cost me to fix their updates screwing up my phone. Really disappointed with Samsung not standing behind their updates and products. I used to love Samsung, i had to move my sim card into my Note 10 plus and it works perfectly no cell issues at all. I will try and update after sending the phone to Samsung. Update 8/12/2025 Soo i sold the phone and bought a Pixel 9pro xl and it works perfectly with my carrier and no issues. I have a friend that has his s22U starting to have issues. My wifes S21U is now having connection issues and I've bought her a Pixel 7 pro. I dont know whats up with Samsung but they need to figure some stuff out. I wont be buying Samsung anymore. I love their camera which is my main point in buying a smart phone. its sad but theyve lost me as a customer.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: To start with - My entire family uses renewed phones so I am very used to what they should look /feel like.  Hopefully this one just slipped through. This was purchased as a refurbished - Excellent condition phone - the Amazon definition of that is "This pre-owned or refurbished product has been professionally inspected and tested to work and look like new. How a product becomes part of Amazon Renewed, your destination for pre-owned, refurbished products: A customer buys a new product and returns it or trades it in for a newer or different model. That product is inspected and tested to work and look like new by Amazon-qualified suppliers. Then, the product is sold as an Amazon Renewed product on Amazon." Issues: 1. there is no way this phone could be rated as Excellent - it looks like it had been in someone's pock with keys for a very long time - or drug through a gravel pit.  Sides are beat up with some deep pockmarks / Screen has many scratches. (see pics) 2. Speaker sounded like it was broken / blowen out or had dirt packed in it or maybe had something shoved into it.  either way it could only get to about half the volume my wife's phone (exact same model) could get to. 3. Microphone - when on wifi calling (to eliminate carrier issues) anything going through the microphone was distorted - possibly dirt packed into it or something 4. Fingerprint reader could not get it to work 25% of the time.  if would only work up to 50% I could live with it. positives: It takes and makes calls.  hard to hear them and I have to speak very loudly to get through the mic. It fits the Ghostek waterproof phone case Maybe after a thorough cleaning the speaker / Mic will function, and it may hit the renewed - acceptable level. This one - I will be returning

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: +The phone arrived a day earlier than the shipping prediction indicated (I might not have needed the extra $14 to advance delivery by a day). --->>> 1 month Update: This phone's Data and phone reception is Horrible no matter where I go in the Baltimore metro area!  Comparing side by side with working S-6 and S-7 phones this phone will not detect a Data signal in many urban settings where I could previously make and receive calls, offering the Ã˜ symbol rather than (empty) reception bars. Calls will not come through unless I am on WiFi.  ( Wifi transmissions/receptions frequently completely drops off when moving from room to room in an average size house with 6 WiFi access points. Not so with the S-6 or S-7). ---->> October 4, 2023 Update: The phone refused to take or make calls unless I was almost underneath a  Cell Tower. I took it to Verizon, and they could not evaluate antenna performance. GeekSquad was also unable to evaluate poor connectivity. The phone simply failed to perform basic cell phone duties. (WiFi connectivity was weak also).  And So I took advantage of Verizon's Phone Insurance plan where they gave me a replacement at no cost.  --- In the End, this purchase was not worth it. -- "Excellent condition" seems to me should be a just tiny bit shy of new in the box. In my case the metal edge at the top and bottom had the finish worn off, and the phone appears to have suffered a minor drop as there was a noticeable but not deep, depression in the screen and metal rim at the top of the phone. (The screen may be made from a similar material as that for folding phones so that it does not shatter for some drop types) There does not appear to be any diminishment to the screen performance/color-saturation. -- The generic "C" charger cable does not easily fit into the phone.  The first time I plugged it in I could not get it to seat so I had to fiddle with it to stay in, wedging the phone to keep it from sliding out. While it showed charging had started it must have come loose shortly after as it did not charge over night. "C" connectors are supposed to fit up or down, but this one only snaps fully in one way. [My Samsung S-6' micro-B had failed after two years and so I was not anxious to use force on any USB (I am an experienced systems / tech manager so this isn't a fear of tech thing)].

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: Before Proceeding with this review, Please note that I have contacted Amazon and they are sending me a replacement.  I will update this once the new device comes in and it matches what is posted on Amazon. I received this phone in "Refurbished - Excellent" condition, but was not aware of the multiple issues I would have with it.  The first thing I notice was any time the charging cable is plugged in, the phone becomes unstable.  Trying to type is a nightmare and swiping the keyboard in impossible.  The second was the screen.  An actual S22 Ultra has a nice crisp screen where as this one is kind of choppy at 120hz and gets overheated very quickly.  There is a huge border around the screen where the screen should wrap around and be squared off. See the image with the colors to see how it should look.  This is also how my neighbors looks on his S22 Ultra.  These is no note in the description that states the phone will come with a knockoff display.  The display also gets very hot, very quickly, and consumes battery quickly.  In comparison to my neighbors, it handles brightness well and uses much less battery.  Set to the same resolution, brightness and playing the same YouTube video, in 30 minutes, his dropped 4% and mine was hot and dropped 16%.  Finally, being able to compare the phone to a complete real S22 Ultra on the same cellular provider as myself, and living right next door, he has WiFi Calling and 5G, where I do not. *** RED FLAG *** This is listed in the listing as MODEL SM-S908W The phone I was sent is MODEL SM-S908U/DS I expected to receive the SM-S908W as purchased and the correct hardware.  $400 is not a small amount to spend.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: Do not purchase from seller. We purchased two phones and they came promptly and in nice packaging. The phone itself appears in great condition. One of the phones is working well.  However, one of the phones has an issue with the S Pen failing to connect and the screen flickers, and fades in and out periodically. After doing the usual troubleshooting the phone is still not working properly. We attempted to request a replacement online, but the only option is to request a return. This means you will be without a phone because will have to return it first then order a new one and possibly have a difficult time porting your data over.  Or you have to buy another phone then return the old one, thereby providing a free loan to Amazon and the seller. After calling Amazon we were told the seller doesn't allow for exchanges and a return is only possible. Do not expect Amazon to take any sort of initiative to resolve an issue if you have one. They will only repeat the same thing and they will not contact the seller themselves. They will not attempt to resolve your issue other than tell you to return it. After several phone calls and several representatives of Amazon we were hung up on three different occasions. This whole experience has been terrible!!! I am reaching out to the seller directly.  If they are able to provide a better resolution, this review will be updated.  It's unfortunate that the customer service through Amazon was truly awful.  If they had seamlessly provided a replacement phone, this could have been a great experience and a positive review, despite the issue with the phone.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra, launched in 2022, is a premium smartphone blending the S-series power with the Note's integrated S Pen, featuring a 6.8" 120Hz QHD+ display, powerful Snapdragon/Exynos chip, 108MP quad-camera system with 10x optical zoom, and 5000mAh battery, still offering great performance, camera, and design in 2025.
reviews: I wanted to upgrade from my S9 Plus for my birthday, and this looked like a good deal. I ordered it, spent the hour or so getting everything in order and put the new case I already bought on it, and the lock button felt a little off. I thought it was because I wasn't used to having all of my buttons on the side of my phone instead of the back, so I ignored it for a while. Until the lock button downright stopped working. Couldn't lock my phone, which is a pain. I had to set my screen shut off to 15 seconds so it would lock itself. I reached out to them for help, or maybe even a credit so I could just go fix it myself and avoid the hassle of returning it and buying a whole new one, but they wanted it returned. Now for the best part. I ordered another one to replace the first one. The second one came in crappy packaging, the phone was dirty with grime on it like it belonged to a teenage boy, sticky stuff around the camera, even the pen was dirty when I took it out. *ew* I tried to brush past it as long as the damn thing worked and there were no scratches on the screen. I got most of the grime off, put it in my case, and started using it. Well guess what? It won't stay connected to any charger cords that I have. If it even moves an inch, it stops charging. So when I have it connected to my car through cord, every bump, it disconnects. Not very fun. Now I have to return this one. I ordered myself a phone off of backmarket for a much better deal, I'll be receiving it soon as well. When I do, I'll be transferring my information for the third time in this lovely adventure and this phone is going to be returned. Thanks for listening to my rant!

The only one thing is it keeps downloading the same update over and over again but my old Samsung phone did the same thing but you can ignore it. Other than that the phone is perfect. It comes with a built in Bluetooth pen and I downloaded the diamond painting app and itâ€™s like a mini sized version of my iPad and pen that I used for that app. I love it.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra 128GB Unlocked Android Smartphone - Mystic Black (Renewed)
description: This pre-owned or refurbished product has been professionally inspected and tested to work and look like new. How a product becomes part of Amazon Renewed, your destination for pre-owned, refurbished products: A customer buys a new product and returns it or trades it in for a newer or different model. That product is inspected and tested to work and look like new by Amazon-qualified suppliers. Then, the product is sold as an Amazon Renewed product on Amazon. If not satisfied with the purchase, renewed products are eligible for replacement or refund under the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.
reviews: I don't use face recognition so I can't say how well it works, but for the first week at any rate, the on-screen fingerprint reader has been amazingly easy to use.  I don't use my phone super heavy and it's not uncommon to have 70% or more battery when I put it on the wireless charger at night, and it's *significantly* less picky about placement on the wireless charger than the old phone (note 8).  The car has wireless charging and it's also much better charging there; the old one would often not be in the right place and not get any electrons, where this never fails to juice up. I got the Note 20 because it's the last Note (currently) that has an SD card slot; I'm absolutely against some company gouging me hundreds of dollars extra for a 256GB phone when a 512GB SD card is under 50 bucks.  The drawback to that is this phone came with pretty much nothing at all but a charging cable, which isn't really adding any value.  It took me some time to find a way to get the SD card slot open, without their custom tool, because on this phone at least the hole is waaayyyy too small for a paper clip.  I finally unwound the spring from an ink pen, which was small enough and stiff enough to release it.  Seriously leave out the cable that probably everyone in the world has by now and put that tool in!  It's needed for the SIM even without an SD card. Speaking of SIM, moving my line to this phone was trivially simple.  The phone was apparently on T-Mobile previouisly and I'm on Verizon, and everything worked flawlessly right from the phone.  Put the SIM in, turned it on, and followed the instructions.  Done. I got a Note because, well, I've been a Note fanboy since the 4, when my old Droid with the hardware keyboard gave up the ghost, because of the S-Pen.  It's not something I use every day, but when I do use it, there is literally no alternative that works like the S-Pen.  If Samsung ever stops putting that on their phone I'll probably move on to something more affordable. This is my first ever refurb, and this one at least is exactly what one would hope; it physically indistinguishable from a brand new phone.  Even close observation in the light reveals no scratches or blemishes, it hasn't crashed or exhibited any wonky behaviour (knocks on head), and it's significantly snappier than the old one.  That's not just because it has more resources, I think it's because the UI has been tweaked.  For example when scrolling a long list this phone's "inertia", how long it scrolls untouched after a flick up or down, is much higher than the old phone, so it's considerably faster to browse by scrolling.  I'm sure other improvements have been made as well, and together they translate into a much more responsive feel. The OS itself is similar to the Note 8, really, but it has even more bloat and unremovable cruft in it.  For exampe there's "AR" functionality now, but even though I have nothing AR, and if I do it's highly unlikely I'll use this phone in conjunction with it.  There's an "AR Zone" that can't be disabled, can't be removed, can't be told not to nag me with notifications, can't be managed in the slightest.  Seriously Samsung, get off your high horse.  You don't know what I want my phone to do; fine if you want to have that enabled by default, why do I care?  But can't disable it or remove all the massively huge list of permissions?  Want to rub some salt in there for me?  It's also considerably more in-your-face nagging about things; like I haven't figured out how to get it to stop nagging me to save passwords for web sites, as if the last fifteen times I'd change my mind.  Stuff like that isn't helpful, it's obtuse and rude. Migration was a PitA, but that's normal, so I mention it anecdotally.  Samsung's "Smart Switch" does make it less than heinously atrocious, but "Everything" isn't (everything), and it still took me days to get all my appointments and other things loaded in.  Once I find my browser bookmarks and get them in I'll finally be done.  Least favorite part of getting a new phone is setting the @*&#% up.  I can back up and restore a computer with trivial ease but no phone maker yet is smart enough to do that with a phone.  Pathetic. I considered only four stars because of the missing SD card tool.  Not sure how many folks would be able to figure out how to open it with the hole being about 2/3 the diameter of a paper clip, which is by the way what Verizon recommends using if one can't find the tool.  I have no straight pins so I don't know if they work, but if I did I'd still want to file the point off to be sure I didn't damage anything. But overall a VERY happy camper.  If you like Android it's likely you'll be satisfied with this phone, and if you've never had an S-pen you'll probably be hooked.  lol

reviews: I ordered an excellent condition Note 20 Ultra in black and it arrived exactly as advertised,  without a scratch.  It is the most beautiful phone Iâ€™ve ever owned and Iâ€™ve had several dozen phones.  My daily phone is an iPhone 13 Pro Max because of work (Apple Ecosystem) so this phone was to take a break from Apple at times.  I also own a Samsung S20 Ultra so not new to Samsung / Android.  Out of the box I had connection issues with WiFi and cell phone switching.  When I left my house from WiFi into T-Mobile cell service I would get no service.  I then had to reboot  the phone, it would connect to cell service and then the phone would blowup with notifications.  It didnâ€™t happen every time I left the house, was 50/50.  It also had issues with lag like it was out of memory.  Opening YouTube for example Iâ€™d get the spinning ball.  Checking for software update or cleaning the memory, the color dots wouldnâ€™t even spin.  Then there is the battery (4500 mAh) which was extremely poor.  My best battery day was 3 hours 49 minutes onscreen time with 60hz refresh set.  For comparison my used older S20 Ultra battery (5000 mAh) best day was 9 hours 2 minutes (iPhone, 10 hours 16 minutes).  So I called around and found a Samsung certified store which quoted me $79 for an OEM battery replacement.  I would have totally changed the battery if the phone didnâ€™t have the other issues.  I only used the phone for 4 days and after the second hard reset, I made the decision to return it.  I just sent it back today after receiving it 7 days ago.  Even with the issues, I miss it already.  I donâ€™t miss the battery life and the hiccups but the phone itself was gorgeous (that 1440p screen).  It was no fault of the Amazon seller, someone would have to use the phone for days to detect these issues.

reviews: I was a little nervous to buy this used phone due to some rough reviews, turns out I didn't need to be as this showed almost zero wear. Several tiny micro scratches around the camera bezel, light scuff line near the bottom portion of the screen, but scuff invisible when using phone. Purchased this aging phone to replace my Note 10 Plus as the 20 Ultra was the last Note series that featured a physical sim card. My work provides an iPhone that I hate, but that iPhone has a physical sim, so I removed the sim from the iPhone and put it in my Note 20. Instant activation and Android bliss. Immediately noticed the performance upgrade from the previous Note, beautiful bright screen. Facial recognition and fingerprint reader massively upgraded from the Note 10. Actually works closer to Apple products, but still not as slick as Apple, but this "new to me" Note 20 Ultra is still an "old phone" with slightly outdated hardware. Pen is much more responsive than the Note 10 Plus version, no issues with the phone pairing with the pen. Purchased a sweet slim fitting case that has a sliding camera cover for amazing protection.

reviews: The phones are Renewed, which means there are multiple sellers and multiple conditions for the phones to arrive in.  When reading the reviews I noticed there are some issues that show up often. I bought from two, since the 1st had defects that shouldn't be in a phone listed as Excellent condition. I ordered a replacement, from a different seller, and have been happy. Putting the two experiences together, I came up with the 4-star review. These are the defects with the 1st phone I ordered. I got an incorrect display, which was too small with rounded corners and it didn't reach the sides or bottom of the screen. The back plate was loose on arrival, but that was mostly an inconvenience because I always use a case. Although, when I took off the case to return the phone, the back had separated from the body. The charging port had not been checked and cleaned out, meaning charging cords wouldn't connect correctly, so it would randomly stop charging. That was a rather simple issue to fix myself. I just shouldn't have had to with an Excellent condition phone. The main issue, and reason for the return, was that the phone didn't properly receive signal. With it constantly dropping calls and losing signal while sitting on a desk untouched, I couldn't use it as a phone.

reviews: I had thus exact same model phone for almost 3yrs. It still worked perfectly and I loved it but unfortunately I dropped it just the perfectly wrong way and destroyed the led screen. The phone was no longer usable. So I liked it so much I decided to buy the exact same phone. Over 300.00 for a refurbished model. I get it and first of all none of my pictures would sync. They all tried to but they all are just completely black. There are many other things that were different. Maybe due to software updates. When I first got it I thought it was defective because it went on for almost 2 days of constantly updating. I was upset but finally it stopped. The facial recognition rarely works and the fingerprint sensor doesn't work at all. I think it has to do with the Glas screen protector but it is specifically designed for a fingerprint sensor but it doesn't work at all. Since I broke the last one I don't want to have it unprotected. Overall I still enjoy this model but there seems to be numerous differences from my last one. It never gets hot. It takes decent pictures and has a lot of features to improve pictures. I don't think it should cost this much but it is a nice model phone. I would recommend it but just wish the biometric options worked better or even at all.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra 128GB Unlocked Android Smartphone - Mystic Black (Renewed)
description: This pre-owned or refurbished product has been professionally inspected and tested to work and look like new. How a product becomes part of Amazon Renewed, your destination for pre-owned, refurbished products: A customer buys a new product and returns it or trades it in for a newer or different model. reviews: First of all, it's a refurbished phone. It arrived completely unlocked without a single blemish on it. I specifically chose this phone because it was the only relatively new model with ALL these features: 1. Memory card slot. I put a 512 GB card in it to make sure I don't run out of space. Almost every major phone company has ditched it. 2. Stylus. Because I do IT work using this phone from time to time, I need the precision of a stylus when selecting files or accounts. 3. UWB. I wanted Ultra Wide Band for some of the new connectivity. Pros: 1. Stylus is very accurate. 2. Good looking display. 3. Camera better than expected. 4. Speed is still great considering it's a 2020 release. 5. It's an Android. Sorry iPhone peeps, but Apple is way to controlling and hides too much. I was an iPhone guy up through 6, but I won't be going back in the foreseeable future. I currently have an iPhone 11 as a tester phone. Cons: 1. I wish the battery lasted longer; however, I do things that tend to burn through battery life. 2. Most of the time I do a screenshot, it also engages the volume level on the screen causing me to retake it too often. 3. The fingerprint scanner needs serious work. This is the most annoying thing about Samsung. My S20 FE was just as bad. I prefer the fingerprint sensor on my Pixel, which is on the back, so much more. The Samsung face recognition does work really well, even in lighting conditions that aren't that great. FYI, I paid $400 for a phone that retailed for $1,300 two years ago. At $400, this thing is FANTASTIC. Another side note, I have about 8 different phones, because I have to do app testing.

reviews: I bought this phone looking for something nice, yet affordable. When I bought this my expectations were high and when received is when the problem started. That would've been fine if it wasn't for the fact when I booted up it was said to be unlocked but came up with the at&t logo but even weirder is when I registered the phone with samsung it comes up with Verizon. I've contacted all 3 companies now trying to unlock the phone but no luck if it wasn't for the fact I use straight talk which works with all carriers I would be more upset by this. The phone condition was amazing not even a scratch which is good but the s pen came broken in 2, in which the seller partially reimbursed me for, still a disappointing out come. reviews: The way your Accident Protection Plan works is very inconvenient and inefficient. If Asurion has contraced service centers in my area, why not have them do the repairs or service? It seems like common sense that if I can drop my phone off at a place locally that can fix it; they should be able to fix it under the Asurion Accident Protection Plan. Then I should be able to pay the service fee of $39 for a repair rather than $99 for replacement (which actually has hidden fees not mentioned until you process a claim!). The way it is set up now, from what I understand is that I have to have my phone sent into one of your service centers, wait to see if you can fix it, then if not I have to wait for a credit or gift card so I can replace my phone on my own. None of that even tells me how long I would  have to wait for the repair, if possible, or the credit. Why should I have to send my phone in for Asurion to see if they can fix it when there is a place right here that I can take it and have it fixed in 2 hours? The cost of the repair should be covered under the accident protection plan. The service center should be able to provide the repair service that should be covered underneath the accident protection plan. Asurion needs to update the coverage information for purchasers to read disclaimers that the phone must be sent in to one of your service centers instead of bringing it to a place locally. If I have to send my phone in, then Asurion should provide mailing supplies to send it into your service center instead of me having to take a somewhere. This whole thing has been very frustrating and annoying. It does not give me confidence in purchasing any more asurion accident protection plans as here I am with a cracked screen, that can be repaired, and I have no idea how long I would have to be without it in order to get it fixed or replaced. I work remotely and depend on my phone to do my work, therefore cannot be without it for any length of time. That is the reality of the world today. Remote workers and people who need their phones to do their jobs. Asurion needs to update their system to accommodate the way the world is heading or get out of the Accident Protection Plan business. No, I would not recommend your service to anyone, ever again.

reviews: I purchase renewed phones as a way to save money. From experience, it's always a gamble. And gambling we love. Majority of renewed phones always look shiny with flawless screens. Know that this is common and a way to give you the "wow" factor. But also know these are not the original Gorilla glass screens that Samsung installed. These are aftermarket screens affixed by the reseller. I find that they are prone to cracks more quickly compared to Gorilla Glass. While my phone work great, the problem is the camera. Yes, it takes photos, but I cannot do close up photos nor does the auto focus work as it should. If you Google this, this is a known issue. Some people claim if you bang the phone hard enough, it fixes the issue while some just return it. Never ever use the charging adapter/cable that comes with renewed stuff. They are very often the cheapest, unbranded stuff thrown in to satisfy the buyer that they got a charger/cable. I find that some don't work and some charge erratic and slow. They also tend to zap out and become a fire hazard. Stay away from them and use a good charger.

reviews: So...I purchased this phone hoping it was going to be my next LTR, however, it appears this relationship won't make it 6 months. Firstly, the device itself initially appeared great. Clean, shiny and new (used), IMO 8/10. It's been roughly about a month and I do like the phone, it's an upgrade from my Note 8 and functions IMO 7/10. In these last few days, however, it's been showing its semi- refurbished side. (I hope to upload pics) This device should have a water tight seal in its construction. This is not the case (no pun intended), with the back cover coming unglued there is now some separation that I can glide my finger nail through (thick nail). A rainy day will brick this phone. I am perplexed with how bright and vivid the screen is whilst also have some display issues. Maybe it's just me but when I'm streaming and there are darks or deep blacks it just gives you grainy video. Furthermore, as I'm swiping or trying to press on some functions either the touch screen or something doesn't respond to my touch on top sides. Having my finger holding or swiping motion with a picture or file toward the bottom of the screen causes a jitter and sometimes releases my item or causes an undesired selection. These are my main qualms and will look to resolving these issues.

reviews: I've purchased a few refurbished phones from Amazon and was happy with my first Note 20 Ultra. I decided my whole family should have one as well. Well due unforeseen circumstances, my phone ended up needing to be replaced. So I ordered a new one no problem. Getting the phone was no problem but upon inspection, the excellent status of the phone was put into question. In the upper right-hand corner there was a barely noticeable screen deformity. It wasn't a deal breaker as the phone was still fully functional. But after preforming a usual task while at work, a break point occurred that cracked the screen significantly. I don't pretend to understand the science of gorilla glass but the cracks don't seem normal and it appears that the glas itself was deformed from an incorrect installation that is causing the cracked areas to be raised. Another point of contention comes from the backlighting. It seems to surround all the edges even around the front Camera. Just be cautious when purchasing these phones as they have physical flaws you may not notice at first glance

reviews: Out of the box it looked like a brand new phone.  Also included was a screen protector that worked better than others that I have tried.  There seems to be a problem with the curved sides of the screen that create problems with these phones, but this one fit and worked better than any others that I have tried. Less than 24 hours after receiving this item, it was giving a black screen and I was unable to do anything with the phone.  After finally getting it to restart by holding the down volume and power buttons for about 30 seconds, it restarted.  Sometimes it took more.  It's difficult to tell if they are being pressed correctly since there is no screen to give any kind of feedback. The Black screen happened several times in the 6 days that I've had it and it is very problematic as I work on the road and not being able to check email, text messages and receive or make calls is very problematic. I have ordered a replacement and will update this review when I receive the new phone.

reviews: Bought the Note 20 Ultra a few weeks ago. The phone seems to function correctly with 2 exceptions: 1. Reception is at best half of the Galaxy A-50 (cheapy) I've had for years. Not sure if it's because of phone damage or just a weakness of the Note 20 model (which I doubt because of other research). At any rate dead zones increased exponentially with this phone. Streaming is almost impossible when driving... 2. Screen sensitivity is weak as well. When the phone hasn't been used for several minutes it is very difficult to wake the phone up from it's snoozing state. Sometimes I even have to wake it with the PWR button. This phone has lot's of cool features but the reception and sensitivity issues are making me question this purchase. My options seem to be spending a few hundred bucks for a cell booster or a new phone...

reviews: I recieved this phone earlier than Amazon suggested, but the display has very large bezels around the edges when the phone is supposed to have edge to edge display. The camera holes do not match up over the cameras like they're supposed to on the selfie camera and the back cameras. The glass that's put on is larger than the frame of the phone itself or at least it isn't put On correctly. I can feel the sharp edges of the glass when I hold the phone in my hand. There is a gap on the back glass at the top where the glass is glued on too far down and dirt is already getting in. title: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra 128GB Unlocked Android Smartphone - Mystic Black (Renewed)
description: This pre-owned or refurbished product has been professionally inspected and tested to work and look like new. reviews: So I just got this today, and so far, I'm not impressed.  Can't tell you how the phone will work yet, as there are absolutely no directions or paperwork included.  As for "excellent" condition, yeah, not so much.  I'd judge it as fair to good condition.  There is a great deal of obvious pitting and scratching all around the edges, although not on the screen itself.  It is definitely visible from more than 12 inches away.  I'll be putting it in a case to protect it, so hopefully that won't matter if it's just cosmetic.  I just worry that this phone went through the wringer with it's previous owner. It definitely looks like it's been dropped a few times... I have to say, compared to my current phone, a Galaxy Note 9, also purchased as a refurb over 4 years ago, this one is a disappointment.  That one was pristine when I received it.  Still looks great due to it being in a case, but the battery is starting to go, doesn't hold a charge very long, and gets really hot, really fast.  Also the speaker is going and since I use it for work and do a lot on speakerphone, that's critical for me. I too chose this Galaxy Note 20 as it's the last in the line that has the SD slot. Now I just have to go searching for a user manual online so I can figure out how to transfer all my data and memory/sim/etc.  Once I actually, hopefully, get to use it, I'll come back and update my review. Update: I've had this phone for a couple of months now, and to say I'm underwhelmed is putting it mildly.  Cosmetically, it definitely was NOT in perfect condition.  Very obviously used hard by previous owner.  But I can deal with that.  What I can't deal with is the poor volume control, the fact that it cuts in and out, and locks up.  I find I have to restart it far to often to get it to work.  Not what you want in a phone. I use my phone a lot for work and not being able to rely on clear sound is a deal breaker.  And it's not like I'm walking around and the signal is fading in and out.  I live in an urban area, and talk to others in same area, and half the time I can't hear them or they can't hear me, or the sound cuts in an out.  So very annoying.  It's going back.  I'd better get a full refund or I'm going to be even more ticked.  This one was a rip-off in my opinion.  Completely opposite experience from my first refurb phone.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra 128GB Unlocked Android Smartphone - Mystic Black (Renewed)
description: This pre-owned or refurbished product has been professionally inspected and tested to work and look like new. reviews: I got exactly 100 days of use out of the phone this third party seller sent me, and an experience I hope is worth the $300 I wasted on this product. I am a lifelong Samsung product user, so you can imaging the devastation i felt when my Samsung s10e fell into a bath (and stayed in the bath for about a minute).  I purchased the Note20U (as it's the latest Samsung phone with the SD slot) and thought this was the push I needed to get a new phone. And it arrived in decent condition. It was scratchless, turned on with no issue and worked well, and I was quite happy - which would've prompted a 5 star review. However, on the 100th day of owning it, as I washed my hands, droplets of water landed on it. What shouldve been no big deal turned out to be the end of this phone. The phone turned off completely, and is no longer functional. The Note20U has an IP68 rating, the seller advertised it as Water Resistant, and it has no cracks or visible faults anywhere, and somehow the entire camera was full of water. How this happened, I'm not sure but I'm assuming that when the phone was fixed by the seller, they either forgot to or chose not to add the sealing that makes the phone IP68 rating-compatible. I did what anyone else would do - looked at the Amazon A-To-Z Guarantee, contacted the seller and I was told that because the warranty is for 90 days (it was 10 days after the warranty expiration), they couldn't help me with a replacement. The seller offered to reach out to their "specialists" to see if I could return it (but I'd have to pay shipping and a restocking fee?!) and when I followed up with whether these "specialists" responded, I was told that they would not be receiving it back. Amazon Customer service told me they couldn't do anything about this (all 7 agents throughout a weeks time) So now I have a broken note20u, no refund, no replacement and I'm currently typing this on the cracked, beat up s10e that survived with no water damage. My advice? Don't. And if you do - keep an eye on that warranty.

reviews: And I can attest to this because I purchased a refurbished Galaxy Note 20 G Ultra I got this because I love the pen and this is the last of the note series. Now I have never had an issue with a brand new phone or a refurbished phone I've had many. My standard practice is to pull out the screen protector the OtterBox have them set up and ready and then open up the phone install the screen protector install it into the case and then upload all my information to the phone this ensures there's no dust hair fingerprints are Grime on the phone potentially as it is crisp out of the box however after I got into my OtterBox with the screen protector on which cost $50 I turned it on and after a minute I got an alert that my pen wasn't connected I went into the settings try to reconnect it after about a minute and a half of trying to connect it gave me the same error message I uploaded all my data updated the phone wipe the phone updated the phone without my data wipe the phone and my data updated and all the meanwhile I've changed various settings turn all the settings off turn them back on reset and every time I try to connect and then also every time I turn on the phone it tries to connect and it will not link Now there is one of two possibilities either I received a defective pen receiver or the flex cable that attaches the receiver to the phone was not plugged in Now this does not require an in-depth the way you literally boot on the phone and you get an alert with a very annoying Audible ping so you could not have missed this if you quality assured the phone The biggest issue is I return the phone I lose $50 I keep the phone I have to pay full price for a defective phone I talked to Amazon and we came up with a couple offers for the seller try and rectify things and they flat out refuse so I've been f***** over by these people because they didn't quality assure their own product that would have taken 2 minutes and you would have instantly known because you would have been alerted by the phone he didn't have to do anything and just had to be on for 2 minutes

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra 128GB Unlocked Android Smartphone - Mystic Black (Renewed)

If not satisfied with the purchase, renewed products are eligible for replacement or refund under the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.
reviews: Phone came in pristine condition, but then stopped working while still under warranty. I spoke to the seller and they sent me a return label. It was a week or two later that I finally had a chance to mail it off as I do not live anywhere near a dropoff site and of course, they never use USPS for the mailing. I mailed the item off and then received an email that it was received, and I should see my refund soon as they said they couldn't replace the item. No refund showed up, so I contacted them again. They then said that it was sent outside of the warranty period. We literally talked prior to it being out of warranty and I received the mailing label before it went out of warranty which was only a few days before it would've been out of warranty. I could understand if I had waited MONTHS, but it was only a week or two before I was able to send it off. I then asked them to return the product since they refuse to warranty it out. They stated that they need Amazon to send them my address before they can return it to me. This made zero sense as they sent me the product in the first place, so I said okay and spoke to Amazon and told them what the seller said, so they messaged the seller to return the product. I also used Amazon's assistant bot to send the address to the seller, but it shows up as a message coming from me. The seller again then said that this is not what they want, but the Amazon rep told me that they cannot send the seller our address as they do not have access to it. I conveyed this to the seller and told them to just send the product back to the original address it was shipped to in the first place which IS my address. I will see what the reply is and I'll probably being dealing with this issue longer. This was a whole lot of my time wasted on an almost 500.00 phone that worked for a short amount of time. I paid 300.00 to have my Note10 screen repaired, which is what the Note 20 was supposed to replace, and it's been working great, so I'll stick with that. I also bought my husband a Note 20 from the same seller and it is still working, but did the same thing mine did with the screen turning black and not working, but his did eventually come back on in a few hours. I had confidence in these products as they were from the Amazon Renewed store, but never again will I waste my time or money.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra 128GB Unlocked Android Smartphone - Mystic Black (Renewed)

If not satisfied with the purchase, renewed products are eligible for replacement or refund under the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.
reviews: I'm writing this as a review of the product and experience, but also as a way to reach out to the seller as Amazon's process keep forcing me to use their chat system. I purchased my Note 20 Ultra 12/6/2024. Initially I was reasonably happy with the phone. It did have issues charging using a cable from the get go and I probably should have exchanged it then, but it charged wirelessly and everything else worked fine. I was just happy to have a functional phone. Today is 4/13/2025 just 5 months from the date of purchase. On 4/11/25 my phone decided that it no longer wanted to connect to cell services. It had entered into a half activated airplane mode that could not be overcome. I tried every fix and workaround listed on all the help boards I could find online. Nothing worked. I took the phone to a repair facility that tried to fix the antenna problem by swapping the daughter board, but it failed as the problem appears to be a deaper issue. I asked them to look into the charging issue, but the problem is deeper and more severe than simply swapping the port. The repair facility also noted that it was an obviously referbished model and that it had not been done well. There were several screws missing internally and the back glass was glued on with an excessive amount of the wrong type of glue. I'm fully aware this phone only comes with a 90 day warranty, but this product is claimed to come professionally inspected to look AND work like new. This does not meet with that claim. I hope to reach some kind of resolution with the seller and be able to adjust this review accordingly, but until then this 1 star review is sadly warranted.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra 128GB Unlocked Android Smartphone - Mystic Black (Renewed)

reviews: I rarely write bad reviews but this deserves the hoslnest review im writing here. I bought this phone as excellent quality refurbished and holy moly this phone was far from that. When i opened the box it had all it accessories but this thin slightly greasy film on the front and back of the phone, it was all over it and then the plastic film on the front glass of the phone had a bunch of lint and dust on it. I peeled it of and coukd see all the lint and dirt was on the sticky side that adheres to the phone screen. The screen was scratch free and crack free and so was the rest of the phone. But i noticed the color was off and not as vibrant as my s20 fe phone. The galaxy Note 20 Ultra is a top end high quality phone with high quality display. So to see it noticeabley faded and dull looking compared to my S20 it seemed liked something was wrong. Then i tried taking pictures with it and it did not focous well at all. I took it to a cell phone store and compared it to another used Note 20 ultra and they did not have one but the person at the front visually inspected the camera and took pictures with it and he said the camera needed to be replaced. So i just decided to return this phone and get a refund. The return mailing tracking number verified they have had the phone for over a week and still have not refunded me.. I called and was told anything over 100$ it takes about 3 weeks to a month for a refund. So just a heads up if you are interested in this phone and end up returning it. I was not impressed at all with theyre refurbishment quality. This is the second phone ive bought from amazon and have had the same type of experience. I dont think they know how to refurbish cell phones very well and certaintly not to an excellent or even good quality.

reviews: Ok I'm gonna be fair with everyone since nobody guaranteed me the phone would last me for a certain amount of time but I also didn't expect a 500 dollar phone to just quit barely one year after i bought it, the phone came in decent condition when I bought it about a year ago, apart from it overheating a little I never had any issue with it and it just suddenly went dark while using it one day, I don't know if this is a manufacturing defect or if it's the refurbished department who didn't do a good job and the fact that it was used I can't really expect the guaranty of a new product so I had to buy another phone after only had it for a year, and I paid $500 for a phone I only got to use for a year because I asked how much was to get it fixed they say it was close to what I paid for it so nah, I'm not blaming anyone over this that's why I never filed a complaint or requested refund or anything I knew it was used and even though it was in decent shape and working condition I didn't expect to last me only for one year so I just wanted to share my experience, hopefully helps anybody from making a mistake. Because if I would've known I was paying 500 for a phone that will only last me a year I would not have bought it or if it would've lasted at least one more year I would still leave a fair review, and like I said I don't blame the seller or amazon for this since I'm sure neither could've predicted this was gonna happen but i still lost 500 for a phone i should still have now. It might not be fair but it's not fair to me either so it is what it is.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra 128GB Unlocked Android Smartphone - Mystic Black (Renewed)

reviews: I purchased this phone that was described to be in excellent condition, which has specific criteria defined by Amazon.  When it arrived, it had protective film over the screen.  Even with the film over it, I could see a large 1" long scratch on the screen.  Once the film was removed, the scratch was very prominent and could be felt on the screen.  There was also a corner that had been dropped at one point where it was dented and silver due to the anodizing being scraped off. I contacted Amazon right away and they agreed to send out a replacement since it was time critical that I get a phone for my employment.  Hats off to Amazon for their response, but the description by the seller was not accurate at all. UPDATE:  I received my second note 20 ultra from the same vendor, and this time the screen was okay minus a few minor scratches I can live with.  However,  this one has actual pieces of glass inside the bottom camera lens, from what I assume is from a glass repair that wasn't performed properly.  The telephoto function of this particular lense doesn't work properly, which is either a faulty camera or the glass is interfering with the movement of the lense.  When I contacted Amazon, I was not given an option for another replacement, only a return tag and promise of a refund once received.  I had to activate the phone since I could not receive any calls for work and now I'm in a position where I have to pay more money out of my pocket to buy another phone before I can send this one back and get my $400 back. This is beyond frustrating.  I have had good luck with Amazon refurbished before, but I don't know if I'll ever try it again after this experience.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 Ultra 128GB Unlocked Android Smartphone - Mystic Black (Renewed)
description: This pre-owned or refurbished product has been professionally inspected and tested to work and look like new. How a product becomes part of Amazon Renewed, your destination for pre-owned, refurbished products: A customer buys a new product and returns it or trades it in for a newer or different model. That product is inspected and tested to work and look like new by Amazon-qualified suppliers. Then, the product is sold as an Amazon Renewed product on Amazon. If not satisfied with the purchase, renewed products are eligible for replacement or refund under the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.
reviews: I rarely give 1-star ratings, but the inconvenience associated with this purchase earned it. Received the phone, moved all my data over, input my passwords to all my apps, re-did fingerprint and face recognition, put my credit card info in Samsung wallet, connected different Bluetooth devices, etc.  You all know how tedious that is.  Received a phone call and the person on the other end could hardly hear me.  I thought nothing of it.  Received another call and the person could not hear me.  Decided to test the microphone.  It only picks up static.  Even in a room of silence the playback is pure static.  I have to use an external headset of some sort just to have a phone conversation.  Read online this is a problem with this model.  Even installing the latest software updates didn't fix it. At this point I had already traded in my old phone.  Contacted the seller and was told they wouldn't send a replacement until I mailed the faulty phone.  Was told they would overnight a replacement, but tracking shows it will not arrive the next day.  So, I'll be WITHOUT a phone for 2-3 days.  When I get the phone, I have to take time out of my day to go get it activated, have to take more time to put passwords back into all my apps, take more time to re-register my fingerprints and face ID, take more time to setup Samsung wallet, take more time to re-pair Bluetooth devices, etc. etc.  You get the idea.  It would be easier to accept this outcome if it were merely a used phone sold "as is", but this was a refurbished phone.  How did it ever pass inspection with a faulty microphone??  I am waiting for the replacement as I type this.  Fingers crossed there aren't more problems with the replacement whenever it arrives.  If so, I'll be back to type even more...

reviews: This has been the worst phone ever ! I had the first one replaced because it would just turn off the screen randomly and not come back on for hours maby a day. Would not register my finger prints at all and would stop every time around 40-50% like it was trolling me. So I sent it back and received what I thought was a almost perfect maby even new one. two weeks later or so Same thing except 10 times worse ! It even one day while I was half asleep started to hiss and got super hot from experience that tells me one thing . "SHES GONA VENT" so I ran out side and tossed it on the concrete incase it did. It was so hot you could barely touch it. Now this being not my first NOTE Oh no I have had ever galaxy from the first and every Galaxy NOTE there ever was . This was the last of the notes that Samsung made . I have a sneaking suspicion the problems. I encountered where designed into the phone ("Not the battery that came from a bad replacement ") . But the screen, the finger print and wacky random shut downs yes . I can not ever in good conscience recommend a NOTE 20 Ultra 5G to anyone ever again! THUMB DOWN !

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Great phone! I've always been on Verizon prepaid and it was so easy and simple putting my Sim card in and setting it up. It came with a sim tool and a charger. I bought one in excellent condition and it came as described just a few tiny scratches on the screen but you can't really tell at all and I'm very happy and pleased with this phone. It's so beautiful and so far haven't had an issue with it! If it does I will definitely come back on here and put it in my review but hopefully all continues to go well. It's pretty fast loading and so far no battery issues whatsoever. I bought a case for mine just because I don't want to chance anything but overall this phone is fantastic and I would definitely buy it again! It came 2 days earlier than expected and I would definitely recommend this seller to anyone! I had a note 8 for years and always wanted this note 10 plus and I can't tell you how happy I am with it!

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: I don't want to speak too soon... I've only had it for half a day. This phone IS renewed, meaning there's always a chance that a problem may pop up and just hasn't yet. If it does happen, I will update the review... HOWEVER... So far, no issues. The condition listed for mine was "new", and from what I can tell, it definitely was. I don't see any scratches or dents or anything. It makes me wonder what part of it was "renewed". It really does feel like a brand new phone, other than obviously not coming in the original packaging. It fast charges and wirelessly charges fine. The screen is bright and works as it should. The S Pen does its job flawlessly. If you are considering purchasing, I cannot speak for all the sellers, but this one was great. Shipped on time. Keep in mind that this IS renewed, so it will not come in the original box or with the original charger. Mine came with a Motorola power box, but hey, it does the job! When the Galaxy Note 10 Plus first came out, it was $1100. I got this basically brand new one for $300 in 2024. Zero complaints here. This flagship phone is an absolute legend and holds its own even though it's like 4-5 years old. It's got a better camera, more storage and RAM, and so many more other features that my lower-end modern 2024 phone had for the same price. Everyone is always obsessed with "brand-new", when really they should worry about the quality, overall value, and lifespan of their devices instead!

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: This was really the first 'big' purchase I have made so far, aside from my car. I have been using an absolutely rallied Galaxy 8+ since highschool.  And let me say, what an upgrade! I did a lot of review reading on both under this phone, and the sellers that partner with Amazon Renewed to sell it. My Galaxy 8 was renewed, the first one didn't charge, sent it back and got the one I kept, but headphone jack never worked. In a so far successful attempt to avoid something like that with this phone, I decided to order through Edge Cellular, since they had the most positive response. And I'm so happy I did! First of all, I got the phone in FOUR days, including the day I ordered it and the day it arrived. I live in Alaska, so that's practically unheard of.  The only way I could tell this phone was not brand new, was two extremely minor surface scratches on the back, which is obviously expected. And the S Pen had a tiny bit of white paint on it, that wiped right off. Other then that, the phone was pristine, not even a fingerprint, until I picked it up. It started right up, charges perfect, it's unlocked, the S Pen works, battery life is basically stagnant if it's not being used, and it's absolutely beautiful. I don't have any complaints so far, it has been almost two weeks since I received the phone. If that changes, I will update my review :)

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Brilliant phone. Still using it till today and not looking for an upgrade anytime soon. Phone was in near perfect condition

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Great value for the money you pay. What comes in the box?? Mine came in a sketchy looking white box but contained a fancy shaped sim injector, cheap cable (not Samsung), and a cheap charger block (also not Samsung). The phone did have plastic peels on the screen, camera setup, sensors, and around the edges of the phone. I tested every last one of the sensors in the phone.with the built in number you can dial in the phone app. S pen feels great but the latency of this generation is definitely not the perfect smoothe experience, though that is not to blame the manufacturer. BATTERY! the battery life is Amazing. Some days it will go all day on a single full charge, but on occasion it will rapidly die faster than expected. If your getting this to play games on it then I have really good news for you. This phone can and will plow through max graphics 60fps call of duty mobile, plays apex legends mobile smoothly, genshin impact also runs well. Screen wise The screen is nice and bright, very colour accurate compared to my galaxy a10e LED panel. The note 10+ has a 91% screen to body ratio. Meaning most of the phone is screen. The screen itself is an AMOLED/oled display, really dark colours and blacks are at their best here. Screen curves do not impose too much accidental touches. Screen didn't arrive with a single mark. The display automatically uses either 1080p or (3/4) 4k It comes with 256 gb of storage (I love) and 12 gb of ram (hardly ever uses 6) Price So for what after about 2 or 3 months of using this, I would say that the normal $799.99 hefty price tag one of these note 10+ cost in store let's renewed prices shine bright. For saving about $300 you will not regret purchasing this. Now it is on its last leg for security updates and further android updates, but android with one UI version 4.1 is all it needs. Finger print reader and facial recognition are nice.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: First one I bought was sold as "like new" refurbished. Outside it looked like new but sound quality of phone was distorted and staticky unless the headphones were connected. Contacted seller and they exchanged it with a different phone with no issues. I had a replacement in 2 days. I have no complaints with the replacement. It looks and performs like a brand new phone. The screen is super touchy but once I put a case on it that took care of that issue. I'm not one that needs the latest version or a super expensive phone so this one was perfect for what I paid for it. It was unlocked and compatible with Cricket Wirelss so all I had to do was swap out the SIM card from my old phone and I was up and running. Lots of storage and I LOVE the stylus that comes with it...it does some really cool things! Would highly recommend to anyone who just wants a decent phone without an outrageous price tag.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: I just got mine four days ago today and may I say I was SUPer skeptical but I have been impressed from day one. My phone connected to everythinh wit b out a problem. My phone chip installion wasnt a problem. Everything about this phone is pretty great. The phone itself is glass so I got a case immediately. I wanted to wait a few days before I did a review just so I could get a good feel and I am thoroughly impressed. The only thing is the finger scanner is not as good as some other phones but that's okay because of the abundance of other features so I really don't mind. I would definitely recommend so far! Later on down the line I will update this comment with how things are going. I will also share photos later as well.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: I just received my phone in the mail today. I LOVE this phone. I have much newer Sansung model as well but I wanted a second phone and I bought this one because I love the camera on it so much. There is a super wide angle that my newest model doesn't have. The portrait mode also seems to be better for some reason.
