title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: 1. Fast shipping A+ 2. Note10+ looks pristine A+ 3. Works on Verizon (unlocked). Just added Sim & works. A+ (came in AT&T box, was confused at 1st glance) 4. Battery in great condition. A+ Cons: the battery came completely drained & took a few minutes to respond after it was plugged in. I imagine this is why fast charging didn't work at first. To fix not fast changing, charge to 100% let the battery drain a bit 80%, with the phone unplugged from power, then flip the fast charging toggle a few times, finally leaving it on, in battery settings. Then press volume down & power at same time for 10 seconds to force shutdown. (you may have to change power button preferences from Bixby to Power button in settings. Mine was set to Bixby upon arival). Power on phone, plug in "fast charge" QC 3.0 capable cord & CHARGER to phone. Fast Charging fixed. Next step was to fix the wifi from intermittently turning off. In settings, go to "connections" then "wifi", click "3 dots" top right, select "advanced". Make sure 'Switch to mobile data" is turned off. Go back to "settings" main menu, scroll down to & select "General management". Once inside select "Reset". Finally "Reset Network Settings". It'll explain that wifi, mobile data, & Bluetooth hardware will be reset to factory settings if u continue to "RESET SETTINGS", click it. Restart phone, reconnect ur wifi & fixed. (It was probably the 10 updates that screwed wifi hardware settings). But now all is perfect & running as should be & I don't fault the seller for the wifi issue. Although, the fast charge not working is most likely due to seller shipping drained battery. All in all, great purchase & value Note10+ 12GB ram 256GB storage.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Seller: Snergy Order Date: March 19th, 2022 Order price @ Time of purchase: $419 **The phone arrived arrived a few days after it's scheduled delivery date. Though the status of it was updated alongside actual package arrivals/departures so that was fine. Unboxing: Opening the unoriginal boxing the phone came in; It arrived in a plastic bag within a white cardboard box. The phone shipped with unoriginal wall adapter/brick & cable. And none of the OEM accessories like the AGK headphones nor an actual SIM Card Removal Tool. It came with a paperclip instead. Outside Impressions: â€¢ The phone was impressive lighter than my Note 9, which this phone was replacing. I noticed the weight difference immediately. â€¢ I inspected the rear glass and was blown away by the this color: Aura Glow. The finish and how well it captured light and reflected objects in its glass was and is still great. â€¢ The camera system was without damage or scratches. â€¢ However the metal frame of the phone at the bottom had deep grooves of scratches from a hard drop it seemed. It can be felt with hand and enough depth to catch on smooth surfaces. Damages were along the sides as well. â€¢ The build felt solid in hand, when I didn't focus on the damages from the past user. Study but light. Took some time to get used to. â€¢ The Screen was huge. 1440x3040 that can be turn down if you are concerned about batteyr life. Bigger screen to body ratio than my Note 9 as well while not bigger much larger in its actual dimensions for me. I have fairly large hands. What troubled me mostly was the damaged screen. It had a noticeable gouge in the screen towards the top right 1/4 of the display that simply could not be ignored. It was easily felt under thumb and finger and even visible with screen off/on. **I returned the phone asking for a refund as it was beyond regular wear and tear use. Synergy gave me NO problem whatsoever with this. And emailed me within a few hours to a day that they will process a full refund upon receiving the product back. I did pay shipping back for the device. I was disappointed with that however I am happy with Synergy's customer support even though my product was not as it should have been. It gives me confidence to purchase with them in the future as good customer service is hard to come by today. The only issues where the damages that I saw and tested the phone As for today, 4/14/22: I have ordered a new Note 10+ 512GB version this review is based on the good working device I received and couldn't be happier with the device itself outside of the features it loses from the Note 9. The Note 9 was truly the last no compromise Smartphone of the Era. So i wouldn't call the Note 10+ an upgrade > Note9(N9) as much as I would say a Left-Right change of features for the user.. â€¢ Fingerprint scanner: In screen fingerprint sensor.. While consistent in my use, it is slow to read even with developer mode enabled. â€¢ Face Scanner: To make up for the "poor" speed of the FP scanner I make use of the face scanner feature to unlock the phone. This isn't the same as the Iris Scanner from the Note 9 (N9) and it is not as secure as the Iris Scanner but to serves my needs the same and is faster than the finger print scanner and faster than the Note 9 Iris scanner (both have .5 animation speed in developer settings). â€¢ The features of the S Pen are nice but I haven't explored them all. I do consistently use it for various tasks and apps and signing documents and editing. â€¢ Camera is very good. MANY settings in the pro mode and many camera modes itself. I use GCam myself. Big improvement I believe. â€¢ Still testing battery life as the phone learns user usage to better optimize battery will update â€¢ Phone calls are clear and good. â€¢ Speakers are impressively loud as well. I'm glad because I watch videos/play music (Netflix/Crunchyroll/Spotify) often. Bottom firing speaker and earpiece speaker sound good to the ear. Snapdragon chip, fast and 12gb of ram. No lag and running andriod 12, running 4.1UI but I have a launcher that I find suits my needs better. You won't be made at this phone in 2022. I only upgrade, at most, every three years unless phone is stolen/loss/damaged outside warranty. Definitely happy with the huge screen, faster chip, S Pen, SD card slot (fitted with a 1TB  PNY) and factory unlocked.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Phones were fully unlocked. The ba There on one of the phones isn't the best and edges had some signs of wear.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: God bless you guys for getting me a phone delivered in less than 12 hours since I dropped my note 10 and shattered the screen! I ordered an aura glow to match my previous note 10 but was delivered a silver. Oh well, those cost more anyways. It came with a screen protector which was ironically the first thing I did this time. Everything seems to be working seamlessly. Thank you!!!!! Also the pen that came with it is blue. I saw someone else complain in a review about that but oh well I hardly use it anyways, plus who doesn't like blue? 4 stars because I don't like silver lol. Now my phone matches my husband's but that's alright! One flesh and now one phone style ðŸ˜‚

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Bought the phone from Chubbiestech back in July 2022. Phone arrived in near perfect condition besides some scuffs and scratches on the S-Pen. Also, the S-Pen didnâ€™t work when i received the device. Not sure what it was but the phone wouldnâ€™t recognize the S-Pen. Reached out to Amazon who then contacted the vendor and they send me out a replacement that worked perfectly. Everything was fine until a week ago, Wednesday night. Took the phone off the charger and used it that night and everything worked fine. Put the phone down to go to sleep, woke up the following morning and the phone wouldnâ€™t turn on, wouldnâ€™t charge or anything. Looked up Youtube videos and tried pressing the power button and volume up and down buttons for 15seconds but no dice. Reached out to Amazon and was able to return it and get a refund even though it was out of warranty but Amazon rep said i couldnâ€™t get full refund but still got something back as it stopped working within the first year. Think i paid a bit over $300 including shipping and taxes and got refunded about $260. So, not bad but really intended to keep this phone. Overall pretty pleased with the phone, unfortunate that it blacked out on me within the first year but will be getting another Note 10 plus. Would highly recommend even in 2023.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: This is the 2nd Note 10+ I purchased from this Seller. Both phones appear and work like NEW.  Although they are "unlocked" for use with most carriers this phone (my 2nd purchase) is an AT&T branded phone and is loaded with AT&T's typical "bloatware" which cannot be removed without "rooting the phone" which I do not intend to do. I bought this phone for my wife and she really doesn't care about the bloatware since she really only uses a dozen or so apps. The phone has ample internal memory, 256 gb, along with 12 gb of ram this phone is powerhouse compared to her old phone (a Galaxy Note 4). She is happy and when "Momma's happy I'm happy". Commenting on both of the Note10+ phones I've purchased from this seller I can honestly say there was NO HINT ANYWHERE that either phone was "renewed" except for the generic white box they came in. They looked BRAND NEW. I watched comparison reviews of the Note 10+ vs. the Note 20 + prior to purchasing these phones and the thumbs up went to the Note 10+.  and the cost was less than 1/2  of a new Note 20+  The only other minor issue is the fingerprint readers aren't very reliable. These phones were a good fit for what we needed and this seller did everything right. I WOULD recommend to my friends.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: The phone came pretty much as good as new. The only thing that gave it away was that I could tell it had a phone cover on it by looking at the dirt/marking around the camera lens. If the phone was cleaned properly I wouldn't have been able to tell it apart from a brand new phone. If you are wondering if the Note 10+ is good for you or not here is what I've found so far. Productivity wise it's amazing, it makes doing a lot of "phone things" easier. If your number priority is a great camera this one will disappoint you. I don't know what Samsung did but the camera in my opinion is terrible. I wouldn't use it to post on Instagram(Maybe a story) But other than that it's really great, charges really fast especially if you get the original 25w charger. The charger that was included was terrible and made a weird buzzing noise, so definitely purchase the Samsung 25w charger. Summary: An amazon renewed phone comes like new, the Note10+ is amazing at being a phone but terrible with taking pictures and videos.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: I absolutely love the holographic/reflective back, doesn't have a scratch anywhere on it. The storage capacity is nice, the camera quality is awesome but the s pen doesn't connect. It doesn't have a whole lot of customizable settings but it's a pretty phone with good storage and nice graphics.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Impressed with shipping arriving a day early but renewed is a bit different refurbished. The phone overall is a great phone but there are used qualities for example the volume buttons sticking, gashes, and cuts in the phone. The back of the phone has been glued back together and started to separate also. Overall the phone itself is amazing but the quality is definitely 4 out of 5 giving the benefit of the doubt.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: The s pen keeps disconnecting. Guessing because it's a 3rd party replacement. Occasionally the bottom speaker will stop working and only the top one will work. The only way to get it to start back is if you playing music and you get a notification. Sometimes when the s pen disconnects the touch stops working. Little things here and there is the reason I'm returning it. But Customer service is great. Reply fast and are really helpful. That's why I gave it 4 stars and not 3. But if you can get past the little things the phone looked perfect. No blemishes. Camera worked and looked great. Literally looked brand new.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: I am loving the size and responsiveness with this phone! However, I hardly use my phone, but battery only lasts one day, recharge every evening when about 25%.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: It works almost as good as new but every night and sometimes throughout the day I get alerts of the stylus being ejected when I haven't removed or touched it. The stylus that came with the phone did have a bent, unresponsive tip. My old phones' stylus was fine so I switched them out. There are times where apps crash or freeze but I'll take that over the issues I had with my last phone, which prompted this replacement. It was easy to setup. The phone did come with all the needed parts including a charger and sim card removal tool. The phone was blemish free other than the broken stylus tip. I didn't have any issues getting my data and service transferred over.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: The specific phone I bought, from the specific vendor, had no original parts. When I needed a new screen, the technician showed me the internals, it explained a lot about how oddly it behaved. I love the Note series, and wish they were still making them. (no, the new iteration is not an improvement, for my needs.)

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Phone is either getting warm when not in use, or the stylist isn't reading even when it's in the phone. Touch screen is going in and out where it won't read when I scroll or unlock the phone. Never had any problems with my previous note

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.

The thing that I am NOT HAPPY about it that I have to charge it a couple times a day. The charge runs down real quick. That's the problem with used or refurbished phones.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Seller was - CELLULAR GALLERY INC I love the phone, Looks great - no major scratches and it works really good for the most part, the face recognition doesn't always work 100% but it works most of the time.  I didn't however get the proper S pen with this phone.  My phone keeps asking me to connect the S pen via Bluetooth and it wont connect  because it doesn't appear to be the Bluetooth version of the S pen, like i should have received.  I can use it on the phones screen but i have none of the other features i should be getting with on the Note 10 Plus, like camera control with the pen and air motion control w/ the pen.  I am disappointed that I paid a good amount of money for this phone and it didn't come with the proper parts.  Just be aware if you purchase from this seller they may cheap out on the kind of pen the SHOULD provide that actually came with this version of phone.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: I am mostly enjoying my 'renewed' Note 10+ and I particularly love the amazing iridescent color. The phone is so lovely I don't want to use a case but for protection I use a thin clear case which is close to the sleek uncovered experience. I wish they'd stop with the curved screen on the Note line, it is frustrating to use the edges and tougher to protect. I appreciate it is running smoothly with Android 11 and I just upgraded to the Android 12 final beta. I do wish Samsung hadn't abandoned their VR Gear products because I enjoyed them and bought headsets and controllers which are now useless. I may still exchange or return the Note 10+ before the 90 day period because I've been annoyed by the speaker often causing the phone to vibrate in an unpleasant way even at medium volume. Also, since switching to it, a number of videos have refused to play correctly, instead showing jagged lines and I can't find anything online about the issue so I am suspecting a memory issue. Overall I love the Note series and I think the Note 10+ is a great phone, especially if I can get these few issues resolved.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: This phone has a face scanner not a fingerprint reader just to be clear. It works half the time and you need to be in a lit room for it to work properly. The phone is a relatively fast hand-me-down but I'm not impressed with the battery charging time on this phone. If you're using it heavily while charging it's aggravatingly s l o w . But it holds charge for half the day or more and does well once fully charged. The signal isn't the best but that might be the carrier's fault. The phone has an impressive amount of space and I'm happy that it's even more expandable with an SD card slot. I bought the phone for a petty reason- the holographic back casing, lol. It's gorgeous and rainbow reflective. But I'm still impressed by the way it handles. It's better to type and hold with two hands but some tasks can be handled with one. The cameras work great. The main cam lens has stability which is neat.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Phone came and looked really nice, everything seem to work but my data. My phone company was able to to turn it on manually, then out of nowhere it stops working again, this time my company is not able to get my data to work. Text and calls work but thats about it unless I have wifi. Probably not a legitimate company refurbishing the phones. When I received my phone I also noticed it did not even feel the same in weight as my old one, so probably cheaper materials.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: This was advertised as in excellent condition; but when I got it and started to transfer my data over, the USB C did not work for data. It did work for charging. So, I had to find other ways to transfer my data such as NFC, etc. But, when I was done after spending four hours of my time to get everything set up, the device did not work in my car for navigation; again, because the USB C did not work for data. It was a pain to try and set up, going back and forth researching for solutions on YouTube, etc. And then, it was working one moment and not the other. So, I gave up. Went back to my old phone which worked fine but the screen colors had dimmed a bit.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: It's a nice phone, but the one I got, the volume button is completley dead despite getting a "renewed" phone. Can't get a new one without my data disapearing nor could I get a refund.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Was really excited to get a new 10 after mine stopped taking a charge. A few things I noticed with my new 10, it didn't like my SD card, so most of my photo memories are gone. Especially of my mom who just recently passed. My S-pen is damaged, both the pen itself and the indicator when I plug my phone in to charge. I constantly have to fight with the brightness level a few times a day. Any email, private message gets to me a few days late. This was not a problem with my previous 10, so I'm a bit annoyed. Now to make this phone work til I can get a new one that isn't broken from day 1.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: The phone overall was good, looked new even. The battery life wasn't the best and it did heat up but the main problem and reason why I won't be using Amazon renewed again is because who would've guessed, the phone is locked. At first, I didn't mind all too much and figured I could simply unlock it with the resources given, nope. I've called customer support 3 times, went to a store, basically just wasted a lot of time to finally be told it can't be unlocked. Disappointed but as long as I get my refund and rid of this mess, then whatever.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: When I see refurbished, I see a product that will pass by Company standards as almost new because of the testing it goes through. Had I known I was purchasing a phone that was very well loved so much that Tik Tok is burnt into the screen, I would have flat out put the 1500 down on a brand new Note model. This is ridiculous,  but considering I'm close to an upgrade, I'll just deal with what I have for another month. It was a rip off considering the condition of the screen burned images, otherwise everything else works fine.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Wireless charging does not work and makes a concerning crunching noise when pressing down on the screen just above the fingerprint sensor.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Had the phone 2 days. Was in my pocket at my desk job and glass broke. I suspect they are refurbished with less then satisfactory glass, because OEM glass for this phone it a 300 dollar expense. they accepted return and denied once received leaving me in an awkward position and using auto reply support that sends one message a day. Would not purchase from them again and wouldn't purchase this phone again because of the horrendous glass replacement cost.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: This phone is great. I bought one came amazing. Still using it as I'm typing this. Bought another for my bf and it came with black dots on the screen. (Dead spots) they didn't make it easy to return and I don't have a car. Had to take ubers to even go to the return place. Then took about a month and a half to refund me the credits. So bf was with no phone for a whole month and a half because his broke hence why I ordered this to be here in 3 days lol then they tell me to get a refund I must return the broken phone first. Would be fine if I now wasn't 270 dollars down until a month and a half so to get a new phone for the mean time would've been crazy and a waste of money. Nobody will steal a broken phone. Even version gives you a lender when they mess up. That's insane they expect you to have no phone nor ur money back in a timely manner lmao. Rude customer service as well. Not a discount or even a thank you for previously buying a phone from them and giving a nice review.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: I ordered this product expecting it to come with factory settings, but it's asking for a PIN code from the previous user, and I can't format it either because it's asking for the previous user's email account.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: This phone (Note 10+ 256GB) was purchased as a present. Since the seller was listed as Amazon Renewed Store,  I thought it would be a legitimately safe purchase, boy was I wrong. The phone itself came very nicely without any cosmetic damage with a new cord and generic charger. After installing SIM card from my phone carrier (Cricket), the phone show that it connected to the network. I was able to play around with it and use my data to download some apps. But then something odd happened, my mom complains to me later that day to say she was not able to call me and instead heard a recording that simply said "this caller cannot be reached". So I tried calling her, instead, it immediately goes straight to my carrier's customer service line. They ask what I need and I explain how I have new phone and I switched my SIM card to the Note 10+ and that I cannot make or receive calls, but I can use my data. She asks me to give the phone's IMEI number and looks it up. Before telling me what's up, she asks me in a curious tone how I obtained the phone in the first place, which I tell her I purchased it on Amazon. She then informs me that the phone itself is blacklisted from all networks because the phone was reported STOLEN and that it is impossible to make it usable. Darn, so much for that...

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Loved type of phone 2nd in six months but recived broken purchased from amazon renued progam. In exellent condition sad when arived broken under the program ut says refund with in 7 days of return but had to spend over 8 hrs on phone with amazon about my refund even thoughit was recived i had to wait for over 40 days and still no refund was to they would refund and could not fux issue for minumum if 30 daya then 7 plus days after that all i wanted was a good phone replaced but cant get the money back to puchase other phone from here so if its a good phone great deal but if you have to return item super bad deal very tough to recive refund even though the advertise 7 days afer returned not true amazon billed me right away but kept my money during refund guess they were just useing my money to draw interest on there account im a disabled veteran and coyld not affourd to just buy another right away so just out money and phone 45 plus days reported to the attourney general decptive business practices and could not speak to any one in America at all know matter who or what manager out of country i spoke to ripping of a army veteran way to do business jeff/ amazon

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: I just got this phone in the mail. Came with a charger that gets burning hot smells like burnt plastic, should've been a red flag but I still gave the phone a chance. I open the phone to multiple scratches, okay cool I know its used at least its not cracked. I go through the process of turning it on following the instuctions and it still tells me its a Verizon phone. Okay, maybe I have to go through manually and do the IMEI number, THE PHONES IMEI NUMBER IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH MY CARRIER!?!  But its suppose to be a FULLY UNLOCKED phone!?! The packaging was terrible to begin with. A rolled up paper ball on one side, then it looks like the charger was just thrown in the box along with the phone with a piece of bubble wrap that didnt cover the entire phone. This is the second time ive tried ordering a phone on amazon for it to not work correctly because it was never fully unlocked. Returning it tomorrow morning as it was packaged. I took a video of myself unboxing everything and putting back in the box to avoid them refusing a refund. If you areba verizon user buy this phone its perfect for your carrier but dont do it for another carrier. That is all.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Id love to say this was a great experience but it was not.. The phone arrived with a deep gouge on the screen which was very noticeable.. if this was just a surface scratch I probably could deal with it being a renewed phone. It is so deep I can catch my finger on it as I move across the screen. Tried to return for replacement and have been asked to jump through hoops.. Seller asked for "many pictures" of packaging ect. Said we would have to Put in a  claim with the carrier (shipper), and they had no resolution otherwise.. Reviews for this seller seem to be pretty good overall so I'm thinking I got an outlier when it comes to the quality of phone I received. That being said, with the guarantee you see at the bottom of the page trust me, if you have a problem it's not as easy as just returning the phone. You will be required to do extensive work to get a replacement if you get one at all. I'm still waiting.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: I purchased a renewed Samsung Galaxy Note 10+ from Bayshine Trading US, and it arrived defectiveâ€”the screen had a frozen image stuck in the background. I contacted the seller immediately, expecting a resolution, but they refused to take any responsibility and hid behind the expired 90-day renewed warranty. A renewed product should work properly upon arrival, but this seller clearly sells faulty devices and avoids accountability. Their customer service is terrible, and they refuse to issue refunds or replacements even when they sell you a broken item. I highly recommend avoiding this seller at all costs. Save yourself the frustration and buy from a more reputable seller instead. Amazon should reconsider allowing them to sell on this platform!

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Phone arrived powering down at 15% battery life. A full charge gives 4 hour charge at most. Sometimes 100% will jump to 12-15% in minutes. Buyer beware of this vendor. I am stuck with this POS.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: I bought this phone for my wife in late January.  It was okay for about 2 months then It kept losing connection to the S pen that come in it. And it started slowing down about a month later and today 5-18-25 the screen quit working.  And of course the it is out of the 90 day return policy! This is the second time we have had problems with Amazon refurbished products.  We will not be purchasing anymore Amazon renewed products.

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, 256GB, Aura Glow Silver - Fully Unlocked (Renewed) Fully Unlocked cell phone.
reviews: Didn't come with instructions, any protective accessories, was also locked and in mandrin or some other Asian language and i couldn't get it to factory reset or turn off so I'm assuming the buttons are messed up as well. Not happy, i spent my whole paycheck on this phone just for it to not work.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22+ Plus 5G, US Version, 256GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung S22+ 256GB Phantom Black Unlocked (Renewed)
reviews: Perfect phone for a slight upgrade, got it as a gift for my mom after her previous s21 ultra stopped working. Similar performance yet feels smoother and has more software support. Great camera and processor keeps up with everything my mom does on the job and at home or when she goes out. Great price, sleek look, and perfect for anything you need.

title: Samsung Galaxy S22+ Plus 5G, US Version, 256GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung S22+ 256GB Phantom Black Unlocked (Renewed)
reviews: Didn't trust other third party sellers so I bought this directly from Amazon renewed (ship/sold by amazon). It was a bit more expensive than what other resellers were offering but the quality insurance is definitely there. The phone came in a brand new box and the phone was in like new condition with no physical wear whatsoever. This thing must have been sitting for awhile as it wasn't updated to ONEUI 8.0 - but I appreciate that it wasn't as that was the reason why I bought it. Samsung removed a feature on ONEUI 7.0 and up where you could use all your apps on your phone on a windows pc, windowed, (mobile games, etc) and control it with the windows mouse/keyboard. So yeah, it met my needs perfectly - ONEUI 6.1 allows me to use this feature and i got a new device, thank you amazon!

title: Samsung Galaxy S22+ Plus 5G, US Version, 256GB, Phantom Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Samsung S22+ 256GB Phantom Black Unlocked (Renewed)
reviews: I'll come back to this review every once in a while as I continue to use the phone. EDIT2: 7/9/2023 Okay the line is not going away after locking and waking the phone like it did before. You can see in the second picture, it's faint, but it's there (ignore the orange glow, that's from my old s7 that can't take pictures of other screens without struggling). The fact that it wouldn't go away makes me think it's getting worse. I had to restart it this time to make it disappear. Went ahead and started the refund process because it seems like it's getting worse. Unfortunate because this was labeled as an excellent condition phone too. I guess it's hit or miss what you get when you buy refurbished. I'm not a phone repairman, so I'm not going to be able to open it up and figure it out. I'm just gonna refund this and get a different phone to avoid the problem happening again. EDIT: Okay, it's been 4 days since the review. Woke this morning and unlocked my phone, typical. Was adjusting notification volume settings then all of a sudden BAM, bright PINK (not green this time) line right through the same spot as usually from top to bottom of the screen. Wanted to take a picture with my old phone but was afraid of leaving the error on the screen for too long (was busy using restroom) so I locked the phone and unlocked it again and the line went away. Man... I might return this thing because this is scaring me. So far the phone has been pretty great. One thing's for sure though, it's crazy the difference (s7 to s22+) 2 oz of weight (including cases) can feel while holding it. This thing feels like I'm holding a brick compared to my old phone lol. All of these things that I am giving it accolades for are, of course, from a biased perspective of somebody who has used the s7 since it's launch, so take it with a grain of salt if you are coming from something like an s20 or later. Great/Solid battery, Great performance, Great visuals. Little heavy though. Those are the main points. Since it is refurbished, the only actual visible damage you can see well is the small scratch at the bottom left corner of the screen (as seen in picture) that is on the glass for a length of about 2mm and then goes off to the side a bit. Not a problem though, it's quite out of the way. Saving around $350 just to have a scratch on the screen is quite the deal. I make my phones last, so this thing is going to be built like a tank by the time I'm done putting protective layers and cases on it. (This is the reason for the 4/5 and not 5/5) So far my only real scare with this phone (purchased as an excellent condition renewed s22+ with 256gb storage from Macalegin Electronics) is, since I've received it as of June 29th, it's now July 3rd, it's had this very thin vertical green line from the top of the screen to the bottom of the screen 3 times upon waking the phone. Seems to really only happen when I wake the phone. If I see it again I'll try to take a picture with my old phone and add it to the review. First time it happened I kinda had a mini freak-out, thinking that this is the end of having this phone and I gotta return it before it's too late and it gets worse. If it does get worse and more frequent, then I will get the refund because that's unacceptable as an excellent condition phone. Some people online say that it is because of a loose connection from the motherboard to the screen panel (I don't know the actual technical lingo), usually caused by the phone being dropped. Well, it's "brand new" to me, so it wasn't me who dropped it. Either way, the phone is great except for that scare. To be honest though, I do miss my more compact and sleek phone designs. I do kinda wish I had gotten the s22 instead, but I wanted to see what it's like having a bigger screen. Well, we'll see as the years go by.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G, US Version, 128GB, Graphite - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 features a 6.7" foldable AMOLED main screen, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chip, 8GB RAM, 128/256/512GB storage, a dual 12MP rear camera system, a 10MP front camera, and a 3700mAh battery with 25W fast charging, all in a compact, IPX8 water-resistant design with a smaller 1.9" cover display.
reviews: This review is for the phone as well as the process of buying a Renewed item through Amazon. I purchased this phone because I could not find a phone that isn't massive but that still had the features and performance I require for daily use, so I decided to try this renewed Flip 4. The 90 day return policy and the great price convinced me to try it out. Not sure if I can name the seller in the review but I basically selected the phone in the best condition from the highest-rated seller fulfilled by Amazon. The phone arrived in blank packaging with a charging cable. It looks like there is a screen protector installed, plus there was a plastic film on top of the screen for packaging. It came half charged. The phone itself looks brand new. No detectable blemishes or signs of use. Hinge is nice and solid. Full charge was very fast (with fast charger). Setup fairly easy with Samsung transfer app but I am still missing a few passwords and accounts. I can manually add those later. There is a lot of bloatware from Samsung, plus carrier junk apps. (I think this is carrier unlocked- when I put my SIM it, it applied my carrier settings and apps.) Battery life (as expected-lots of info on this) is not great. I knew that going in. I am tracking battery usage throughout the day with different levels of use- screen open and closed, dormant or playing videos - and it seems as though this particular device doesn't deplete battery any more than would be typical for a phone this age. I suspect this particular phone was very gently used to begin with. Example: battery depleted about 10-15% overnight with no use, not plugged in. With heavier usage the battery use goes up to about 10% per hour. Not sure if there's anything I can adjust/disable to make this more efficient. My old phone would give me 1.5 to 2 days of a charge with regular use so this will be an adjustment. The screen is beautiful and easy to see. Samsung is an upgrade overall for me and I am pleased with how smooth it runs. Nice on-screen keyboard, etc. I am not tech savvy so there are probably too many customization options for me personally. I really just want a phone that works well for calls, that I can text on and use internet and maps periodically. This should do the job just fine. No SD storage and no headphone jack. I guess that's becoming customary. The device doesn't seem flimsy at all. That being said, I would get a case ASAP in the event of inadvertent drops - it happens. Signal and connection seem good, as does speaker quality. The fingerprint sensor is on the side near the volume buttons. Not sure I am crazy about this placement and it never registers the first time for me, but I think that's probably a user (me) problem. Overall I had a very good experience buying Renewed. Anyone who is interested in trying a flip smartphone, this is very economical option without a major commitment. I will update my review accordingly if, within 90 days, anything goes haywire on the device.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G, US Version, 128GB, Graphite - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 features a 6.7" foldable AMOLED main screen, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chip, 8GB RAM, 128/256/512GB storage, a dual 12MP rear camera system, a 10MP front camera, and a 3700mAh battery with 25W fast charging, all in a compact, IPX8 water-resistant design with a smaller 1.9" cover display.
reviews: I recently took the plunge and purchased this refurbished Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 to upgrade from my 2016 iPhone SE, and I must say, it has been nothing short of a revelation. This sleek and stylish foldable phone has managed to exceed all my expectations, offering a perfect blend of speed, economy, feature richness, and outstanding battery life. Let's start with the design. The Z Flip 4's compact form factor is not only a marvel to behold but also highly practical. The folding mechanism is smooth and precise, reflecting the cutting-edge engineering that Samsung is known for. The device fits perfectly in the palm of my hand when folded, and its slim profile easily slips into my pocket, making it incredibly portable. The speed of this device is nothing short of impressive. Powered by the latest hardware, including a snappy processor and ample RAM, the Z Flip 4 handles multitasking with ease. Apps launch quickly, and navigating through the interface is a seamless experience. Whether I'm streaming videos, playing games, or working on productivity tasks, the Z Flip 4 delivers a fluid and responsive performance. Economical in both price and energy consumption, the refurbished Z Flip 4 proves that sustainability doesn't have to come at the expense of performance. The refurbished model not only comes at a more budget-friendly price point but also contributes to reducing electronic waste, aligning with the growing demand for eco-conscious consumer choices. One of the standout features of the Z Flip 4 is its impressive array of capabilities. The camera system, for instance, captures stunning photos with vibrant colors and sharp details. The ability to flex the device at various angles unlocks creative possibilities for both photography and video recording. The flexibility of the foldable screen also enhances the overall user experience, allowing for innovative use cases in both entertainment and productivity. Speaking of the screen, the Z Flip 4's display is a visual treat. The vibrant colors and high resolution make watching videos or scrolling through social media an immersive experience. The durability of the foldable glass ensures that I don't have to worry about scratches or cracks, providing peace of mind in daily use. Now, let's talk about battery lifeâ€”a crucial aspect for any smartphone user. The Z Flip 4 excels in this department. The combination of a well-optimized operating system and a sizable battery ensures that I can go through a full day of heavy usage without worrying about running out of power. The quick-charging feature is an added bonus, providing a significant boost in a short amount of time. In conclusion, the refurbished Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 is a triumph in smartphone design and functionality. Its seamless folding mechanism, powerful performance, economical pricing, feature-rich capabilities, and impressive battery life make it a standout device in the crowded smartphone market. If you're in the market for a device that pushes the boundaries of innovation while being mindful of your budget and the environment, the Z Flip 4 is undoubtedly worth considering.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G, US Version, 128GB, Graphite - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 features a 6.7" foldable AMOLED main screen, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chip, 8GB RAM, 128/256/512GB storage, a dual 12MP rear camera system, a 10MP front camera, and a 3700mAh battery with 25W fast charging, all in a compact, IPX8 water-resistant design with a smaller 1.9" cover display.
reviews: TLDR: since the review is long: Don't get the Flip 4 renewed unless price is your motivation. Its last year's phone. The Razr 2023 is only $599 (cheaper on sale) and nearly identical. Or get a new Razr+ 2023 or Flip 5 instead. Battery life sucks on flip phones, so eliminating some of the battery usage going new instead of renewed is almost a necessity. Even if you go new, I'd still recommend getting a portable battery, like one that hangs off the USB-C port unless you plan on leaving the phone charging all day. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- I did not realize the Flip 4's screen is very soft plastic. I knew it was soft but I didn't think it was that soft. The one I received had a dent in it. Contacted seller and they gave me a $25 refund so I chose that since the dent wasn't that bad and I'll probably get used to it. I didn't want to return + repurchase and gamble. The outside notification screen is nice and serves its purpose. I installed GoodLock from the Samsung store and the MultiStar extension so I could use apps, mainly calculator, Spotify, Pandora, and Samsung Wallet (tap to pay) with the screen closed.  Using full apps (as opposed to the cover widgets) on the cover screen is a gimmick I probably won't use that often, but its nice to have that option. Sound quality of the speaker + earpiece (can do stereo) isn't as good as an S21, S21FE, or newer. Even my S10 Lite has better sound than the Flip 4, but that was expected due to small speaker and small earpiece. Battery health measured at 3595mAh out of 3700mAh (97%) and Amazon only requires 80% battery life. Although battery life is 97%, the battery life is abysmal , losing about 10% per hour while using the phone. I'll probably purchase a 5000mAh or higher hang off the USB-C port battery pack if I notice battery life is too low. Wireless charging is slow. It gets even slower when the phone is in use, like if you're watching something or listening to music.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G, US Version, 128GB, Graphite - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 features a 6.7" foldable AMOLED main screen, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chip, 8GB RAM, 128/256/512GB storage, a dual 12MP rear camera system, a 10MP front camera, and a 3700mAh battery with 25W fast charging, all in a compact, IPX8 water-resistant design with a smaller 1.9" cover display.
reviews: Edit: Broke in less than two years just from regular folding. Only the second half works. It's basically useless since I can't touch quick settings and notification bar. Original review: I bought this phone as soon as prices dropped. Things I like: - It's small enough to fit in pockets and purses. - Front (selfie) camera is higher quality than any android I've used. - Can use cover screen as a selfie mirror when taking photos with back camera. - On the cover screen I can easily read weather info, control music, and turn off upcoming alarms. - Can multi-task with split screen or pop-up screen. - Locked screen shows charging time. - Control panel shows battery % of Bluetooth devices. - Can automatically turn off phone to keep things running smoothly. Things I dislike: - Battery life isn't long. - Doesn't have a headphone jack. - Phone is slim and long. Hard to press things at the top. - Camera is very warm toned and saturated. - A lot of gaming apps haven't adapted to this screen ratio yet. - Cover screen can display the full SMS or IG message for two seconds when they're received, but once I try to toggle to the notifications slide, the message is kept private. - Fingerprint reader is too sensitive.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G, US Version, 128GB, Graphite - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 features a 6.7" foldable AMOLED main screen, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chip, 8GB RAM, 128/256/512GB storage, a dual 12MP rear camera system, a 10MP front camera, and a 3700mAh battery with 25W fast charging, all in a compact, IPX8 water-resistant design with a smaller 1.9" cover display.
reviews: This has been my second refurbished phone I have purchased from amazon, and the second in a row to have a major defect.  The first was a Samsung s20, which would reboot on its own around five to six times a day. And you wouldn't receive any notifications until you unlock the phone. This phone is awesome, but something with the built in antenna that receives the cellular connection is messed up. Sometimes I can call and sometimes I can not. Sometime my Sim card will show unknown or att or t-mobile. I used att, I've even tried an esim to rule out the Sim card. Will be trading this phone in to the att store for the new z flip five as they're doing a good deal for the trade in.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G, US Version, 128GB, Graphite - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 features a 6.7" foldable AMOLED main screen, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chip, 8GB RAM, 128/256/512GB storage, a dual 12MP rear camera system, a 10MP front camera, and a 3700mAh battery with 25W fast charging, all in a compact, IPX8 water-resistant design with a smaller 1.9" cover display.
reviews: Phone came in great at first, was loving it to death it's really cool phone. Worked flawlessly. It was my first galaxy, and I plan on getting a normal galaxy after this. The hinge is shockingly fragile, and I don't know if this is because it is a design flaw of the phone itself or because it's a refurb. A very short fall on that while the phone is closed and it's pretty much done for. It completely dislocated on one side and it would not open up all the way, looked decently repairable until the screen started dying. It eventually pinched the flexible screen and killed pixels. As far as I know there's no cases that protect the hinge. I was lucky to be within the 90 day return window or else I'd be forking over a lot of money in order to repair it :( I got a lot of compliments on it and I'm really sad to say goodbye to such a dope phone. But maybe later models will be less prone to damage.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G, US Version, 128GB, Graphite - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 features a 6.7" foldable AMOLED main screen, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chip, 8GB RAM, 128/256/512GB storage, a dual 12MP rear camera system, a 10MP front camera, and a 3700mAh battery with 25W fast charging, all in a compact, IPX8 water-resistant design with a smaller 1.9" cover display.
reviews: I bought different renewed products from Amazon but this time didn't end up very well. As soon as I turned it on it was showing green lines; which in a foldable phone is a really bad sign. Things got worst and worst as I set up the phone, to the point where the screen would go off and on as I was changing the folding position. At times the whole screen would get of a shade of green, which I never seen before to be honest. I could not even use it for few hours that these problems started to show up, so I just packed it back and returned it. Maybe it was a defective unit, maybe it was a coincidence but this is the second foldable from Samsung that ended up having problems, and I am not going to take the risk, as I already wasted 1K on a Z-Fold 4 last year. Maybe it is better to wait few more years for a foldable phone

description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 features a 6.7" foldable AMOLED main screen, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chip, 8GB RAM, 128/256/512GB storage, a dual 12MP rear camera system, a 10MP front camera, and a 3700mAh battery with 25W fast charging, all in a compact, IPX8 water-resistant design with a smaller 1.9" cover display.

Takes forever to charge, even with a fast charger and will start alerting me when it starts to overheat, which is often. I will start my day at 830am with 100% charge, by noon it is at 10-20%. I don't even understand how when I'm at work and not using it. I always close out my apps, clear cashes, optimize, lower my brightness etc ... doesn't help. I'm so confused. I had a note 9 for 5 years that has better battery life. That phone would go 2 days with extended use without needing a charge. I reached out to seller a few weeks ago, haven't heard back but will reach out again. It's been 2 months at this point, not sure if anything can be done.

I wish i could return this as it starts to cause problems after 1 year of usage. Stay away from flip phones, usability is not as facny as it looks. Durability is the problem Screensize is solid for such a thing phone, sound quality is meh and features are topnotch anyways since its samsung

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G, US Version, 128GB, Graphite - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 features a 6.7" foldable AMOLED main screen, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chip, 8GB RAM, 128/256/512GB storage, a dual 12MP rear camera system, a 10MP front camera, and a 3700mAh battery with 25W fast charging, all in a compact, IPX8 water-resistant design with a smaller 1.9" cover display.
reviews: I've only had my flip z 4 phone for 2.5 months and it's already of NO USE to me!  I was told by the Samsung office that the warranty on the phone expired before I purchased it and if I needed it fixed I would have to pay out of pocket to get the screen repaired.  I attached a photo of the phone which has a bleed that is growing wider every day.  The bleed started at the crease of the fold and got bigger and bigger.  BTW, I did not drop it!  It did not get wet! I only opened and closed as I used it.  This was a bad purchase!

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 5G, US Version, 128GB, Graphite - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4 features a 6.7" foldable AMOLED main screen, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chip, 8GB RAM, 128/256/512GB storage, a dual 12MP rear camera system, a 10MP front camera, and a 3700mAh battery with 25W fast charging, all in a compact, IPX8 water-resistant design with a smaller 1.9" cover display.
reviews: Up to today, the phone has never been dropped (on hard surfaces), looks brand new as if it came out of the box besides a very small blemish to the right of the camera lens. The color is beautiful and matches what is shown online. The phone was very responsive and quick for multiple tasks, it even worked well on Genshin Impact (the game) besides getting a little on the warm side. I paid $299.99 (plus $18.00 tax totaling $317.99) June 22 2024. The phones screen started peeling and shortly after turning into a black line 8-9 months of ownership. As of today, ~16 months of ownership the black line grew to cover ~1 inch varying in size across the middle of the screen. (The progression of the peeling over ~7-8 months) The black line and above no longer responds to touch, only can see display above the black line. Under the black line works as it should. The touch screen not working on the top was discovered as of yesterday. I'm not sure of how many total reports there have been of this model of phone but with my experiences I would consider a different phone and perhaps avoid all of the Galaxy Z Flip or Fold phones. If you do consider to buy a Flip or Fold phone and expect it to last quite a bit longer than the warranty, while still being reliable, I highly advise to do your research. Sharing the steps I've taken so far... I've contacted Amazon. Seems they cant do much as its after a year of when I'm reporting this. I left a voicemail to Chubbiestech, the seller, to see what they can do. I will give Samsung a try as well as this problem is from a design flaw, not wear and tear. I also taken multiple pictures and a video of the phone and the phone case purchased for the phone to show the condition of the phone (phone looks brand new besides the screen where it is peeling and some finger prints on the sides) I would post the video however it is too big in size. The pictures shown are the phone along with the phone case. The case is scratched up a bit on the bottom left corner, however this only caused a cosmetic flaw to the case purchased separately for the phone. The case did its job protecting the phone for normal use excluding drops as the phone has never been dropped on hard surfaces. I'm sure its been lightly tossed on the bed, dropped into a pocket, and placed into a purse with other items that most likely caused the cosmetic flaw on the case. The phone has only been open while in use, so only fingers and weather touched the screen. A screen protector has never been applied to the phone. This is the first time I've ever had trouble with a product design itself sold on the Amazon platform out of 86 items.

reviews: **Warning!** I purchased this phone because it was advertised as "unlocked" and included eSIM functionality. Initially, I only used a physical SIM card, so I didn't realize that the eSIM feature was disabled. When I reached out to the seller for assistance, their only response was, "90 days have passed, there's nothing we can do." All I wanted was to get it working! Essentially, if you don't notice any issues within 90 days, you're out of luck. Additionally, they misrepresent the product as unlocked and claim features that don't actually exist. Im stuck with a locked device!! And absolutely NO assistance from the seller since 90 days has been passed. From my experience, when you get the device, make sure it has Esim enabled and that is unblocked.

reviews: You might as well send me your money. This phone is crap. However I really liked it in the beginning. I purchaced it 12/18/24. Of course the return time was a few days past due so I lost my money. Of course this being refurbed, no one cares. Just to replace the Digitizer (screen) costs only a few $'s less than the price of the phone then you will have to labor to tear the phone down to repair it and on top of that it probably wouldnt work anyways. I lost a ton of data because of this and now have to buy and set up a new phone. Please check out the other reviews before you purchace the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 4. title: Samsung Galaxy S23 FE 5G, US Version, 128GB, Black - Unlocked (Renewed)
description: Introducing the Samsung Galaxy S23 FE SM-S711U, a marvel of modern mobile technology. Elevating your smartphone experience to new heights, this device seamlessly integrates power, performance, and style. With its sleek design and vibrant display, every interaction feels immersive and captivating. Capture life's moments in stunning detail with its advanced camera system, ensuring that memories are preserved with clarity and brilliance. Powered by cutting-edge hardware and intuitive software, the Galaxy S23 FE delivers smooth multitasking and effortless navigation, empowering you to do more, faster. Stay connected, entertained, and productive throughout your day with the Samsung Galaxy S23 FE.
reviews: This Samsung Galaxy S23 FE is my first Samsung phone after switching from Apple. I figured I'd get it refurbished in case I didn't like it. I really love this phone! It came in great condition, no visible damages. I transfered all of my data and photos from my iPhone to the S23 FE using a lightning to USB-C cable, which only took about an hour. The phone runs smoothly and has excellent battery life. It lasts me all day unless I'm doomscrolling. I got a Galaxy Watch that connected to this S23 FE using the Wearables app. People were saying that the phone gets hot, but it doesn't really. The only time it's felt hot is when I've had multiple apps running at once or had my brightness up. My only issue with it is that I couldn't sign into any Samsung apps or services for a few days. I even ordered a new one to replace this one, but the issue on this phone ended up resolving itself before I even got the replacement. I'd definitely recommend this phone. It came at a good price and is a super easy transition from a lifelong Apple user.

reviews: The Samsung Galaxy S23 itself is fantastic. The screen arrived in pristine condition, the battery life is excellent, and the speakers are loud and clear without distortion. For the price, this is a steal. The camera quality is out of this world. Pictures stay crisp even at +3x zoom. It really is a great phone and I haven't found a better price for it. One important note: the phone is locked to AT&T. Unlocking it for use with another carrier can be time-consuming and may cost extra. If you already use AT&T, this phone is an amazing deal. If you plan to switch carriers, be prepared for additional steps and costs. Honestly I would say not even worth it if you're going to switch carriers. If you plan to keep it with AT&T then I think this is one of the best deals. Overall, despite the carrier lock, the phone performs exceptionally well and I highly recommend it.

reviews: My 2nd Samsung cellphone and the first time I've purchased a refurbished phone of any type. Arrived reasonably promptly and as it is an unlocked phone all I had to do was switch the Sim card and add my Wi-Fi password to get good reception. The phone to all appearances is brand new. This is a midrange Samsung device and is priced reasonably for what it is. Be a bit careful during setup to prevent getting your data take by the various online companies. My only concern is battery life, however that will become clearer over the next months and with a 90 day return policy I will have the time test it out. You can get a one-year warranty by taking a photo of what I'm posting. MY only COMPLAINTS thus far is the failure to provide a website with CLEAR setup instructions that lets you know the pros and cons of the various options. ALSO the phone is difficult to turn off which is the biggest negative thus far.

reviews: I ordered a renewed Samsung S23FE from this company for my wife and noticed when un-boxing that the charging adapter was dented, and also that this was not a Samsung charger.  I was able to charge the phone after un-boxing so thought nothing of it. The next day I moved the SIM Card, contacts, calendar, pictures, etc.  Afterwards, I thought  I should re-charge the phone.  This time when charging, the phone would cycle off and on as if I had unplugged and re-plugged the charger back into a wall outlet.  Also, I noticed that when I touched the charger it was extremely hot as well.  "Very HOT." I grabbed my charger from my personal Samsung phone and the issue went away.  I then put the charger just received with the S23 on my phone and the same thing happedâ€¦ cycling on and off and extremely hot! I called Amazon and after explaining all the troubleshooting I had completed agreed the charger needed replaced.  They said I would receive an email from â€œthe Sellerâ€ as to next step. I received the belowâ€¦. SELLER REPLIED: Sorry to hear that youâ€™re having issue with charging. Here are some quick-fix you can try: 1. Turn off your phone and check the charging port for any dirt or debris (use a flash light if needed) 2. Use a slim toothpick or sim ejector, gently pick and remove any dirt you saw. 3. You may also try a different outlet / adapter / charging cable to find out if the problem is coming from the accessories. 4. Update the phone may help fix any glitches with the software preventing fast-charging. I then called Amazon back and they contacted the seller who said they couldnâ€™t replace the Adapter itself but that I would have to return the newly received S23 with the defective adapter and they would then send another S23 with a new adapter.  This doesnâ€™t seem a viable solution as Iâ€™d spent a large amount of time and effort moving the SIM Card, contacts, calendar, pictures, downloading apps, reestablishing user name and passwords, etc. I resolved to just purchase another charging adapter, but the Amazon associate took it a step farther and resolved the issue thru Amazon and not the seller.  What GREAT support Amazon gives!  What poor support options â€œthe Seller" gives.

reviews: Even though the phone looked great and was advertised as unlocked, I could never get it to work.  It would not read the SIM or ESIM provided by either company that I tried, and it took weeks and weeks and paying for phone plans through two different phone carriers for a month each paid up front to realize that the phone itself had some kind of flaw.  Both companies spent hours with me on the phone, trying repeatedly to get the phone I bought to talk to their system, as it was showing as compatible, but the phone itself kept saying to insert a SIM card, even though I tried three different physical SIM cards, , plus downloaded ESims from each company, and it just kept saying insert a SiM card.  Hundreds of dollars down the drain, plus an extra hundred in useless phone plans, and no way of finding out that it is actually a bad phone until it is too late to make a complaint, because it takes so long to get a SIM card from a phone company each time.  One of the techs said that it may be a cloned phone or from another country, or locked to a carrier, but sold as unlocked, but that they really had no idea what was wrong with it, just that they could find no way to get it to connect and talk to their system. The IMEI number loaded into it said that it was compatible each time, when they typed the number into their system, but when they tried to connect with an ESIM to get around the fact that the phone won't read a SIMP card, they got a message back saying that the phone was locked to a different carrier. Super disappointing purchase.
